department_management.question: How many heads of the departments are older than 56 ?
department_management.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM head WHERE age > 56

department_management.question: List the name, born state and age of the heads of departments ordered by age.
department_management.query: SELECT name ,  born_state ,  age FROM head JOIN management ON head.head_ID  =  management.head_ID JOIN department ON management.department_ID  =  department.Department_ID ORDER BY age

department_management.question: List the creation year, name and budget of each department.
department_management.query: SELECT Creation ,  Name ,  Budget_in_Billions FROM department

department_management.question: What are the maximum and minimum budget of the departments?
What is the average number of employees of the departments whose rank is between 10 and 15?
department_management.query: SELECT AVG(num_employees) FROM department WHERE ranking BETWEEN 10 AND 15

department_management.question: What are the names of the heads who are born outside the California state?
department_management.query: SELECT name FROM head WHERE born_state NOT LIKE 'California'

department_management.question: What are the distinct creation years of the departments managed by a secretary born in state 'Alabama'?
department_management.query: SELECT DISTINCT Creation FROM department AS T1 JOIN management AS T2 ON T1.Department_ID = T2.Department_ID JOIN head AS T3 ON T2.head_ID = T3.head_ID WHERE T3.born_state = 'Alabama'

department_management.question: What are the names of the states where at least 3 heads were born?
department_management.query: SELECT born_state FROM head GROUP BY born_state HAVING COUNT(*) >= 3

department_management.question: In which year were most departments established?
department_management.query: SELECT creation, COUNT(*) AS num_departments FROM department GROUP BY creation ORDER BY num_departments DESC LIMIT 1

department_management.question: Show the name and number of employees for the departments managed by heads whose temporary acting value is 'Yes'?
department_management.query: SELECT department.Name, department.Num_Employees FROM department JOIN management ON department.Department_ID = management.department_ID JOIN head ON management.head_ID = head.head_ID WHERE management.temporary_acting = 'Yes'

department_management.question: How many acting statuses are there?
department_management.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM management WHERE temporary_acting = true

department_management.question: How many departments are led by heads who are not mentioned?
department_management.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM department AS T1 LEFT JOIN management AS T2 ON T1.Department_ID = T2.Department_ID WHERE T2.head_ID IS NULL

department_management.question: What are the distinct ages of the heads who are acting?
department_management.query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.age FROM management AS T1 JOIN head AS T2 ON T1.head_ID = T2.head_ID WHERE T1.temporary_acting = true

department_management.question: List the states where both the secretary of 'Treasury' department and the secretary of 'Homeland Security' were born.
department_management.query: SELECT T1.born_state FROM head AS T1 JOIN management AS T2 ON T1.head_id  =  T2.head_id JOIN department AS T3 ON T2.department_id  =  T3.department_id WHERE T3.name  =  "Treasury" INTERSECT SELECT T1.born_state FROM head AS T1 JOIN management AS T2 ON T1.head_id  =  T2.head_id JOIN department AS T3 ON T2.department_id  =  T3.department_id WHERE T3.name  =  "Homeland Security"

department_management.question: Which department has more than 1 head at a time? List the id, name and the number of heads.
department_management.query: SELECT department.Department_ID, department.Name, COUNT(*) AS num_heads FROM department JOIN management ON department.Department_ID = management.department_ID GROUP BY department.Department_ID, department.Name HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

department_management.question: Which head's name has the substring 'Ha'? List the id and name.
department_management.query: SELECT head_ID, name FROM head WHERE name LIKE '%Ha%'

farm.question: How many farms are there?
farm.query: SELECT count(*) FROM farm

farm.question: Count the number of farms.
farm.query: SELECT count(*) FROM farm

farm.question: List the total number of horses on farms in ascending order.
farm.query: SELECT Total_Horses FROM farm ORDER BY Total_Horses ASC

farm.question: What is the total horses record for each farm, sorted ascending?
farm.query: SELECT Farm_ID, SUM(Total_Horses) AS Total_Horses_Record FROM farm GROUP BY Farm_ID ORDER BY Total_Horses_Record ASC

farm.question: What are the hosts of competitions whose theme is not "Aliens"?
farm.query: SELECT Hosts FROM farm_competition WHERE Theme <> 'Aliens'

farm.question: Return the hosts of competitions for which the theme is not Aliens?
farm.query: SELECT hosts FROM farm_competition WHERE theme <> 'Aliens'

farm.question: What are the themes of farm competitions sorted by year in ascending order?
farm.query: SELECT Theme FROM farm_competition ORDER BY Year ASC

farm.question: Return the themes of farm competitions, sorted by year ascending.
farm.query: SELECT Theme FROM farm_competition ORDER BY Year ASC

farm.question: What is the average number of working horses of farms with more than 5000 total number of horses?
farm.query: SELECT avg(Working_Horses) FROM farm WHERE Total_Horses > 5000

farm.question: Give the average number of working horses on farms with more than 5000 total horses.
farm.query: SELECT avg(Working_Horses) FROM farm WHERE Total_Horses > 5000

farm.question: What are the maximum and minimum number of cows across all farms.
farm.query: SELECT max(Cows), min(Cows) FROM farm

farm.question: Return the maximum and minimum number of cows across all farms.
farm.query: SELECT MAX(cows), MIN(cows) FROM farm

farm.question: How many different statuses do cities have?
farm.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Status) FROM city

farm.question: Count the number of different statuses.
farm.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Status) FROM city

farm.question: List official names of cities in descending order of population.
farm.query: SELECT Official_Name FROM city ORDER BY Population DESC

farm.question: What are the official names of cities, ordered descending by population?
farm.query: SELECT Official_Name FROM city ORDER BY Population DESC

farm.question: List the official name and status of the city with the largest population.
farm.query: SELECT Official_Name, Status FROM city ORDER BY Population DESC LIMIT 1

farm.question: What is the official name and status of the city with the most residents?
farm.query: SELECT Official_Name, Status FROM city WHERE Population = (SELECT MAX(Population) FROM city)

farm.question: Show the years and the official names of the host cities of competitions.
farm.query: SELECT Year, Official_Name FROM city WHERE City_ID IN (SELECT Host_city_ID FROM farm_competition)

farm.question: Give the years and official names of the cities of each competition.
farm.query: SELECT Year, Official_Name FROM city JOIN farm_competition ON city.City_ID = farm_competition.Host_city_ID

farm.question: Show the official names of the cities that have hosted more than one competition.
farm.query: SELECT Official_Name FROM city WHERE City_ID IN (SELECT Host_city_ID FROM farm_competition GROUP BY Host_city_ID HAVING COUNT(*) > 1)

farm.question: What are the official names of cities that have hosted more than one competition?
farm.query: SELECT official_name FROM city WHERE city_id IN (SELECT host_city_id FROM farm_competition GROUP BY host_city_id HAVING count(*) > 1)

farm.question: Show the status of the city that has hosted the greatest number of competitions.
farm.query: SELECT t1.Status FROM city AS t1 JOIN farm_competition AS t2 ON t1.City_ID  =  t2.Host_city_ID GROUP BY t2.Host_city_ID ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

farm.question: What is the status of the city that has hosted the most competitions?
farm.query: SELECT t1.status FROM city AS t1 JOIN farm_competition AS t2 ON t1.city_id  =  t2.host_city_id GROUP BY t2.host_city_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

farm.question: Please show the themes of competitions with host cities having populations larger than 1000.
farm.query: SELECT Theme FROM farm_competition JOIN city ON farm_competition.Host_city_ID = city.City_ID WHERE city.Population > 1000

farm.question: What are the themes of competitions that have corresponding host cities with more than 1000 residents?
farm.query: SELECT Theme FROM farm_competition WHERE Host_city_ID IN (SELECT City_ID FROM city WHERE Population > 1000)

farm.question: Please show the different statuses of cities and the average population of cities with each status.
farm.query: SELECT Status, AVG(Population) FROM city GROUP BY Status

farm.question: What are the statuses and average populations of each city?
farm.query: SELECT status, AVG(population) FROM city GROUP BY status

farm.question: Please show the different statuses, ordered by the number of cities that have each.
farm.query: SELECT Status, COUNT(*) FROM city GROUP BY Status ORDER BY COUNT(*) ASC

farm.question: Return the different statuses of cities, ascending by frequency.
farm.query: SELECT Status FROM city GROUP BY Status ORDER BY COUNT(*) ASC

farm.question: List the most common type of Status across cities.
farm.query: SELECT Status FROM city GROUP BY Status ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

farm.question: What is the most common status across all cities?
farm.query: SELECT Status FROM city GROUP BY Status ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

farm.question: List the official names of cities that have not held any competition.
farm.query: SELECT Official_Name FROM city WHERE City_ID NOT IN (SELECT Host_city_ID FROM farm_competition)

farm.question: What are the official names of cities that have not hosted a farm competition?
farm.query: SELECT Official_Name FROM city WHERE City_ID NOT IN (SELECT Host_city_ID FROM farm_competition)

farm.question: Show the status shared by cities with population bigger than 1500 and smaller than 500.
farm.query: SELECT status FROM city WHERE population > 1500 AND population < 500

farm.question: Which statuses correspond to both cities that have a population over 1500 and cities that have a population lower than 500?
farm.query: SELECT Status FROM city WHERE Population > 1500 INTERSECT SELECT Status FROM city WHERE Population < 500

farm.question: Find the official names of cities with population bigger than 1500 or smaller than 500.
farm.query: SELECT Official_Name FROM city WHERE Population > 1500 OR Population < 500

farm.question: What are the official names of cities that have population over 1500 or less than 500?
farm.query: SELECT Official_Name FROM city WHERE Population > 1500 OR Population < 500

farm.question: Show the census ranking of cities whose status are not "Village".
farm.query: SELECT Census_Ranking FROM city WHERE Status <> 'Village'

farm.question: What are the census rankings of cities that do not have the status "Village"?
farm.query: SELECT Census_Ranking FROM city WHERE Status <> 'Village' ORDER BY Census_Ranking ASC

student_assessment.question: which course has most number of registered students?
student_assessment.query: SELECT T1.course_name FROM Courses AS T1 JOIN Student_Course_Registrations AS T2 ON T1.course_id = T2.course_id GROUP BY T1.course_name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

student_assessment.question: What is the name of the course with the most registered students?
student_assessment.query: SELECT T1.course_name FROM Courses AS T1 JOIN Student_Course_Registrations AS T2 ON T1.course_id = T2.course_id GROUP BY T1.course_name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

student_assessment.question: what is id of students who registered some courses but the least number of courses in these students?
student_assessment.query: SELECT student_id FROM Student_Course_Registrations GROUP BY student_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) ASC LIMIT 1;

student_assessment.question: What are the ids of the students who registered for some courses but had the least number of courses for all students?
student_assessment.query: SELECT student_id FROM Student_Course_Registrations GROUP BY student_id HAVING COUNT(*) = (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Student_Course_Registrations GROUP BY student_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) ASC LIMIT 1)

student_assessment.question: what are the first name and last name of all candidates?

student_assessment.question: What are the first and last names of all the candidates?

student_assessment.question: List the id of students who never attends courses?

student_assessment.question: What are the  ids of every student who has never attended a course?
student_assessment.query: SELECT student_id FROM Students WHERE student_id NOT IN (SELECT student_id FROM Student_Course_Attendance)

student_assessment.question: List the id of students who attended some courses?

student_assessment.question: What are the ids of all students who have attended at least one course?

student_assessment.question: What are the ids of all students for courses and what are the names of those courses?

student_assessment.question: What is detail of the student who most recently registered course?
student_assessment.query: SELECT T1.student_details FROM Students AS T1 JOIN Student_Course_Registrations AS T2 ON T1.student_id = T2.student_id ORDER BY T2.registration_date DESC LIMIT 1

student_assessment.question: What details do we have on the students who registered for courses most recently?
student_assessment.query: SELECT T1.* FROM Students AS T1 JOIN Student_Course_Registrations AS T2 ON T1.student_id = T2.student_id WHERE T2.registration_date = (SELECT MAX(registration_date) FROM Student_Course_Registrations)

student_assessment.question: How many students attend course English?
student_assessment.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Students AS T1 JOIN Student_Course_Attendance AS T2 ON T1.student_id = T2.student_id JOIN Student_Course_Registrations AS T3 ON T2.course_id = T3.course_id JOIN Courses AS T4 ON T3.course_id = T4.course_id WHERE T4.course_name = "English";

student_assessment.question: How many students are attending English courses?
student_assessment.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT T1.student_id) FROM Student_Course_Registrations AS T1 JOIN Courses AS T2 ON T1.course_id = T2.course_id WHERE T2.course_name = "English";

student_assessment.question: What are the details of the student who registered for the most number of courses?

student_assessment.question: How many registed students do each course have? List course name and the number of their registered students?

student_assessment.question: For each course id, how many students are registered and what are the course names?

student_assessment.question: What are the cell phone numbers of the candidates that received an assessment code of "Fail"?

student_assessment.question: List the id of students who registered course statistics in the order of registration date.

student_assessment.question: List the id of students who attended  statistics courses in the order of attendance date.

student_assessment.question: What are the ids of the students who attended courses in the statistics department in order of attendance date.
student_assessment.query: SELECT T1.student_id FROM Student_Course_Attendance AS T1 JOIN Student_Course_Registrations AS T2 ON T1.student_id = T2.student_id JOIN Courses AS T3 ON T2.course_id = T3.course_id WHERE T3.course_name LIKE "%statistics%" ORDER BY T1.date_of_attendance ASC

bike_1.query: SELECT start_station_name, start_station_id FROM trip WHERE start_date LIKE '2014-08%' GROUP BY start_station_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: Which bike traveled the most often in zip code 94002?
bike_1.query: SELECT bike_id, COUNT(*) AS num_trips FROM trip WHERE zip_code = '94002' GROUP BY bike_id ORDER BY num_trips DESC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: What is the id of the bike that traveled the most in 94002?
bike_1.query: SELECT bike_id FROM trip WHERE zip_code = 94002 GROUP BY bike_id ORDER BY SUM(duration) DESC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: How many days had both mean humidity above 50 and mean visibility above 8?
bike_1.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT date) FROM weather WHERE mean_humidity > 50 AND mean_visibility_miles > 8

bike_1.question: What is the number of days that had an average humity above 50 and an average visibility above 8?
bike_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM (SELECT date, avg(mean_humidity) AS avg_humidity, avg(mean_visibility_miles) AS avg_visibility FROM weather GROUP BY date HAVING avg_humidity > 50 AND avg_visibility > 8) AS t1

bike_1.question: What is the latitude, longitude, city of the station from which the shortest trip started?
bike_1.query: SELECT s.lat, s.long, s.city FROM station AS s JOIN trip AS t ON s.id = t.start_station_id ORDER BY t.duration ASC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: What is the latitude, longitude, and city of the station from which the trip with smallest duration started?
bike_1.query: SELECT s.lat, s.long, s.city FROM station AS s JOIN trip AS t ON s.id = t.start_station_id ORDER BY t.duration ASC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: What are the ids of stations that are located in San Francisco and have average bike availability above 10.
bike_1.query: SELECT t1.id FROM station AS t1 JOIN status AS t2 ON t1.id  =  t2.station_id WHERE t1.city  =  "San Francisco" GROUP BY t1.id HAVING AVG(t2.bikes_available) > 10

bike_1.question: What are the ids of the stations in San Francisco that normally have more than 10 bikes available?
bike_1.query: SELECT s.id FROM station AS s JOIN status AS st ON s.id = st.station_id WHERE st.bikes_available > 10 AND s.city = 'San Francisco'

bike_1.question: What are the names and ids of stations that had more than 14 bikes available on average or were installed in December?
bike_1.query: SELECT id, name FROM station WHERE id IN (SELECT station_id FROM status GROUP BY station_id HAVING AVG(bikes_available) > 14) OR MONTH(installation_date) = 12

bike_1.question: What are the names and ids of all stations that have more than 14 bikes available on average or had bikes installed in December?
bike_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT s.name, s.id FROM station s LEFT JOIN status st ON s.id = st.station_id WHERE st.bikes_available > 14 OR MONTH(s.installation_date) = 12

bike_1.question: What is the 3 most common cloud cover rates in the region of zip code 94107?
bike_1.query: SELECT cloud_cover, COUNT(*) AS count FROM weather JOIN station ON weather.zip_code = station.zip_code WHERE station.city = 'San Francisco' AND station.zip_code = '94107' GROUP BY cloud_cover ORDER BY count DESC LIMIT 3

bike_1.question: What are the 3 most common cloud covers in the zip code of 94107?
bike_1.query: SELECT cloud_cover, COUNT(*) AS count FROM weather WHERE zip_code = '94107' GROUP BY cloud_cover ORDER BY count DESC LIMIT 3

bike_1.question: What is the zip code in which the average mean sea level pressure is the lowest?
bike_1.query: SELECT zip_code FROM weather GROUP BY zip_code ORDER BY avg(mean_sea_level_pressure_inches) ASC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: What is the zip code that has the lowest average mean sea level pressure?
bike_1.query: SELECT zip_code FROM weather GROUP BY zip_code ORDER BY avg(mean_sea_level_pressure_inches) ASC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: What is the average bike availability in stations that are not located in Palo Alto?
bike_1.query: SELECT AVG(bikes_available) FROM status WHERE station_id NOT IN (SELECT id FROM station WHERE city = "Palo Alto")

bike_1.question: What is the average bike availablility for stations not in Palo Alto?
bike_1.query: SELECT AVG(bikes_available) FROM status WHERE station_id NOT IN (SELECT id FROM station WHERE city = 'Palo Alto')

bike_1.question: What is the average longitude of stations that never had bike availability more than 10?
bike_1.query: SELECT AVG(long) FROM station WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT station_id FROM status WHERE bikes_available > 10)

bike_1.question: What is the mean longitude for all stations that have never had more than 10 bikes available?
bike_1.query: SELECT AVG(long) FROM station WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT station_id FROM status WHERE bikes_available > 10)

bike_1.question: When and in what zip code did max temperature reach 80?
bike_1.query: SELECT date, zip_code FROM weather WHERE max_temperature_f = 80

bike_1.question: What zip codes have a station with a max temperature greater than or equal to 80 and when did it reach that temperature?
bike_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t4.zip_code, t3.date FROM station AS t1 JOIN status AS t2 ON t1.id = t2.station_id JOIN weather AS t3 ON t2.time = t3.date AND t1.city = t3.zip_code JOIN (SELECT station_id, MAX(bikes_available) AS max_bikes FROM status GROUP BY station_id) AS t4 ON t2.station_id = t4.station_id WHERE t3.max_temperature_f >= 80

bike_1.question: Give me ids for all the trip that took place in a zip code area with average mean temperature above 60.
bike_1.query: SELECT t1.id FROM trip AS t1 JOIN weather AS t2 ON t1.start_date = t2.date WHERE t2.mean_temperature_f > 60 AND t2.zip_code = t1.zip_code

bike_1.question: For each zip code, find the ids of all trips that have a higher average mean temperature above 60?
bike_1.query: SELECT t3.zip_code, t2.id FROM trip AS t1 JOIN weather AS t2 ON DATE(t1.start_date) = t2.date JOIN station AS t3 ON t1.start_station_id = t3.id GROUP BY t3.zip_code, t2.id HAVING AVG(t2.mean_temperature_f) > 60

bike_1.question: For each zip code, return how many times max wind speed reached 25?
bike_1.query: SELECT weather.zip_code, COUNT(*) FROM weather WHERE max_wind_speed_mph >= 25 GROUP BY weather.zip_code

bike_1.question: For each zip code, how many times has the maximum wind speed reached 25 mph?
bike_1.query: SELECT weather.zip_code, COUNT(*) FROM weather WHERE max_wind_speed_mph >= 25 GROUP BY weather.zip_code

bike_1.question: On which day and in which zip code was the min dew point lower than any day in zip code 94107?
bike_1.query: SELECT w.date, w.zip_code FROM weather AS w WHERE w.min_dew_point_f < (SELECT MIN(min_dew_point_f) FROM weather WHERE zip_code = '94107') ORDER BY w.date ASC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: Which days had a minimum dew point smaller than any day in zip code 94107, and in which zip codes were those measurements taken?
bike_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.date, t4.zip_code FROM weather AS t1 JOIN status AS t2 ON t1.date = t2.time JOIN station AS t3 ON t2.station_id = t3.id JOIN weather AS t4 ON t1.min_dew_point_f < t4.min_dew_point_f WHERE t3.zip_code = '94107'

bike_1.question: For each trip, return its ending station's installation date.
bike_1.query: SELECT trip.end_date, station.installation_date FROM trip JOIN station ON trip.end_station_id = station.id

bike_1.question: What is the installation date for each ending station on all the trips?
bike_1.query: SELECT t1.installation_date, t2.end_station_name FROM station AS t1 JOIN trip AS t2 ON t1.id = t2.end_station_id GROUP BY t2.end_station_id

bike_1.question: Which trip started from the station with the largest dock count? Give me the trip id.
bike_1.query: SELECT t1.id FROM trip AS t1 JOIN station AS t2 ON t1.start_station_id  =  t2.id ORDER BY t2.dock_count DESC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: What is the id of the trip that started from the station with the highest dock count?
bike_1.query: SELECT t.id FROM trip AS t JOIN station AS s ON t.start_station_id  =  s.id ORDER BY s.dock_count DESC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: Count the number of trips that did not end in San Francisco city.
bike_1.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM trip WHERE end_station_id NOT IN (SELECT id FROM station WHERE city = 'San Francisco')

bike_1.question: How many trips did not end in San Francisco?
bike_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM trip WHERE end_station_name NOT LIKE '%San Francisco%'

bike_1.question: In zip code 94107, on which day neither Fog nor Rain was not observed?
bike_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT date FROM weather WHERE zip_code = '94107' AND events NOT LIKE '%Fog%' AND events NOT LIKE '%Rain%'

bike_1.question: On which day has it neither been foggy nor rained in the zip code of 94107?
bike_1.query: SELECT date FROM weather WHERE events NOT LIKE '%Fog%' AND precipitation_inches = 0 AND zip_code = '94107'

bike_1.question: What are the ids of stations that have latitude above 37.4 and never had bike availability below 7?
bike_1.query: SELECT s.id FROM station s WHERE s.lat > 37.4 AND s.id NOT IN (SELECT station_id FROM status WHERE bikes_available < 7)

bike_1.question: What are the ids of all stations that have a latitude above 37.4 and have never had less than 7 bikes available?
bike_1.query: SELECT s.id FROM station s WHERE s.lat > 37.4 AND s.id NOT IN (SELECT station_id FROM status WHERE bikes_available < 7)

bike_1.question: What are names of stations that have average bike availability above 10 and are not located in San Jose city?
bike_1.query: SELECT name FROM station WHERE city != "San Jose" AND id IN (SELECT station_id FROM status GROUP BY station_id HAVING AVG(bikes_available) > 10)

bike_1.question: What are the names of all stations that have more than 10 bikes available and are not located in San Jose?
bike_1.query: SELECT name FROM station AS s JOIN status AS st ON s.id = st.station_id WHERE st.bikes_available > 10 AND s.city != "San Jose"

bike_1.question: What are the name, latitude, and city of the station with the lowest latitude?
bike_1.query: SELECT name, lat, city FROM station ORDER BY lat ASC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: What is the name, latitude, and city of the station that is located the furthest South?
bike_1.query: SELECT name, lat, city FROM station ORDER BY lat DESC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: What are the date, mean temperature and mean humidity for the top 3 days with the largest max gust speeds?
bike_1.query: SELECT T3.date, T3.mean_temperature_f, T3.mean_humidity FROM (SELECT date FROM weather ORDER BY max_gust_speed_mph DESC LIMIT 3) AS T1 JOIN (SELECT date, AVG(mean_temperature_f) AS mean_temperature_f, AVG(mean_humidity) AS mean_humidity FROM weather GROUP BY date) AS T3 ON T1.date = T3.date

bike_1.question: What is the date, average temperature and mean humidity for the days with the 3 largest maximum gust speeds?
bike_1.query: SELECT T3.date, AVG(T3.mean_temperature_f), AVG(T3.mean_humidity) FROM (SELECT date, max_gust_speed_mph FROM weather ORDER BY max_gust_speed_mph DESC LIMIT 3) AS T1 JOIN status AS T2 ON T1.date = T2.time JOIN weather AS T3 ON T1.date = T3.date WHERE T2.bikes_available > 0 GROUP BY T3.date ORDER BY T3.date ASC

bike_1.question: List the name and the number of stations for all the cities that have at least 15 stations.
bike_1.query: SELECT s.city, COUNT(s.id) AS num_stations FROM station AS s GROUP BY s.city HAVING COUNT(s.id) >= 15

bike_1.question: What is the name of every city that has at least 15 stations and how many stations does it have?
bike_1.query: SELECT s.city, COUNT(*) AS num_stations FROM station AS s GROUP BY s.city HAVING num_stations >= 15

bike_1.question: Find the ids and names of stations from which at least 200 trips started.
bike_1.query: SELECT start_station_id, name FROM station JOIN (SELECT start_station_id, COUNT(*) AS num_trips FROM trip GROUP BY start_station_id HAVING num_trips >= 200) AS t ON station.id = t.start_station_id

bike_1.question: What are the ids and names of all start stations that were the beginning of at least 200 trips?
bike_1.query: SELECT start_station_id, start_station_name FROM trip GROUP BY start_station_id, start_station_name HAVING count(*) >= 200

bike_1.question: Find the zip code in which the average mean visibility is lower than 10.
bike_1.query: SELECT zip_code FROM weather GROUP BY zip_code HAVING avg(mean_visibility_miles) < 10

bike_1.question: For each zip code, select all those that have an average mean visiblity below 10.
bike_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT weather.zip_code FROM weather JOIN status ON weather.date = DATE(status.time) JOIN station ON status.station_id = station.id WHERE weather.mean_visibility_miles < 10 GROUP BY weather.zip_code

bike_1.question: List all the cities in a decreasing order of each city's stations' highest latitude.
bike_1.query: SELECT city FROM station GROUP BY city ORDER BY MAX(lat) DESC

bike_1.question: For each city, list their names in decreasing order by their highest station latitude.
bike_1.query: SELECT city, name FROM station GROUP BY city ORDER BY MAX(lat) DESC

bike_1.question: What are the dates that had the top 5 cloud cover rates? Also tell me the cloud cover rate.
bike_1.query: SELECT date, cloud_cover FROM weather ORDER BY cloud_cover DESC LIMIT 5

bike_1.question: What are the dates that have the 5 highest cloud cover rates and what are the rates?
bike_1.query: SELECT date, cloud_cover FROM weather ORDER BY cloud_cover DESC LIMIT 5

bike_1.question: What are the ids and durations of the trips with the top 3 durations?
bike_1.query: SELECT id, duration FROM trip ORDER BY duration DESC LIMIT 3

bike_1.question: What are the ids of the trips that lasted the longest and how long did they last?
bike_1.query: SELECT id, duration FROM trip ORDER BY duration DESC LIMIT 2 OFFSET 1

bike_1.question: For each station, return its longitude and the average duration of trips that started from the station.
bike_1.query: SELECT station.long, AVG(trip.duration) FROM station JOIN trip ON station.id = trip.start_station_id GROUP BY station.id

bike_1.question: For each start station id, what is its name, longitude and average duration of trips started there?
bike_1.query: SELECT start_station_id, station.name, station.long, AVG(trip.duration) AS avg_duration FROM trip JOIN station ON trip.start_station_id = station.id GROUP BY start_station_id, station.name, station.long ORDER BY start_station_id ASC

bike_1.question: For each station, find its latitude and the minimum duration of trips that ended at the station.
bike_1.query: SELECT s.lat, MIN(t.duration) FROM station s JOIN trip t ON s.id = t.end_station_id GROUP BY s.id

bike_1.question: For each end station id, what is its name, latitude, and minimum duration for trips ended there?
bike_1.query: SELECT t1.name, t1.lat, MIN(t2.duration) FROM station AS t1 JOIN trip AS t2 ON t1.id = t2.end_station_id GROUP BY t2.end_station_id

bike_1.question: List all the distinct stations from which a trip of duration below 100 started.
bike_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT start_station_name FROM trip WHERE duration < 100

bike_1.question: What are all the different start station names for a trip that lasted less than 100?
bike_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT start_station_name FROM trip WHERE duration < 100

bike_1.question: Find all the zip codes in which the max dew point have never reached 70.
bike_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT zip_code FROM weather WHERE max_dew_point_f < 70

bike_1.question: What are all the different zip codes that have a maximum dew point that was always below 70?
bike_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT zip_code FROM weather WHERE max_dew_point_f < 70 AND zip_code NOT IN (SELECT zip_code FROM weather WHERE max_dew_point_f >= 70)

bike_1.question: Find the id for the trips that lasted at least as long as the average duration of trips in zip code 94103.
bike_1.query: SELECT id FROM trip WHERE duration >= (SELECT AVG(duration) FROM trip WHERE zip_code = '94103')

bike_1.question: What are the ids of all trips that had a duration as long as the average trip duration in the zip code 94103?
bike_1.query: SELECT id FROM trip WHERE duration = (SELECT AVG(duration) FROM trip WHERE zip_code = '94103')

bike_1.question: What are the dates in which the mean sea level pressure was between 30.3 and 31?
bike_1.query: SELECT date FROM weather WHERE mean_sea_level_pressure_inches BETWEEN 30.3 AND 31

bike_1.question: What are the dates that have an average sea level pressure between 30.3 and 31?
bike_1.query: SELECT date FROM weather WHERE mean_sea_level_pressure_inches BETWEEN 30.3 AND 31 GROUP BY date

bike_1.question: Find the day in which the difference between the max temperature and min temperature was the smallest. Also report the difference.
bike_1.query: SELECT date, (max_temperature_f - min_temperature_f) AS temp_diff FROM weather ORDER BY temp_diff ASC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: What are the days that had the smallest temperature range, and what was that range?
bike_1.query: SELECT date, (max_temperature_f - min_temperature_f) AS temp_range FROM weather ORDER BY temp_range ASC LIMIT 1

bike_1.question: What are the id and name of the stations that have ever had more than 12 bikes available?
bike_1.query: SELECT id, name FROM station WHERE id IN (SELECT station_id FROM status WHERE bikes_available > 12)

bike_1.question: What are the different ids and names of the stations that have had more than 12 bikes available?
bike_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT station.id, station.name FROM station JOIN status ON station.id = status.station_id WHERE status.bikes_available > 12

bike_1.question: Give me the zip code where the average mean humidity is below 70 and at least 100 trips took place.
bike_1.query: SELECT zip_code FROM trip WHERE start_date IN (SELECT date FROM weather WHERE mean_humidity < 70 GROUP BY date HAVING COUNT(*) >= 100)

bike_1.question: What are the zip codes that have an average mean humidity below 70 and had at least 100 trips come through there?
bike_1.query: SELECT t3.zip_code FROM weather AS t1 JOIN trip AS t2 ON t1.date = t2.start_date AND t1.zip_code = t2.zip_code JOIN station AS t3 ON t2.start_station_id = t3.id WHERE t1.mean_humidity < 70 GROUP BY t3.zip_code HAVING COUNT(*) >= 100

bike_1.question: What are the names of stations that are located in Palo Alto city but have never been the ending point of trips more than 100 times?
bike_1.query: SELECT s.name FROM station AS s LEFT JOIN trip AS t ON s.id = t.end_station_id WHERE s.city = 'Palo Alto' AND (t.end_station_id IS NULL OR (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM trip WHERE end_station_id = s.id) < 100)

bike_1.question: What are the names of the stations that are located in Palo Alto but have never been the ending point of the trips
bike_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT station.name FROM station LEFT JOIN trip ON station.id = trip.end_station_id WHERE station.city = 'Palo Alto' AND trip.end_station_id IS NULL

bike_1.question: How many trips started from Mountain View city and ended at Palo Alto city?
bike_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM trip WHERE start_station_name = 'Mountain View' AND end_station_name = 'Palo Alto'

bike_1.question: How many trips stated from  a station in Mountain View and ended at one in Palo Alto?
bike_1.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM trip WHERE start_station_name = 'Mountain View' AND end_station_name = 'Palo Alto'

bike_1.question: What is the average latitude and longitude of the starting points of all trips?
bike_1.query: SELECT avg(s.lat), avg(s.long) FROM trip AS t JOIN station AS s ON t.start_station_id = s.id

bike_1.question: What is the average latitude and longitude of all starting stations for the trips?
bike_1.query: SELECT AVG(s.lat), AVG(s.long) FROM station AS s JOIN trip AS t ON s.id = t.start_station_id

book_2.question: How many books are there?
book_2.query: SELECT count(*) FROM book

book_2.question: List the writers of the books in ascending alphabetical order.
book_2.query: SELECT Writer FROM book ORDER BY Writer ASC

book_2.question: List the titles of the books in ascending order of issues.
book_2.query: SELECT Title FROM book ORDER BY Issues ASC

book_2.question: What are the titles of the books whose writer is not "Elaine Lee"?
book_2.query: SELECT Title FROM book WHERE Writer <> "Elaine Lee"

book_2.question: What are the title and issues of the books?
book_2.query: SELECT Title, Issues FROM book

book_2.question: What are the dates of publications in descending order of price?
book_2.query: SELECT Publication_Date FROM publication ORDER BY Price DESC

book_2.question: What are the distinct publishers of publications with price higher than 5000000?
book_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT Publisher FROM publication WHERE Price > 5000000

book_2.question: List the publisher of the publication with the highest price.
book_2.query: SELECT Publisher FROM publication WHERE Price = (SELECT MAX(Price) FROM publication)

book_2.question: List the publication dates of publications with 3 lowest prices.
book_2.query: SELECT Publication_Date FROM publication ORDER BY Price ASC LIMIT 3

book_2.question: Show the title and publication dates of books.
book_2.query: SELECT Title, Publication_Date FROM book

book_2.question: Show writers who have published a book with price more than 4000000.
book_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT Writer FROM book AS T1 JOIN publication AS T2 ON T1.Book_ID  =  T2.Book_ID WHERE T2.Price  >  4000000

book_2.question: Show the titles of books in descending order of publication price.
book_2.query: SELECT Title FROM book JOIN publication ON book.Book_ID = publication.Book_ID ORDER BY Price DESC

book_2.question: Show publishers that have more than one publication.
book_2.query: SELECT Publisher FROM publication GROUP BY Publisher HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

book_2.question: Show different publishers together with the number of publications they have.
book_2.query: SELECT Publisher, COUNT(*) FROM publication GROUP BY Publisher

book_2.question: Please show the most common publication date.
book_2.query: SELECT Publication_Date FROM publication GROUP BY Publication_Date ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

book_2.question: List the writers who have written more than one book.
book_2.query: SELECT Writer FROM book GROUP BY Writer HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

book_2.question: List the titles of books that are not published.
book_2.query: SELECT Title FROM book WHERE Book_ID NOT IN (SELECT Book_ID FROM publication)

book_2.question: Show the publishers that have publications with price higher than 10000000 and publications with price lower than 5000000.
book_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT Publisher FROM publication WHERE Price > 10000000 AND Publisher IN (SELECT Publisher FROM publication WHERE Price < 5000000)

book_2.question: What is the number of distinct publication dates?
book_2.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Publication_Date) FROM publication

book_2.question: How many distinct publication dates are there in our record?
book_2.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Publication_Date) FROM publication

book_2.question: Show the prices of publications whose publisher is either "Person" or "Wiley"
book_2.query: SELECT Price FROM publication WHERE Publisher IN ('Person', 'Wiley')

musical.question: How many actors are there?
musical.query: SELECT count(*) FROM actor

musical.question: Count the number of actors.
musical.query: SELECT count(*) FROM actor

musical.question: List the name of actors in ascending alphabetical order.
musical.query: SELECT Name FROM actor ORDER BY Name ASC

musical.question: What are the names of actors, ordered alphabetically?
musical.query: SELECT Name FROM actor ORDER BY Name ASC

musical.question: What are the characters and duration of actors?

musical.question: Return the characters and durations for each actor.
musical.query: SELECT Character, Duration FROM actor

musical.question: List the name of actors whose age is not 20.

musical.question: What are the names of actors who are not 20 years old?
musical.query: SELECT Name FROM actor WHERE age != 20

musical.question: What are the characters of actors in descending order of age?
musical.query: SELECT Character FROM actor ORDER BY age DESC

musical.question: Return the characters for actors, ordered by age descending.
musical.query: SELECT Character FROM actor ORDER BY age DESC

musical.question: What is the duration of the oldest actor?

musical.question: Return the duration of the actor with the greatest age.

musical.question: What are the names of musicals with nominee "Bob Fosse"?
musical.query: SELECT Name FROM musical WHERE Musical_ID IN (SELECT Musical_ID FROM actor WHERE Nominee = "Bob Fosse")

musical.question: Return the names of musicals who have the nominee Bob Fosse.
musical.query: SELECT T1.Name FROM musical AS T1 JOIN actor AS T2 ON T1.Musical_ID  =  T2.Musical_ID WHERE T2.Nominee  =  "Bob Fosse"

musical.question: What are the distinct nominees of the musicals with the award that is not "Tony Award"?
musical.query: SELECT DISTINCT Nominee FROM musical WHERE Award != "Tony Award"

musical.question: Return the different nominees of musicals that have an award that is not the Tony Award.
musical.query: SELECT DISTINCT Nominee FROM musical WHERE Award != "Tony Award"

musical.question: Show names of actors and names of musicals they are in.
musical.query: SELECT T2.Name, T1.Name FROM musical AS T1 JOIN actor AS T2 ON T1.Musical_ID = T2.Musical_ID

musical.question: What are the names of actors and the musicals that they are in?
musical.query: SELECT actor.Name, musical.Name FROM actor JOIN musical ON actor.Musical_ID = musical.Musical_ID

musical.question: Show names of actors that have appeared in musical with name "The Phantom of the Opera".
musical.query: SELECT Name FROM actor WHERE Musical_ID = (SELECT Musical_ID FROM musical WHERE Name = "The Phantom of the Opera")

musical.question: What are the names of actors who have been in the musical titled The Phantom of the Opera?
musical.query: SELECT Name FROM actor WHERE Musical_ID = (SELECT Musical_ID FROM musical WHERE Name = 'The Phantom of the Opera')

musical.question: Show names of actors in descending order of the year their musical is awarded.
musical.query: SELECT Name FROM actor AS T1 JOIN musical AS T2 ON T1.Musical_ID = T2.Musical_ID ORDER BY T2.Year DESC

musical.question: What are the names of actors ordered descending by the year in which their musical was awarded?
musical.query: SELECT actor.Name FROM actor JOIN musical ON actor.Musical_ID = musical.Musical_ID ORDER BY musical.Year DESC

musical.question: Show names of musicals and the number of actors who have appeared in the musicals.
musical.query: SELECT musical.Name, COUNT(actor.Actor_ID) FROM musical JOIN actor ON musical.Musical_ID = actor.Musical_ID GROUP BY musical.Name

musical.question: How many actors have appeared in each musical?
musical.query: SELECT musical.Name, COUNT(actor.Actor_ID) FROM musical JOIN actor ON musical.Musical_ID = actor.Musical_ID GROUP BY musical.Name

musical.question: Show names of musicals which have at least three actors.
musical.query: SELECT Name FROM musical WHERE Musical_ID IN (SELECT Musical_ID FROM actor GROUP BY Musical_ID HAVING COUNT(*) >= 3)

musical.question: What are the names of musicals who have at 3 or more actors?
musical.query: SELECT Name FROM musical WHERE Musical_ID IN (SELECT Musical_ID FROM actor GROUP BY Musical_ID HAVING COUNT(*) >= 3)

musical.question: Show different nominees and the number of musicals they have been nominated.
musical.query: SELECT Nominee, COUNT(DISTINCT Musical_ID) FROM musical GROUP BY Nominee

musical.question: How many musicals has each nominee been nominated for?
musical.query: SELECT Nominee, COUNT(*) FROM musical GROUP BY Nominee

musical.question: Please show the nominee who has been nominated the greatest number of times.
musical.query: SELECT Nominee FROM musical GROUP BY Nominee ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

musical.question: Who is the nominee who has been nominated for the most musicals?
musical.query: SELECT Nominee FROM musical GROUP BY Nominee ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

musical.query: SELECT Result FROM musical GROUP BY Result ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

musical.question: Return the most frequent result across all musicals.
musical.query: SELECT Result FROM musical GROUP BY Result ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

musical.question: List the nominees that have been nominated more than two musicals.
musical.query: SELECT Nominee FROM musical GROUP BY Nominee HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT Musical_ID) > 2

musical.question: Who are the nominees who have been nominated more than two times?
musical.query: SELECT Nominee FROM musical GROUP BY Nominee HAVING COUNT(*) > 2

musical.question: List the name of musicals that do not have actors.
musical.query: SELECT Name FROM musical WHERE Musical_ID NOT IN (SELECT Musical_ID FROM actor)

musical.question: Show the nominees that have nominated musicals for both "Tony Award" and "Drama Desk Award".
musical.query: SELECT Nominee FROM musical WHERE Award IN ("Tony Award", "Drama Desk Award") GROUP BY Nominee HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT Award) = 2

musical.question: Who are the nominees who have been nominated for both a Tony Award and a Drama Desk Award?
musical.query: SELECT Nominee FROM musical WHERE (Award = "Tony Award" OR Award = "Drama Desk Award") GROUP BY Nominee HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT Award) = 2

musical.question: Show the musical nominee with award "Bob Fosse" or "Cleavant Derricks".
musical.query: SELECT Name FROM musical WHERE Nominee = "Bob Fosse" OR Nominee = "Cleavant Derricks" AND Award IS NOT NULL

musical.query: SELECT Nominee FROM musical WHERE Award IN ("Bob Fosse Award", "Cleavant Derricks Award")

twitter_1.question: Find the emails of the user named "Mary".
twitter_1.query: SELECT email FROM user_profiles WHERE name = "Mary"

twitter_1.question: What is the partition id of the user named "Iron Man".
twitter_1.query: SELECT partitionid FROM user_profiles WHERE name = 'Iron Man'

twitter_1.question: How many users are there?
twitter_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM user_profiles

twitter_1.question: How many followers does each user have?
twitter_1.query: SELECT name, followers FROM user_profiles ORDER BY followers DESC

twitter_1.question: Find the number of followers for each user.
twitter_1.query: SELECT uid, followers FROM user_profiles

twitter_1.question: Find the number of tweets in record.
twitter_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM tweets

twitter_1.question: Find the number of users who posted some tweets.
twitter_1.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT uid) FROM tweets

twitter_1.question: Find the name and email of the user whose name contains the word ‘Swift’.
twitter_1.query: SELECT name, email FROM user_profiles WHERE name LIKE '%Swift%'

twitter_1.question: Find the names of users whose emails contain ‘superstar’ or ‘edu’.
twitter_1.query: SELECT name FROM user_profiles WHERE email LIKE '%superstar%' OR email LIKE '%edu%'

twitter_1.question: Return the text of tweets about the topic 'intern'.
twitter_1.query: SELECT text FROM tweets WHERE text LIKE '%intern%'

twitter_1.question: Find the name and email of the users who have more than 1000 followers.
twitter_1.query: SELECT name, email FROM user_profiles WHERE followers > 1000

twitter_1.question: Find the names of the users whose number of followers is greater than that of the user named "Tyler Swift".
twitter_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM user_profiles AS T1 JOIN follows AS T2 ON T1.uid  =  T2.f2 WHERE T1.followers > (SELECT followers FROM user_profiles WHERE name = "Tyler Swift")

twitter_1.question: Find the name and email for the users who have more than one follower.
twitter_1.query: SELECT name, email FROM user_profiles WHERE uid IN (SELECT f2 FROM follows GROUP BY f2 HAVING COUNT(*) > 1)

twitter_1.question: Find the names of users who have more than one tweet.
twitter_1.query: SELECT name FROM user_profiles WHERE uid IN (SELECT uid FROM tweets GROUP BY uid HAVING COUNT(*) > 1)

twitter_1.question: Find the id of users who are followed by Mary and Susan.
twitter_1.query: SELECT t1.uid FROM follows AS t1 JOIN follows AS t2 ON t1.f2 = t2.f2 WHERE t1.f2 = (SELECT uid FROM user_profiles WHERE name = 'Mary') AND t2.f2 = (SELECT uid FROM user_profiles WHERE name = 'Susan')

twitter_1.question: Find the id of users who are followed by Mary or Susan.
twitter_1.query: SELECT uid FROM user_profiles WHERE name IN ('Mary', 'Susan') UNION SELECT f2 FROM follows WHERE f1 IN (SELECT uid FROM user_profiles WHERE name IN ('Mary', 'Susan'))

twitter_1.question: Find the name of the user who has the largest number of followers.
twitter_1.query: SELECT name FROM user_profiles WHERE uid IN (SELECT f2 FROM follows GROUP BY f2 ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1)

twitter_1.question: Find the name and email of the user followed by the least number of people.
twitter_1.query: SELECT T2.name, T2.email FROM user_profiles AS T1 JOIN user_profiles AS T2 ON T1.f2 = T2.uid GROUP BY T1.f2 ORDER BY COUNT(*) ASC LIMIT 1

twitter_1.question: List the name and number of followers for each user, and sort the results by the number of followers in descending order.
twitter_1.query: SELECT name, followers FROM user_profiles ORDER BY followers DESC

twitter_1.question: List the names of 5 users followed by the largest number of other users.
twitter_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM user_profiles AS T1 JOIN follows AS T2 ON T1.uid = T2.f2 GROUP BY T2.f2 ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 5

twitter_1.question: List the text of all tweets in the order of date.
twitter_1.query: SELECT text FROM tweets ORDER BY createdate ASC

twitter_1.question: Find the name of each user and number of tweets tweeted by each of them.
twitter_1.query: SELECT user_profiles.name, COUNT(tweets.id) FROM user_profiles JOIN tweets ON user_profiles.uid = tweets.uid GROUP BY user_profiles.name

twitter_1.question: Find the name and partition id for users who tweeted less than twice.
twitter_1.query: SELECT name, partitionid FROM user_profiles WHERE uid IN (SELECT uid FROM tweets GROUP BY uid HAVING COUNT(*) < 2)

twitter_1.question: Find the name of the user who tweeted more than once, and number of tweets tweeted by them.
twitter_1.query: SELECT user_profiles.name, COUNT(*) as num_tweets FROM tweets JOIN user_profiles ON tweets.uid = user_profiles.uid GROUP BY tweets.uid HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

twitter_1.question: Find the average number of followers for the users who do not have any tweet.
twitter_1.query: SELECT AVG(followers) FROM user_profiles WHERE uid NOT IN (SELECT uid FROM tweets)

twitter_1.question: Find the average number of followers for the users who had some tweets.
twitter_1.query: SELECT AVG(T2.followers) FROM tweets AS T1 JOIN user_profiles AS T2 ON T1.uid = T2.uid

twitter_1.question: Find the maximum and total number of followers of all users.
twitter_1.query: SELECT MAX(followers), SUM(followers) FROM user_profiles

product_catalog.question: What are the entry names of catalog with the attribute possessed by most entries.
product_catalog.query: SELECT T3.catalog_entry_name FROM Catalog_Contents_Additional_Attributes AS T1 JOIN (SELECT attribute_id, COUNT(*) AS count FROM Catalog_Contents_Additional_Attributes GROUP BY attribute_id ORDER BY count DESC LIMIT 1) AS T2 ON T1.attribute_id = T2.attribute_id JOIN Catalog_Contents AS T3 ON T1.catalog_entry_id = T3.catalog_entry_id WHERE T3.catalog_level_number = (SELECT MAX(catalog_level_number) FROM Catalog_Structure)

product_catalog.question: Find the entry names of the catalog with the attribute that have the most entries.

product_catalog.question: What is the level name of the cheapest catalog (in USD)?
product_catalog.query: SELECT catalog_level_name FROM Catalog_Structure AS t1 JOIN Catalogs AS t2 ON t1.catalog_id = t2.catalog_id JOIN Catalog_Contents AS t3 ON t1.catalog_level_number = t3.catalog_level_number WHERE price_in_dollars = (SELECT MIN(price_in_dollars) FROM Catalog_Contents) AND t2.date_of_latest_revision = (SELECT MAX(date_of_latest_revision) FROM Catalogs)

product_catalog.question: Find the level name of the catalog with the lowest price (in USD).
product_catalog.query: SELECT catalog_level_name FROM Catalog_Structure AS T1 JOIN Catalog_Contents AS T2 ON T1.catalog_level_number = T2.catalog_level_number WHERE price_in_dollars = (SELECT MIN(price_in_dollars) FROM Catalog_Contents) LIMIT 1

flight_1.query: SELECT eid FROM employee WHERE eid NOT IN (SELECT eid FROM certificate)

flight_1.question: What are the ids of all employees that don't have certificates?
flight_1.query: SELECT eid FROM employee WHERE eid NOT IN (SELECT eid FROM certificate)

flight_1.question: Show names for all aircrafts of which John Williams has certificates.
flight_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM aircraft AS T1 JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.aid = T2.aid JOIN employee AS T3 ON T2.eid = T3.eid WHERE T3.name = 'John Williams'

flight_1.question: What are the names of all aircrafts that John Williams have certificates to be able to fly?
flight_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM aircraft AS T1 JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.aid = T2.aid JOIN employee AS T3 ON T2.eid = T3.eid WHERE T3.name = 'John Williams'

flight_1.question: Show names for all employees who have certificate of Boeing 737-800.
flight_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM employee AS T1 JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.eid  =  T2.eid JOIN aircraft AS T3 ON T2.aid  =  T3.aid WHERE T3.name  =  'Boeing 737-800'

flight_1.question: What are the names of all employees who have a certificate to fly Boeing 737-800?
flight_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM employee AS T1 JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.eid = T2.eid JOIN aircraft AS T3 ON T2.aid = T3.aid WHERE T3.name = 'Boeing 737-800'

flight_1.question: Show names for all employees who have certificates on both Boeing 737-800 and Airbus A340-300.
flight_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM employee AS T1 JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.eid = T2.eid JOIN aircraft AS T3 ON T2.aid = T3.aid WHERE T3.name = 'Boeing 737-800' INTERSECT SELECT T1.name FROM employee AS T1 JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.eid = T2.eid JOIN aircraft AS T3 ON T2.aid = T3.aid WHERE T3.name = 'Airbus A340-300'

flight_1.question: What are the names of all employees who can fly both the Boeing 737-800 and the Airbus A340-300?
flight_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM employee AS T1 JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.eid = T2.eid JOIN aircraft AS T3 ON T2.aid = T3.aid WHERE T3.name = 'Boeing 737-800' INTERSECT SELECT T1.name FROM employee AS T1 JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.eid = T2.eid JOIN aircraft AS T3 ON T2.aid = T3.aid WHERE T3.name = 'Airbus A340-300'

flight_1.question: Show names for all employees who do not have certificate of Boeing 737-800.
flight_1.query: SELECT name FROM employee WHERE eid NOT IN (SELECT eid FROM certificate WHERE aid = (SELECT aid FROM aircraft WHERE name = 'Boeing 737-800'))

flight_1.question: What are the names of all employees who are not certified to fly Boeing 737-800s?
flight_1.query: SELECT name FROM employee WHERE eid NOT IN (SELECT eid FROM certificate WHERE aid = (SELECT aid FROM aircraft WHERE name = 'Boeing 737-800'))

flight_1.question: Show the name of aircraft which fewest people have its certificate.
flight_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM aircraft AS T1 LEFT JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.aid = T2.aid GROUP BY T1.name ORDER BY COUNT(T2.eid) ASC LIMIT 1

flight_1.question: What are the names of the aircraft that the least people are certified to fly?
flight_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM aircraft AS T1 LEFT JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.aid = T2.aid GROUP BY T1.name ORDER BY COUNT(T2.eid) ASC LIMIT 1

flight_1.question: Show the name and distance of the aircrafts with more than 5000 distance and which at least 5 people have its certificate.
flight_1.query: SELECT T1.name, T1.distance FROM aircraft AS T1 JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.aid = T2.aid GROUP BY T1.name, T1.distance HAVING T1.distance > 5000 AND COUNT(DISTINCT T2.eid) >= 5

flight_1.question: What is the name and distance of every aircraft that can cover a distance of more than 5000 and which at least 5 people can fly?
flight_1.query: SELECT T1.name, T1.distance FROM aircraft AS T1 JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.aid = T2.aid JOIN employee AS T3 ON T2.eid = T3.eid WHERE T1.distance > 5000 GROUP BY T1.name, T1.distance HAVING COUNT(T3.eid) >= 5

flight_1.question: what is the salary and name of the employee who has the most number of aircraft certificates?
flight_1.query: SELECT T1.name, T1.salary FROM employee AS T1 JOIN certificate AS T2 ON T1.eid = T2.eid GROUP BY T1.name, T1.salary ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

flight_1.question: What is the salaray and name of the employee that is certified to fly the most planes?
flight_1.query: SELECT T3.name, T3.salary FROM employee AS T3 JOIN certificate AS T1 ON T3.eid = T1.eid JOIN aircraft AS T2 ON T1.aid = T2.aid GROUP BY T3.name, T3.salary ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

flight_1.question: What is the salary and name of the employee who has the most number of certificates on aircrafts with distance more than 5000?
flight_1.query: SELECT T3.name, T3.salary FROM (SELECT T1.eid, T2.distance, count(*) AS num_certs FROM certificate AS T1 JOIN aircraft AS T2 ON T1.aid = T2.aid WHERE T2.distance > 5000 GROUP BY T1.eid, T2.distance) AS certs JOIN employee AS T3 ON certs.eid = T3.eid ORDER BY certs.num_certs DESC LIMIT 1

flight_1.question: What is the salaray and name of the employee with the most certificates to fly planes more than 5000?
flight_1.query: SELECT T3.name, T3.salary FROM (SELECT T1.eid, T2.name, T2.salary, count(*) AS num_certs FROM certificate AS T1 JOIN employee AS T2 ON T1.eid = T2.eid JOIN aircraft AS T3 ON T1.aid = T3.aid WHERE T3.distance > 5000 GROUP BY T1.eid) AS T3 ORDER BY T3.num_certs DESC LIMIT 1

allergy_1.question: Which allergy type has most number of allergies?

allergy_1.question: Which allergy type has least number of allergies?

allergy_1.question: Which allergy type is the least common?
allergy_1.query: SELECT allergytype FROM allergy_type AS t1 LEFT JOIN has_allergy AS t2 ON t1.allergy  =  t2.allergy GROUP BY allergytype ORDER BY count(stuid) ASC LIMIT 1

allergy_1.question: Show all student IDs who have at least two allergies.
allergy_1.query: SELECT t1.stuid FROM has_allergy AS t1 JOIN (SELECT stuid FROM has_allergy GROUP BY stuid HAVING count(*) >= 2) AS t2 ON t1.stuid  =  t2.stuid

allergy_1.question: What are the students ids of students who have more than one allergy?
allergy_1.query: SELECT t1.stuid FROM has_allergy AS t1 JOIN (SELECT stuid FROM has_allergy GROUP BY stuid HAVING count(*) > 1) AS t2 ON t1.stuid  =  t2.stuid

allergy_1.question: What are the student ids of students who don't have any allergies?

allergy_1.question: How many female students have milk or egg allergies?
allergy_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_allergy AS t2 ON t1.stuid  =  t2.stuid JOIN allergy_type AS t3 ON t2.allergy  =  t3.allergy WHERE t1.sex  =  'F' AND (t3.allergytype  =  'milk' OR t3.allergytype  =  'egg')

allergy_1.question: How many students who are female are allergic to milk or eggs?
allergy_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM student AS T1 JOIN has_allergy AS T2 ON T1.stuid  =  T2.stuid JOIN allergy_type AS T3 ON T2.allergy  =  T3.allergy WHERE T1.sex  =  'F' AND (T3.allergytype  =  'milk' OR T3.allergytype  =  'eggs')

allergy_1.question: How many students have a food allergy?

allergy_1.question: How many students are affected by food related allergies?

allergy_1.question: Which allergy has most number of students affected?

allergy_1.question: Which allergy is the most common?

allergy_1.question: How many students have each different allergy?

allergy_1.question: Find the last name and age of the student who has allergy to both milk and cat.
allergy_1.query: SELECT lname, age FROM student WHERE stuid IN (SELECT stuid FROM has_allergy WHERE allergy IN ('milk', 'cat') GROUP BY stuid HAVING COUNT(*) = 2)

allergy_1.question: What are the last names and ages of the students who are allergic to milk and cat?
allergy_1.query: SELECT t1.lname, t1.age FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_allergy AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid JOIN allergy_type AS t3 ON t2.allergy = t3.allergy WHERE t3.allergytype IN ('milk', 'cat')

allergy_1.question: What are the allergies and their types that the student with first name Lisa has? And order the result by name of allergies.
allergy_1.query: SELECT T1.allergy, T1.allergytype FROM allergy_type AS T1 JOIN has_allergy AS T2 ON T1.allergy  =  T2.allergy JOIN student AS T3 ON T2.stuid  =  T3.stuid WHERE T3.fname  =  'Lisa' ORDER BY T1.allergy

allergy_1.question: What are the allergies the girl named Lisa has? And what are the types of them? Order the result by allergy names.
allergy_1.query: SELECT T1.allergy, T1.allergytype FROM allergy_type AS T1 JOIN has_allergy AS T2 ON T1.allergy  =  T2.allergy JOIN student AS T3 ON T2.stuid  =  T3.stuid WHERE T3.fname  =  'Lisa' AND T3.sex  =  'F' ORDER BY T1.allergytype

allergy_1.question: Find the first name and gender of the student who has allergy to milk but not cat.
allergy_1.query: SELECT t1.fname, t1.sex FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_allergy AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid WHERE t2.allergy = 'milk' AND t1.stuid NOT IN (SELECT t3.stuid FROM has_allergy AS t3 JOIN allergy_type AS t4 ON t3.allergy = t4.allergy WHERE t4.allergytype = 'cat')

allergy_1.question: What are the first name and gender of the students who have allergy to milk but can put up with cats?
allergy_1.query: SELECT t1.fname, t1.sex FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_allergy AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid WHERE t2.allergy = 'milk' AND t1.stuid IN (SELECT t2.stuid FROM has_allergy AS t2 JOIN allergy_type AS t3 ON t2.allergy = t3.allergy WHERE t3.allergytype = 'cats')

allergy_1.question: Find the average age of the students who have allergies with food and animal types.
allergy_1.query: SELECT avg(t1.age) FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_allergy AS t2 ON t1.stuid  =  t2.stuid JOIN allergy_type AS t3 ON t2.allergy  =  t3.allergy WHERE t3.allergytype IN ("food", "animal")

allergy_1.question: How old are the students with allergies to food and animal types on average?
allergy_1.query: SELECT avg(age) FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_allergy AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid JOIN allergy_type AS t3 ON t2.allergy = t3.allergy WHERE t3.allergytype IN ('food', 'animal')

allergy_1.question: What are the distinct first names and cities of the students who have allergy either to milk or to cat?

allergy_1.question: Find the number of students who are older than 18 and do not have allergy to either food or animal.

allergy_1.question: Find the first name and major of the students who are not allegry to soy.

allergy_1.question: What are the first name and major of the students who are able to consume soy?
allergy_1.query: SELECT t1.fname, t1.major FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_allergy AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid JOIN allergy_type AS t3 ON t2.allergy = t3.allergy WHERE t3.allergytype != 'Soy'

store_1.question: A list of the top 5 countries by number of invoices. List country name and number of invoices.
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country AS country, COUNT(*) AS num_invoices FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY num_invoices DESC LIMIT 5

store_1.question: What are the top 5 countries by number of invoices and how many do they have?
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country, COUNT(*) AS num_invoices FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY num_invoices DESC LIMIT 5

store_1.question: A list of the top 8 countries by gross/total invoice size. List country name and gross invoice size.
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country AS country, SUM(total) AS gross_invoice_size FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY gross_invoice_size DESC LIMIT 8

store_1.question: What are the names of the top 8 countries by total invoice size and what are those sizes?
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country, SUM(total) AS total_invoice FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY total_invoice DESC LIMIT 8

store_1.question: A list of the top 10 countries by average invoice size. List country name and average invoice size.
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country AS country, AVG(total) AS avg_invoice_size FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY avg_invoice_size DESC LIMIT 10

store_1.question: What are the names of the countries and average invoice size of the top countries by size?
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country, AVG(total) FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY AVG(total) DESC LIMIT 5

store_1.question: Find out 5 customers who most recently purchased something. List customers' first and last name.
store_1.query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM customers ORDER BY invoice_date DESC LIMIT 5

store_1.question: What are the first and last names of the 5 customers who purchased something most recently?

store_1.question: Find out the top 10 customers by total number of orders. List customers' first and last name and the number of total orders.
store_1.query: SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, COUNT(*) as total_orders FROM customers c JOIN invoices i ON c.id = i.customer_id GROUP BY c.id ORDER BY total_orders DESC LIMIT 10

store_1.question: What are the top 10 customers' first and last names by total number of orders and how many orders did they make?

store_1.question: List the top 10 customers by total gross sales. List customers' first and last name and total gross sales.
store_1.query: SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, SUM(il.unit_price * il.quantity) AS total_gross_sales FROM customers AS c JOIN invoices AS i ON c.id = i.customer_id JOIN invoice_lines AS il ON i.id = il.invoice_id GROUP BY c.id ORDER BY total_gross_sales DESC LIMIT 10

store_1.question: What are the top 10 customers' first and last names with the highest gross sales, and also what are the sales?
store_1.query: SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, SUM(il.unit_price * il.quantity) AS total_sales FROM customers AS c JOIN invoices AS i ON c.id = i.customer_id JOIN invoice_lines AS il ON i.id = il.invoice_id GROUP BY c.id ORDER BY total_sales DESC LIMIT 10

store_1.question: List the top 5 genres by number of tracks. List genres name and total tracks.

store_1.question: How many tracks does each genre have and what are the names of the top 5?

coffee_shop.question: How many members have the black membership card?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT count(*) FROM member WHERE Membership_card = 'black'

coffee_shop.question: Find the number of members living in each address.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT Address, COUNT(*) FROM member GROUP BY Address

coffee_shop.question: Give me the names of members whose address is in Harford or Waterbury.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT name FROM member WHERE address IN ('Harford', 'Waterbury')

coffee_shop.question: Find the ids and names of members who are under age 30 or with black membership card.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT Member_ID, Name FROM member WHERE Age < 30 OR Membership_card = 'black'

coffee_shop.question: Find the purchase time, age and address of each member, and show the results in the order of purchase time.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT time_of_purchase, age, address FROM member ORDER BY time_of_purchase

coffee_shop.question: Which membership card has more than 5 members?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT membership_card FROM member GROUP BY membership_card HAVING count(*) > 5

coffee_shop.question: Which address has both members younger than 30 and members older than 40?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT address FROM member WHERE age < 30 INTERSECT SELECT address FROM member WHERE age > 40

coffee_shop.question: What is the membership card held by both members living in Hartford and ones living in Waterbury address?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT T1.Membership_card FROM member AS T1 JOIN member AS T2 ON T1.Membership_card = T2.Membership_card WHERE T1.Address LIKE "%Hartford%" AND T2.Address LIKE "%Waterbury%"

coffee_shop.question: How many members are not living in Hartford?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT count(*) FROM member WHERE Address NOT LIKE '%Hartford%'

coffee_shop.question: Which address do not have any member with the black membership card?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT Address FROM shop WHERE Shop_ID NOT IN (SELECT Shop_ID FROM member WHERE Membership_card = 'black')

coffee_shop.question: Show the shop addresses ordered by their opening year.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT address FROM shop ORDER BY open_year

coffee_shop.question: What are the average score and average staff number of all shops?
Find the id and address of the shops whose score is below the average score.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT Shop_ID, Address FROM shop WHERE Score < (SELECT AVG(Score) FROM shop)

coffee_shop.question: Find the address and staff number of the shops that do not have any happy hour.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT Address, Num_of_staff FROM shop WHERE Shop_ID NOT IN (SELECT Shop_ID FROM happy_hour)

coffee_shop.question: What are the id and address of the shops which have a happy hour in May?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT shop_id, address FROM shop WHERE shop_id IN (SELECT shop_id FROM happy_hour WHERE month = 'May')

coffee_shop.question: which shop has happy hour most frequently? List its id and number of happy hours.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT shop_id, COUNT(*) AS num_of_happy_hours FROM happy_hour GROUP BY shop_id ORDER BY num_of_happy_hours DESC LIMIT 1

coffee_shop.question: Which month has the most happy hours?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT month FROM happy_hour GROUP BY month ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

coffee_shop.question: Which months have more than 2 happy hours?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT month FROM happy_hour GROUP BY month HAVING count(*) > 2

chinook_1.question: What are the album titles for albums containing both 'Reggae' and 'Rock' genre tracks?
chinook_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT a.Title FROM Album a JOIN Track t ON a.AlbumId = t.AlbumId JOIN Genre g ON t.GenreId = g.GenreId WHERE g.Name = 'Reggae' AND EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM Track t2 JOIN Genre g2 ON t2.GenreId = g2.GenreId WHERE g2.Name = 'Rock' AND t2.AlbumId = a.AlbumId)

chinook_1.question: Find the titles of albums that contain tracks of both the Reggae and Rock genres.
chinook_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.Title FROM Album AS T1 JOIN Track AS T2 ON T1.AlbumId  =  T2.AlbumId JOIN Genre AS T3 ON T2.GenreId  =  T3.GenreId WHERE T3.Name  =  "Reggae" AND T1.Title IN (SELECT DISTINCT T1.Title FROM Album AS T1 JOIN Track AS T2 ON T1.AlbumId  =  T2.AlbumId JOIN Genre AS T3 ON T2.GenreId  =  T3.GenreId WHERE T3.Name  =  "Rock")

insurance_fnol.question: Find all the phone numbers.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT Customer_Phone FROM Available_Policies UNION SELECT Customer_Phone FROM Customers_Policies JOIN Available_Policies ON Customers_Policies.Policy_ID = Available_Policies.Policy_ID

insurance_fnol.question: What are all the phone numbers?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT Customer_Phone FROM Available_Policies UNION SELECT Customer_Phone FROM Customers_Policies JOIN Available_Policies ON Customers_Policies.Policy_ID = Available_Policies.Policy_ID

insurance_fnol.question: What are the customer phone numbers under the policy "Life Insurance"?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT ap.customer_phone FROM available_policies AS ap JOIN customers_policies AS cp ON ap.policy_id = cp.policy_id WHERE ap.policy_type_code = "Life Insurance"

insurance_fnol.question: What are the phone numbers of customers using the policy with the code "Life Insurance"?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT customer_phone FROM available_policies AS t1 JOIN customers_policies AS t2 ON t1.policy_id = t2.policy_id WHERE t1.policy_type_code = "Life Insurance"

insurance_fnol.question: Which policy type has the most records in the database?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT policy_type_code, COUNT(*) FROM Available_Policies GROUP BY policy_type_code ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_fnol.question: Which policy type appears most frequently in the available policies?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT policy_type_code FROM available_policies GROUP BY policy_type_code ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_fnol.question: What are all the customer phone numbers under the most popular policy type?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT DISTINCT ap.customer_phone FROM available_policies AS ap JOIN customers_policies AS cp ON ap.policy_id = cp.policy_id WHERE ap.policy_type_code = (SELECT policy_type_code FROM available_policies GROUP BY policy_type_code ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1)

insurance_fnol.question: Find the phone numbers of customers using the most common policy type among the available policies.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT ap.customer_phone FROM available_policies AS ap JOIN (SELECT policy_type_code FROM available_policies GROUP BY policy_type_code ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1) AS t ON ap.policy_type_code = t.policy_type_code

insurance_fnol.question: Find the policy type used by more than 4 customers.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT policy_type_code FROM available_policies GROUP BY policy_type_code HAVING count(DISTINCT customer_phone) > 4

insurance_fnol.question: Find the policy types more than 4 customers use. Show their type code.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT policy_type_code FROM Available_Policies GROUP BY policy_type_code HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT Customer_Phone) > 4

insurance_fnol.question: Find the total and average amount of settlements.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT sum(Settlement_Amount), avg(Settlement_Amount) FROM Settlements

insurance_fnol.question: Return the sum and average of all settlement amounts.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT sum(Settlement_Amount), avg(Settlement_Amount) FROM Settlements

insurance_fnol.question: Find the name of services that have been used for more than 2 times in first notification of loss.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT t2.service_name FROM first_notification_of_loss AS t1 JOIN services AS t2 ON t1.service_id = t2.service_id GROUP BY t2.service_name HAVING count(*) > 2

insurance_fnol.question: Which services have been used more than twice in first notification of loss? Return the service name.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT t2.service_name FROM first_notification_of_loss AS t1 JOIN services AS t2 ON t1.service_id  =  t2.service_id GROUP BY t2.service_name HAVING count(*)  >  2

insurance_fnol.question: What is the effective date of the claim that has the largest amount of total settlement?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT T1.effective_date FROM Claims AS T1 JOIN (SELECT claim_id, sum(settlement_amount) AS total_settlement FROM Settlements GROUP BY claim_id ORDER BY total_settlement DESC LIMIT 1) AS T2 ON T1.claim_id = T2.claim_id

insurance_fnol.question: Find the claim that has the largest total settlement amount. Return the effective date of the claim.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT T1.effective_date FROM Claims AS T1 JOIN Settlements AS T2 ON T1.claim_id = T2.claim_id GROUP BY T1.claim_id ORDER BY SUM(T2.settlement_amount) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_fnol.question: What is the name of the customer who has the most policies listed?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT customer_name FROM customers JOIN customers_policies ON customers.customer_id = customers_policies.customer_id GROUP BY customers.customer_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_fnol.question: Which customer uses the most policies? Give me the customer name.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN customers_policies AS t2 ON t1.customer_id = t2.customer_id GROUP BY t1.customer_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_fnol.question: What are all the policy types of the customer named "Dayana Robel"?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT policy_type_code FROM available_policies AS t1 JOIN customers_policies AS t2 ON t1.policy_id = t2.policy_id JOIN customers AS t3 ON t2.customer_id = t3.customer_id WHERE t3.customer_name = "Dayana Robel"

insurance_fnol.question: Tell me the types of the policy used by the customer named "Dayana Robel".

insurance_fnol.question: What are all the policy types of the customer that has the most policies listed?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT policy_type_code FROM available_policies WHERE policy_id IN (SELECT policy_id FROM customers_policies WHERE customer_id = (SELECT customer_id FROM customers ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1))

insurance_fnol.question: List all the policy types used by the customer enrolled in the most policies.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT policy_type_code FROM available_policies WHERE customer_phone = (SELECT customer_phone FROM available_policies JOIN customers_policies ON available_policies.policy_id = customers_policies.policy_id GROUP BY customer_phone ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1)

insurance_fnol.question: Find the names of customers who have used either the service "Close a policy" or the service "Upgrade a policy".
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN customers_policies AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id JOIN available_policies AS t3 ON t2.policy_id  =  t3.policy_id JOIN services AS t4 ON t3.customer_phone  =  t4.service_id WHERE t4.service_name  =  "Close a policy" OR t4.service_name  =  "Upgrade a policy"

insurance_fnol.question: Which customers have used the service named "Close a policy" or "Upgrade a policy"? Give me the customer names.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT DISTINCT c.customer_name FROM customers AS c JOIN customers_policies AS cp ON c.customer_id = cp.customer_id JOIN available_policies AS ap ON cp.policy_id = ap.policy_id JOIN services AS s ON ap.service_id = s.service_id WHERE s.service_name IN ("Close a policy", "Upgrade a policy")

insurance_fnol.question: Find the names of customers who have used both the service "Close a policy" and the service "New policy application".
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT DISTINCT c.customer_name FROM customers c JOIN customers_policies cp ON c.customer_id = cp.customer_id JOIN available_policies ap ON cp.policy_id = ap.policy_id JOIN first_notification_of_loss fnol ON cp.customer_id = fnol.customer_id AND cp.policy_id = fnol.policy_id JOIN services s ON fnol.service_id = s.service_id WHERE s.service_name = "Close a policy" AND c.customer_name IN (SELECT c2.customer_name FROM customers c2 JOIN customers_policies cp2 ON c2.customer_id = cp2.customer_id JOIN available_policies ap2 ON cp2.policy_id = ap2

insurance_fnol.question: Which customers have used both the service named "Close a policy" and the service named "Upgrade a policy"? Give me the customer names.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT DISTINCT c.customer_name FROM Customers c JOIN Customers_Policies cp ON c.customer_id = cp.customer_id JOIN Available_Policies ap ON cp.policy_id = ap.policy_id JOIN First_Notification_of_Loss fnol ON cp.customer_id = fnol.customer_id AND cp.policy_id = fnol.policy_id JOIN Services s ON fnol.service_id = s.service_id WHERE s.service_name IN ('Close a policy', 'Upgrade a policy') GROUP BY c.customer_name HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT s.service_name) = 2

medicine_enzyme_interaction.query: SELECT name FROM enzyme ORDER BY name DESC
