college_1.question: What is the average gpa of the students enrolled in the course with code ACCT-211?
college_1.query: SELECT AVG(STU_GPA) FROM STUDENT JOIN ENROLL ON STUDENT.STU_NUM = ENROLL.STU_NUM JOIN CLASS ON ENROLL.CLASS_CODE = CLASS.CLASS_CODE JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE WHERE COURSE.CRS_CODE = "ACCT-211";

college_1.question: What is the average GPA of students taking ACCT-211?
college_1.query: SELECT AVG(STU_GPA) FROM STUDENT JOIN ENROLL ON STUDENT.STU_NUM = ENROLL.STU_NUM JOIN CLASS ON ENROLL.CLASS_CODE = CLASS.CLASS_CODE JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE WHERE COURSE.CRS_CODE = 'ACCT-211';

college_1.question: What is the first name, gpa and phone number of the top 5 students with highest gpa?
college_1.query: SELECT STU_FNAME, STU_GPA, STU_PHONE FROM STUDENT ORDER BY STU_GPA DESC LIMIT 5

college_1.question: What is the first name, GPA, and phone number of the students with the top 5 GPAs?
college_1.query: SELECT STU_FNAME, STU_GPA, STU_PHONE FROM STUDENT ORDER BY STU_GPA DESC LIMIT 5

college_1.question: What is the department name of the students with lowest gpa belongs to?
college_1.query: SELECT DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME FROM DEPARTMENT JOIN STUDENT ON DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE = STUDENT.DEPT_CODE WHERE STUDENT.STU_GPA = (SELECT MIN(STU_GPA) FROM STUDENT);

college_1.question: What is the name of the department with the student that has the lowest GPA?
college_1.query: SELECT DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME FROM DEPARTMENT JOIN STUDENT ON DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE = STUDENT.DEPT_CODE WHERE STUDENT.STU_GPA = (SELECT MIN(STU_GPA) FROM STUDENT);

college_1.question: Find the first name and gpa of the students whose gpa is lower than the average gpa of all students.
college_1.query: SELECT STU_FNAME, STU_GPA FROM STUDENT WHERE STU_GPA < (SELECT AVG(STU_GPA) FROM STUDENT)

college_1.question: What is the first name and GPA of every student that has a GPA lower than average?
college_1.query: SELECT STU_FNAME, STU_GPA FROM STUDENT WHERE STU_GPA < (SELECT AVG(STU_GPA) FROM STUDENT)

college_1.question: Find the name and address of the department that has the highest number of students.
college_1.query: SELECT DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME, DEPARTMENT.DEPT_ADDRESS FROM DEPARTMENT JOIN STUDENT ON DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE = STUDENT.DEPT_CODE GROUP BY DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

college_1.question: What is the name and address of the department with the most students?
college_1.query: SELECT DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME, DEPARTMENT.DEPT_ADDRESS FROM DEPARTMENT JOIN COURSE ON DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE = COURSE.DEPT_CODE JOIN CLASS ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE JOIN ENROLL ON ENROLL.CLASS_CODE = CLASS.CLASS_CODE GROUP BY DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT ENROLL.STU_NUM) DESC LIMIT 1;

college_1.question: Find the name, address, number of students in the departments that have the top 3 highest number of students.
college_1.query: SELECT T1.DEPT_NAME, T1.DEPT_ADDRESS, COUNT(T2.STU_NUM) AS NUM_STUDENTS FROM DEPARTMENT AS T1 JOIN STUDENT AS T2 ON T1.DEPT_CODE = T2.DEPT_CODE GROUP BY T1.DEPT_CODE ORDER BY NUM_STUDENTS DESC LIMIT 3;

college_1.question: What is the name, address, and number of students in the departments that have the 3 most students?
college_1.query: SELECT T1.DEPT_NAME, T1.DEPT_ADDRESS, COUNT(*) AS num_students FROM DEPARTMENT AS T1 JOIN STUDENT AS T2 ON T1.DEPT_CODE = T2.DEPT_CODE GROUP BY T1.DEPT_CODE ORDER BY num_students DESC LIMIT 3;

college_1.question: Find the first name and office of the professor who is in the history department and has a Ph.D. degree.
college_1.query: SELECT EMP_FNAME, PROF_OFFICE FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN PROFESSOR ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM JOIN DEPARTMENT ON PROFESSOR.DEPT_CODE = DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE WHERE DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME = "History" AND EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM IN (SELECT EMP_NUM FROM PROFESSOR WHERE PROF_HIGH_DEGREE = "Ph.D.")

college_1.question: What are the first names and office of the professors who are in the history department and have a Ph.D?
college_1.query: SELECT EMPLOYEE.EMP_FNAME, PROFESSOR.PROF_OFFICE FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN PROFESSOR ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM JOIN DEPARTMENT ON PROFESSOR.DEPT_CODE = DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE WHERE DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME = 'History' AND EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM IN (SELECT EMP_NUM FROM PROFESSOR WHERE PROF_HIGH_DEGREE = 'Ph.D')

college_1.question: Find the first names of all instructors who have taught some course and the course code.
college_1.query: SELECT EMPLOYEE.EMP_FNAME, COURSE.CRS_CODE FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN CLASS ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = CLASS.PROF_NUM JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE

college_1.question: What are the first names of all teachers who have taught a course and the corresponding course codes?
college_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT EMPLOYEE.EMP_FNAME, COURSE.CRS_CODE FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN CLASS ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = CLASS.PROF_NUM JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE;

college_1.question: Find the first names of all instructors who have taught some course and the course description.
college_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT EMPLOYEE.EMP_FNAME, COURSE.CRS_DESCRIPTION FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN CLASS ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = CLASS.PROF_NUM JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE

college_1.question: What are the first names of all teachers who have taught a course and the corresponding descriptions?
college_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT EMPLOYEE.EMP_FNAME, COURSE.CRS_DESCRIPTION FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN CLASS ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = CLASS.PROF_NUM JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE

college_1.question: Find the first names and offices of all instructors who have taught some course and also find the course description.
college_1.query: SELECT T2.EMP_FNAME, T3.CRS_DESCRIPTION, T4.PROF_OFFICE FROM CLASS AS T1 JOIN EMPLOYEE AS T2 ON T1.PROF_NUM = T2.EMP_NUM JOIN COURSE AS T3 ON T1.CRS_CODE = T3.CRS_CODE JOIN PROFESSOR AS T4 ON T1.PROF_NUM = T4.EMP_NUM;

college_1.question: What are the first names, office locations of all lecturers who have taught some course?
college_1.query: SELECT EMP_FNAME, PROF_OFFICE FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN PROFESSOR ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM WHERE EMP_JOBCODE = 'Lecturer' AND EMP_NUM IN (SELECT PROF_NUM FROM CLASS)

college_1.question: Find the first names and offices of all instructors who have taught some course and the course description and the department name.
college_1.query: SELECT T3.EMP_FNAME, T4.PROF_OFFICE, T2.CRS_DESCRIPTION, T1.DEPT_NAME FROM CLASS AS T5 JOIN COURSE AS T2 ON T5.CRS_CODE = T2.CRS_CODE JOIN DEPARTMENT AS T1 ON T2.DEPT_CODE = T1.DEPT_CODE JOIN EMPLOYEE AS T3 ON T5.PROF_NUM = T3.EMP_NUM JOIN PROFESSOR AS T4 ON T3.EMP_NUM = T4.EMP_NUM;

college_1.question: What are the first names, office locations, and departments of all instructors, and also what are the descriptions of the courses they teach?
college_1.query: SELECT EMP_FNAME, PROF_OFFICE, DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME, CRS_DESCRIPTION FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN PROFESSOR ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM JOIN DEPARTMENT ON PROFESSOR.DEPT_CODE = DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE JOIN COURSE ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = COURSE.PROF_NUM ORDER BY EMP_FNAME;

college_1.question: Find names of all students who took some course and the course description.
college_1.query: SELECT STUDENT.STU_LNAME, STUDENT.STU_FNAME, COURSE.CRS_DESCRIPTION FROM STUDENT JOIN ENROLL ON STUDENT.STU_NUM = ENROLL.STU_NUM JOIN CLASS ON ENROLL.CLASS_CODE = CLASS.CLASS_CODE JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE;

college_1.question: What are the names of all students who took a class and the corresponding course descriptions?
college_1.query: SELECT STUDENT.STU_LNAME, STUDENT.STU_FNAME, COURSE.CRS_DESCRIPTION FROM STUDENT JOIN ENROLL ON STUDENT.STU_NUM = ENROLL.STU_NUM JOIN CLASS ON ENROLL.CLASS_CODE = CLASS.CLASS_CODE JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE;

college_1.question: Find names of all students who took some course and got A or C.
college_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT STU_LNAME, STU_FNAME FROM STUDENT JOIN ENROLL ON STUDENT.STU_NUM = ENROLL.STU_NUM WHERE ENROLL_GRADE IN ('A', 'C')

college_1.question: What are the names of all students taking a course who received an A or C?
college_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT STU_FNAME, STU_LNAME FROM STUDENT JOIN ENROLL ON STUDENT.STU_NUM = ENROLL.STU_NUM WHERE ENROLL_GRADE IN ('A', 'C')

college_1.question: Find the first names of all professors in the Accounting department who is teaching some course and the class room.
college_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT EMPLOYEE.EMP_FNAME, CLASS.CLASS_ROOM FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN PROFESSOR ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM JOIN DEPARTMENT ON PROFESSOR.DEPT_CODE = DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE JOIN COURSE ON DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE = COURSE.DEPT_CODE JOIN CLASS ON COURSE.CRS_CODE = CLASS.CRS_CODE WHERE DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME = 'Accounting' AND CLASS.CLASS_ROOM IS NOT NULL;

college_1.question: What are the first names of all Accounting professors who teach and what are the classrooms of the courses they teach?
college_1.query: SELECT EMP_FNAME, CLASS_ROOM FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN PROFESSOR ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM JOIN CLASS ON PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM = CLASS.PROF_NUM JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE WHERE COURSE.DEPT_CODE = 'ACC';

college_1.question: Find the first names and degree of all professors who are teaching some class in Computer Info. Systems department.
college_1.query: SELECT EMP_FNAME, PROF_HIGH_DEGREE FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN PROFESSOR ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM JOIN DEPARTMENT ON PROFESSOR.DEPT_CODE = DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE JOIN CLASS ON PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM = CLASS.PROF_NUM JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE WHERE DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME = 'Computer Info. Systems'

college_1.question: What are the different first names and highest degree attained for professors teaching in the Computer Information Systems department?
college_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT EMP_FNAME, PROF_HIGH_DEGREE FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN PROFESSOR ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM JOIN DEPARTMENT ON PROFESSOR.DEPT_CODE = DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE WHERE DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME = "Computer Information Systems"

college_1.question: What is the last name of the student who got a grade A in the class with code 10018.
college_1.query: SELECT STUDENT.STU_LNAME FROM STUDENT JOIN ENROLL ON STUDENT.STU_NUM = ENROLL.STU_NUM JOIN CLASS ON ENROLL.CLASS_CODE = CLASS.CLASS_CODE WHERE CLASS.CLASS_CODE = 10018 AND ENROLL.ENROLL_GRADE = 'A';

college_1.question: What is the last name of the student who received an A in the class with the code 10018?
college_1.query: SELECT STUDENT.STU_LNAME FROM ENROLL JOIN STUDENT ON ENROLL.STU_NUM = STUDENT.STU_NUM WHERE ENROLL.CLASS_CODE = '10018' AND ENROLL.ENROLL_GRADE = 'A'

college_1.question: Find the first name and office of history professor who did not get a Ph.D. degree.
college_1.query: SELECT EMP_FNAME, PROF_OFFICE FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN PROFESSOR ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM WHERE EMP_JOBCODE = 'Professor' AND EMP_NUM NOT IN (SELECT EMP_NUM FROM PROFESSOR WHERE PROF_HIGH_DEGREE = 'Ph.D.' AND DEPT_CODE IN (SELECT DEPT_CODE FROM DEPARTMENT WHERE DEPT_NAME = 'History')) AND DEPT_CODE IN (SELECT DEPT_CODE FROM DEPARTMENT WHERE DEPT_NAME = 'History')

college_1.question: What are the first names and offices of history professors who don't have Ph.D.s?
college_1.query: SELECT EMP_FNAME, PROF_OFFICE FROM EMPLOYEE JOIN PROFESSOR ON EMPLOYEE.EMP_NUM = PROFESSOR.EMP_NUM JOIN DEPARTMENT ON PROFESSOR.DEPT_CODE = DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE WHERE DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME = 'History' AND EMP_NUM NOT IN (SELECT EMP_NUM FROM PROFESSOR WHERE PROF_HIGH_DEGREE = 'Ph.D.')

college_1.question: Find the first names of professors who are teaching more than one class.
college_1.query: SELECT EMP_FNAME FROM EMPLOYEE WHERE EMP_NUM IN (SELECT PROF_NUM FROM CLASS GROUP BY PROF_NUM HAVING COUNT(*) > 1) AND EMP_JOBCODE = 'Professor';

college_1.question: What are the first names of all professors who teach more than one class?
college_1.query: SELECT EMP_FNAME FROM EMPLOYEE WHERE EMP_NUM IN (SELECT PROF_NUM FROM CLASS GROUP BY PROF_NUM HAVING COUNT(*) > 1) AND EMP_JOBCODE = 'Professor';

college_1.question: Find the first names of students who took exactly one class.
college_1.query: SELECT STU_FNAME FROM STUDENT WHERE STU_NUM IN (SELECT STU_NUM FROM ENROLL GROUP BY STU_NUM HAVING COUNT(*) = 1)

college_1.question: What are the first names of student who only took one course?
college_1.query: SELECT STU_FNAME FROM STUDENT WHERE STU_NUM IN (SELECT STU_NUM FROM ENROLL GROUP BY STU_NUM HAVING COUNT(*) = 1)

college_1.question: Find the name of department that offers the class whose description has the word "Statistics".
college_1.query: SELECT DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME FROM DEPARTMENT JOIN COURSE ON DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE = COURSE.DEPT_CODE JOIN CLASS ON COURSE.CRS_CODE = CLASS.CRS_CODE WHERE COURSE.CRS_DESCRIPTION LIKE '%Statistics%'

college_1.question: What is the name of the department that offers a course that has a description including the word "Statistics"?
college_1.query: SELECT DEPARTMENT.DEPT_NAME FROM DEPARTMENT JOIN COURSE ON DEPARTMENT.DEPT_CODE = COURSE.DEPT_CODE WHERE COURSE.CRS_DESCRIPTION LIKE '%Statistics%'

college_1.question: What is the first name of the student whose last name starting with the letter S and is taking ACCT-211 class?
college_1.query: SELECT STUDENT.STU_FNAME FROM STUDENT JOIN ENROLL ON STUDENT.STU_NUM = ENROLL.STU_NUM JOIN CLASS ON ENROLL.CLASS_CODE = CLASS.CLASS_CODE JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE WHERE STUDENT.STU_LNAME LIKE 'S%' AND COURSE.CRS_CODE = 'ACCT-211';

college_1.question: What is the first name of the student whose last name starts with the letter S and is taking ACCT-211?
college_1.query: SELECT STUDENT.STU_FNAME FROM STUDENT JOIN ENROLL ON STUDENT.STU_NUM = ENROLL.STU_NUM JOIN CLASS ON ENROLL.CLASS_CODE = CLASS.CLASS_CODE JOIN COURSE ON CLASS.CRS_CODE = COURSE.CRS_CODE WHERE STUDENT.STU_LNAME LIKE 'S%' AND COURSE.CRS_CODE = 'ACCT-211';

sports_competition.question: How many clubs are there?
sports_competition.query: SELECT count(*) FROM club

sports_competition.question: What is the total number of clubs?
sports_competition.query: SELECT count(*) FROM club

sports_competition.question: List the distinct region of clubs in ascending alphabetical order.
sports_competition.query: SELECT DISTINCT Region FROM club ORDER BY Region ASC

sports_competition.question: What are the different regions of clubs in ascending alphabetical order?
sports_competition.query: SELECT DISTINCT Region FROM club ORDER BY Region ASC

sports_competition.question: What is the average number of gold medals for clubs?
sports_competition.query: SELECT AVG(Gold) FROM club_rank

sports_competition.question: What is the average number of gold medals for a club?
sports_competition.query: SELECT AVG(Gold) FROM club_rank

sports_competition.question: What are the types and countries of competitions?
sports_competition.query: SELECT Competition_type ,  Country FROM competition

sports_competition.question: What are the types of every competition and in which countries are they located?
sports_competition.query: SELECT Competition_type, Country FROM competition

sports_competition.question: What are the distinct years in which the competitions type is not "Tournament"?
sports_competition.query: SELECT DISTINCT Year FROM competition WHERE Competition_type <> "Tournament"

sports_competition.question: What are the different years for all competitions that are not of type equal to tournament?
sports_competition.query: SELECT DISTINCT Year FROM competition WHERE Competition_type != "Tournament"

sports_competition.question: What are the maximum and minimum number of silver medals for clubs.
sports_competition.query: SELECT MAX(Silver), MIN(Silver) FROM club_rank

sports_competition.question: What are the maximum and minimum number of silver medals for all the clubs?
sports_competition.query: SELECT MAX(Silver), MIN(Silver) FROM club_rank

sports_competition.question: How many clubs have total medals less than 10?
sports_competition.query: SELECT count(*) FROM (SELECT Club_ID, SUM(Gold + Silver + Bronze) AS Total_Medals FROM club_rank GROUP BY Club_ID HAVING Total_Medals < 10) AS T1

sports_competition.question: What is the total number of clubs that have less than 10 medals in total?
sports_competition.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT Club_ID, SUM(Gold + Silver + Bronze) AS Total_Medals FROM club_rank GROUP BY Club_ID HAVING Total_Medals < 10) AS T1

sports_competition.question: List all club names in ascending order of start year.
sports_competition.query: SELECT name FROM club ORDER BY Start_year ASC

sports_competition.question: What are the names of all the clubs starting with the oldest?
sports_competition.query: SELECT name FROM club ORDER BY Start_year ASC

sports_competition.question: List all club names in descending alphabetical order.
sports_competition.query: SELECT name FROM club ORDER BY name DESC

sports_competition.question: What are the names of all the clubs ordered in descending alphabetical order?
sports_competition.query: SELECT name FROM club ORDER BY name DESC

sports_competition.question: Please show the names and the players of clubs.
sports_competition.query: SELECT T1.name, T2.name FROM club AS T1 JOIN player AS T2 ON T1.Club_ID = T2.Club_ID

sports_competition.question: What are the names and players of all the clubs?
sports_competition.query: SELECT T1.name, T2.name FROM club AS T1 JOIN player AS T2 ON T1.Club_ID = T2.Club_ID

sports_competition.question: Show the names of clubs that have players with position "Right Wing".
sports_competition.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.name FROM club AS T1 JOIN player AS T2 ON T1.Club_ID = T2.Club_ID WHERE T2.Position = "Right Wing"

sports_competition.question: What are the names of the clubs that have players in the position of "Right Wing"?
sports_competition.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.name FROM club AS T1 JOIN player AS T2 ON T1.Club_ID = T2.Club_ID WHERE T2.Position = "Right Wing"

sports_competition.question: What is the average points of players from club with name "AIB".
sports_competition.query: SELECT AVG(Points) FROM player WHERE Club_ID = (SELECT Club_ID FROM club WHERE name = "AIB")

sports_competition.question: What is the average number of points for players from the "AIB" club?
sports_competition.query: SELECT AVG(Points) FROM player WHERE Club_ID = (SELECT Club_ID FROM club WHERE name = "AIB")

sports_competition.question: List the position of players and the average number of points of players of each position.
sports_competition.query: SELECT Position, AVG(Points) FROM player GROUP BY Position

sports_competition.question: For each position, what is the average number of points for players in that position?
sports_competition.query: SELECT Position, AVG(Points) FROM player GROUP BY Position

sports_competition.question: List the position of players with average number of points scored by players of that position bigger than 20.
sports_competition.query: SELECT Position FROM player GROUP BY Position HAVING AVG(Points) > 20

sports_competition.question: What are the positions of players whose average number of points scored by that position is larger than 20?
sports_competition.query: SELECT Position FROM player GROUP BY Position HAVING AVG(Points) > 20

sports_competition.question: List the types of competition and the number of competitions of each type.
sports_competition.query: SELECT Competition_type, COUNT(*) FROM competition GROUP BY Competition_type

sports_competition.question: What are the types of competition and number of competitions for that type?
sports_competition.query: SELECT Competition_type, COUNT(*) FROM competition GROUP BY Competition_type

sports_competition.question: List the most common type of competition.
sports_competition.query: SELECT Competition_type FROM competition GROUP BY Competition_type ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

sports_competition.question: What is the most common competition type?
sports_competition.query: SELECT Competition_type FROM competition GROUP BY Competition_type ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

sports_competition.question: List the types of competition that have at most five competitions of that type.
sports_competition.query: SELECT Competition_type FROM competition GROUP BY Competition_type HAVING COUNT(*) <= 5

sports_competition.question: What are the types of competition that have most 5 competitions for that type?
sports_competition.query: SELECT Competition_type FROM competition GROUP BY Competition_type HAVING COUNT(*) >= 5 ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC

sports_competition.question: List the names of clubs that do not have any players.
sports_competition.query: SELECT name FROM club WHERE Club_ID NOT IN (SELECT Club_ID FROM player)

sports_competition.question: What are the names of all clubs that do not have any players?
sports_competition.query: SELECT name FROM club WHERE Club_ID NOT IN (SELECT Club_ID FROM player)

sports_competition.question: What are the positions with both players having more than 20 points and less than 10 points.
sports_competition.query: SELECT T1.Position FROM player AS T1 WHERE T1.Points > 20 INTERSECT SELECT T1.Position FROM player AS T1 WHERE T1.Points < 10

sports_competition.question: What are the positions of both players that have more than 20 20 points and less than 10 points?
sports_competition.query: SELECT T1.Position FROM player AS T1 WHERE T1.Points > 20 INTERSECT SELECT T1.Position FROM player AS T1 WHERE T1.Points < 10

sports_competition.question: Show total points of all players.
sports_competition.query: SELECT SUM(Points) FROM player

sports_competition.question: What is the total number of points for all players?
sports_competition.query: SELECT SUM(Points) FROM player

sports_competition.question: how many different positions are there?
sports_competition.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Position) FROM player

sports_competition.question: How many different position for players are listed?
sports_competition.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Position) FROM player

sports_competition.question: what are the name of players who get more than the average points.
sports_competition.query: SELECT name FROM player WHERE Points > (SELECT AVG(Points) FROM player)

sports_competition.question: What are the names of all players that got more than the average number of points?
sports_competition.query: SELECT name FROM player WHERE Points > (SELECT AVG(Points) FROM player)

sports_competition.question: find the number of players whose points are lower than 30 in each position.
sports_competition.query: SELECT Position, COUNT(*) FROM player WHERE Points < 30 GROUP BY Position

sports_competition.question: What is the number of players who have points less than 30 for each position?
sports_competition.query: SELECT Position, COUNT(*) FROM player WHERE Points < 30 GROUP BY Position

sports_competition.question: which country did participated in the most number of Tournament competitions?
sports_competition.query: SELECT T3.Country, COUNT(*) FROM competition_result AS T1 JOIN competition AS T2 ON T1.Competition_ID = T2.Competition_ID JOIN country AS T3 ON T2.Country = T3.Country_name WHERE T2.Competition_type = "Tournament" GROUP BY T3.Country ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

sports_competition.question: what is the name of the country that participated in the most tournament competitions?
sports_competition.query: SELECT T3.Country, COUNT(*) FROM competition_result AS T1 JOIN competition AS T2 ON T1.Competition_ID = T2.Competition_ID JOIN country AS T3 ON T2.Country = T3.Country_name GROUP BY T3.Country ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

sports_competition.question: which countries did participated in both Friendly and Tournament type competitions.
sports_competition.query: SELECT T1.Country FROM (SELECT Country, Competition_type FROM competition WHERE Competition_type = "Friendly") AS T1 JOIN (SELECT Country, Competition_type FROM competition WHERE Competition_type = "Tournament") AS T2 ON T1.Country = T2.Country

sports_competition.question: What are the countries that participated in both friendly and tournament type competitions?
sports_competition.query: SELECT T1.Country FROM competition AS T1 JOIN competition_result AS T2 ON T1.Competition_ID = T2.Competition_ID WHERE T1.Competition_type = "Friendly" INTERSECT SELECT T1.Country FROM competition AS T1 JOIN competition_result AS T2 ON T1.Competition_ID = T2.Competition_ID WHERE T1.Competition_type = "Tournament"

sports_competition.question: Find the countries that have never participated in any competition with Friendly type.
sports_competition.query: SELECT DISTINCT Country FROM competition WHERE Country NOT IN (SELECT Country FROM competition WHERE Competition_type = 'Friendly')

sports_competition.question: What are the countries that have never participated in any friendly-type competitions?
sports_competition.query: SELECT DISTINCT Country FROM competition WHERE Competition_type != "Friendly" AND Country NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT Country FROM competition WHERE Competition_type = "Friendly")

manufacturer.question: How many furniture components are there in total?
Return the name and id of the furniture with the highest market rate.
manufacturer.query: SELECT Furniture_ID, Name FROM furniture WHERE Market_Rate = (SELECT MAX(Market_Rate) FROM furniture)

manufacturer.question: find the total market rate of the furnitures that have the top 2 market shares.
manufacturer.query: SELECT SUM(T1.Market_Rate) FROM furniture AS T1 JOIN (SELECT Furniture_ID FROM furniture_manufacte GROUP BY Furniture_ID ORDER BY SUM(Price_in_Dollar) DESC LIMIT 2) AS T2 ON T1.Furniture_ID = T2.Furniture_ID

manufacturer.question: Find the component amounts and names of all furnitures that have more than 10 components.
manufacturer.query: SELECT Num_of_Component, Name FROM furniture WHERE Num_of_Component > 10

manufacturer.question: Find the name and component amount of the least popular furniture.
manufacturer.query: SELECT Name, Num_of_Component FROM furniture ORDER BY Market_Rate ASC LIMIT 1

manufacturer.question: Find the names of furnitures whose prices are lower than the highest price.
manufacturer.query: SELECT Name FROM furniture WHERE Price_in_Dollar < (SELECT MAX(Price_in_Dollar) FROM furniture_manufacte)

manufacturer.question: Which manufacturer has the most number of shops? List its name and year of opening.
manufacturer.query: SELECT Name, Open_Year FROM manufacturer ORDER BY Num_of_Shops DESC LIMIT 1

manufacturer.question: Find the average number of factories for the manufacturers that have more than 20 shops.
manufacturer.query: SELECT AVG(Num_of_Factories) FROM manufacturer WHERE Num_of_Shops > 20

manufacturer.question: List all manufacturer names and ids ordered by their opening year.
manufacturer.query: SELECT Manufacturer_ID, Name FROM manufacturer ORDER BY Open_Year ASC

manufacturer.question: Give me the name and year of opening of the manufacturers that have either less than 10 factories or more than 10 shops.
manufacturer.query: SELECT Name, Open_Year FROM manufacturer WHERE Num_of_Factories < 10 OR Num_of_Shops > 10

manufacturer.question: what is the average number of factories and maximum number of shops for manufacturers that opened before 1990.
manufacturer.query: SELECT AVG(Num_of_Factories), MAX(Num_of_Shops) FROM manufacturer WHERE Open_Year < 1990

manufacturer.question: Find the id and number of shops for the company that produces the most expensive furniture.
manufacturer.query: SELECT T1.Manufacturer_ID ,  T2.Num_of_Shops FROM manufacturer AS T1 JOIN furniture_manufacte AS T3 ON T1.Manufacturer_ID  =  T3.Manufacturer_ID JOIN furniture AS T4 ON T3.Furniture_ID  =  T4.Furniture_ID JOIN market AS T2 ON T1.Manufacturer_ID  =  T2.Market_ID WHERE T4.Market_Rate  = (SELECT MAX(Market_Rate) FROM furniture)

manufacturer.question: Find the number of funiture types produced by each manufacturer as well as the company names.
manufacturer.query: SELECT T1.Name, COUNT(T2.Furniture_ID) AS Num_of_Furniture_Types FROM manufacturer AS T1 JOIN furniture_manufacte AS T2 ON T1.Manufacturer_ID = T2.Manufacturer_ID GROUP BY T1.Name

manufacturer.question: Give me the names and prices of furnitures which some companies are manufacturing.
manufacturer.query: SELECT T2.Name, T3.Price_in_Dollar FROM furniture_manufacte AS T1 JOIN furniture AS T2 ON T1.Furniture_ID = T2.Furniture_ID JOIN manufacturer AS T3 ON T1.Manufacturer_ID = T3.Manufacturer_ID

manufacturer.question: Find the market shares and names of furnitures which no any company is producing in our records.
manufacturer.query: SELECT f.Name, (SUM(furniture_manufacte.Price_in_Dollar) / (SELECT SUM(Price_in_Dollar) FROM furniture_manufacte)) AS market_share FROM furniture AS f LEFT JOIN furniture_manufacte AS fm ON f.Furniture_ID = fm.Furniture_ID WHERE fm.Manufacturer_ID IS NULL GROUP BY f.Name

manufacturer.question: Find the name of the company that produces both furnitures with less than 6 components and furnitures with more than 10 components.
manufacturer.query: SELECT m.Name FROM manufacturer AS m JOIN furniture_manufacte AS fm ON m.Manufacturer_ID = fm.Manufacturer_ID JOIN furniture AS f ON fm.Furniture_ID = f.Furniture_ID WHERE f.Num_of_Component < 6 INTERSECT SELECT m.Name FROM manufacturer AS m JOIN furniture_manufacte AS fm ON m.Manufacturer_ID = fm.Manufacturer_ID JOIN furniture AS f ON fm.Furniture_ID = f.Furniture_ID WHERE f.Num_of_Component > 10

hr_1.question: Display the first name and department name for each employee.
hr_1.query: SELECT first_name, department_name FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.department_id = departments.department_id

hr_1.question: What are the first name and department name of all employees?
hr_1.query: SELECT first_name, department_name FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.department_id = departments.department_id

hr_1.question: List the full name (first and last name), and salary for those employees who earn below 6000.
hr_1.query: SELECT first_name, last_name, salary FROM employees WHERE salary < 6000

hr_1.question: What are the full names and salaries for any employees earning less than 6000?
hr_1.query: SELECT CONCAT(first_name, ' ', last_name) AS full_name, salary FROM employees WHERE salary < 6000

hr_1.question: Display the first name, and department number for all employees whose last name is "McEwen".

hr_1.question: display job Title, the difference between minimum and maximum salaries for those jobs which max salary within the range 12000 to 18000.

hr_1.question: display the employee ID for each employee and the date on which he ended his previous job.

hr_1.question: display those departments where more than ten employees work who got a commission percentage.
hr_1.query: SELECT departments.department_name FROM departments JOIN employees ON departments.department_id = employees.department_id WHERE employees.commission_pct IS NOT NULL GROUP BY departments.department_name HAVING COUNT(*) > 10

hr_1.question: What are the department ids for which more than 10 employees had a commission?

hr_1.question: What is the average salary of employees who have a commission percentage that is not null?

hr_1.question: display the country ID and number of cities for each country.

hr_1.question: display job ID for those jobs that were done by two or more for more than 300 days.
hr_1.query: SELECT job_id FROM job_history GROUP BY job_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT employee_id) >= 2 AND SUM(DATEDIFF(end_date, start_date)) > 300

hr_1.question: What are the job ids for jobs done more than once for a period of more than 300 days?

hr_1.question: display the ID for those employees who did two or more jobs in the past.

hr_1.question: Find employee with ID and name of the country presently where (s)he is working.

hr_1.question: What are all the employee ids and the names of the countries in which they work?
hr_1.query: SELECT employees.employee_id, countries.country_name FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.department_id = departments.department_id JOIN locations ON departments.location_id = locations.location_id JOIN countries ON locations.country_id = countries.country_id ORDER BY employees.employee_id

hr_1.question: display the department name and number of employees in each of the department.

hr_1.question: Find the ids of the employees who does not work in those departments where some employees works whose manager id within the range 100 and 200.
hr_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT e.employee_id FROM employees e WHERE e.department_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT d.department_id FROM departments d JOIN employees e2 ON d.manager_id = e2.employee_id WHERE e2.manager_id BETWEEN 100 AND 200)

hr_1.question: What are the ids for employees who do not work in departments with managers that have ids between 100 and 200?
hr_1.query: SELECT employee_id FROM employees WHERE department_id NOT IN (SELECT department_id FROM departments WHERE manager_id BETWEEN 100 AND 200)

hr_1.question: display the employee name ( first name and last name ) and hire date for all employees in the same department as Clara.
hr_1.query:
SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name, e.hire_date 
FROM employees e 
WHERE e.department_id = (SELECT department_id FROM employees WHERE first_name = 'Clara')

hr_1.question: What are the full names and hire dates for employees in the same department as someone with the first name Clara?
hr_1.query:
SELECT CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS full_name, e.hire_date 
FROM employees e 
WHERE e.department_id IN (SELECT d.department_id 
                          FROM employees e2 
                          JOIN departments d ON e2.department_id = d.department_id 
                          WHERE e2.first_name = 'Clara')

hr_1.question: display the employee name ( first name and last name ) and hire date for all employees in the same department as Clara excluding Clara.
hr_1.query: SELECT first_name, last_name, hire_date FROM employees WHERE department_id = (SELECT department_id FROM employees WHERE first_name = 'Clara' AND last_name = 'Clara') AND (first_name != 'Clara' OR last_name != 'Clara')

hr_1.question: What are the full names and hire dates for employees in the same department as someone with the first name Clara, not including Clara?
hr_1.query:
SELECT CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS full_name, e.hire_date 
FROM employees e 
WHERE e.department_id IN (SELECT d.department_id 
                          FROM employees e2 
                          JOIN departments d ON e2.department_id = d.department_id 
                          WHERE e2.first_name = 'Clara' AND e2.employee_id != e.employee_id)

hr_1.question: display the employee number and name( first name and last name ) for all employees who work in a department with any employee whose name contains a ’T’.
hr_1.query: SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name FROM employees WHERE department_id IN (SELECT department_id FROM employees WHERE first_name LIKE '%T%' OR last_name LIKE '%T%')

hr_1.question: What are the ids and full names for employees who work in a department that has someone with a first name that contains the letter T?
hr_1.query: SELECT e.employee_id, CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS full_name FROM employees e WHERE e.department_id IN (SELECT d.department_id FROM departments d WHERE EXISTS (SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department_id = d.department_id AND first_name LIKE '%T%')) ORDER BY e.employee_id

hr_1.question: display the employee number, name( first name and last name ), and salary for all employees who earn more than the average salary and who work in a department with any employee with a 'J' in their first name.
hr_1.query: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, e.salary FROM employees e WHERE e.salary > (SELECT AVG(salary) FROM employees) AND e.department_id IN (SELECT department_id FROM employees WHERE first_name LIKE '%J%')

hr_1.question: What are the ids, full names, and salaries for employees making more than average and who work in a department with employees who have the letter J in their first name?
hr_1.query: SELECT e.employee_id, CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS full_name, e.salary FROM employees AS e JOIN departments AS d ON e.department_id = d.department_id WHERE e.salary > (SELECT AVG(salary) FROM employees) AND d.department_id IN (SELECT department_id FROM employees WHERE first_name LIKE '%J%')

hr_1.question: display the employee number and job id for all employees whose salary is smaller than any salary of those employees whose job title is MK_MAN.
hr_1.query: SELECT employee_id, job_id FROM employees WHERE salary < (SELECT MIN(salary) FROM employees WHERE job_id = 'MK_MAN')

hr_1.question: What are the employee ids and job ids for employees who make less than the lowest earning employee with title MK_MAN?
hr_1.query: SELECT employee_id, job_id FROM employees WHERE salary < (SELECT MIN(salary) FROM employees WHERE job_id = 'MK_MAN')

hr_1.question: display the employee number, name( first name and last name ) and job title for all employees whose salary is more than any salary of those employees whose job title is PU_MAN.
hr_1.query:
SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, j.job_title 
FROM employees e 
JOIN jobs j ON e.job_id = j.job_id 
WHERE e.salary > (SELECT MAX(salary) FROM employees WHERE job_id = (SELECT job_id FROM jobs WHERE job_title = 'PU_MAN'))

hr_1.question: What are the employee ids, full names, and job ids for employees who make more than the highest earning employee with title PU_MAN?
hr_1.query:
SELECT e.employee_id, CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS full_name, e.job_id 
FROM employees e 
WHERE e.salary > (SELECT MAX(e2.salary) FROM employees e2 JOIN jobs j ON e2.job_id = j.job_id WHERE j.job_title = 'PU_MAN')

hr_1.question: display the department id and the total salary for those departments which contains at least two employees.
hr_1.query: SELECT department_id, SUM(salary) AS total_salary FROM employees GROUP BY department_id HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2

hr_1.question: What are total salaries and department id for each department that has more than 2 employees?
hr_1.query: SELECT SUM(salary), department_id FROM employees GROUP BY department_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 2;

hr_1.question: display all the information of those employees who did not have any job in the past.
hr_1.query: SELECT * FROM employees WHERE employee_id NOT IN (SELECT employee_id FROM job_history)

hr_1.question: What is all the information about employees who have never had a job in the past?
hr_1.query: SELECT * FROM employees WHERE employee_id NOT IN (SELECT employee_id FROM job_history)

hr_1.question: display the department ID, full name (first and last name), salary for those employees who is highest salary in every department.
hr_1.query:
SELECT d.department_id, CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS full_name, e.salary 
FROM employees e 
JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id 
WHERE e.salary = (SELECT MAX(salary) FROM employees WHERE department_id = d.department_id) 
ORDER BY d.department_id ASC

hr_1.question: What are the department ids, full names, and salaries for employees who make the most in their departments?
hr_1.query: SELECT e.department_id, CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS full_name, e.salary FROM employees e WHERE e.salary = (SELECT MAX(salary) FROM employees WHERE department_id = e.department_id)

hr_1.question: display the first and last name, department, city, and state province for each employee.

hr_1.question: What are the full names, departments, cities, and state provinces for each employee?
hr_1.query: SELECT CONCAT(first_name, ' ', last_name) AS full_name, department_name, city, state_province FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.department_id = departments.department_id JOIN locations ON departments.location_id = locations.location_id

hr_1.question: display those employees who contain a letter z to their first name and also display their last name, city.

hr_1.question: What are the full names and cities of employees who have the letter Z in their first names?
hr_1.query: SELECT CONCAT(first_name, ' ', last_name) AS full_name, city FROM employees JOIN locations ON employees.department_id = locations.location_id WHERE first_name LIKE '%Z%'

hr_1.question: display the department name, city, and state province for each department.

hr_1.question: What are the department names, cities, and state provinces for each department?

hr_1.question: display the full name (first and last name ) of employee with ID and name of the country presently where (s)he is working.

hr_1.question: What the full names, ids of each employee and the name of the country they are in?

hr_1.question: What are the department names and how many employees work in each of them?
hr_1.query: SELECT departments.department_name, COUNT(employees.employee_id) FROM departments JOIN employees ON departments.department_id = employees.department_id GROUP BY departments.department_name

hr_1.question: display the full name (first and last name), and salary of those employees who working in any department located in London.
hr_1.query: SELECT first_name, last_name, salary FROM employees WHERE department_id IN (SELECT department_id FROM departments WHERE location_id IN (SELECT location_id FROM locations WHERE city = 'London'))

hr_1.question: What are full names and salaries of employees working in the city of London?
hr_1.query: SELECT CONCAT(first_name, ' ', last_name) AS full_name, salary FROM employees JOIN locations ON employees.department_id = departments.department_id AND departments.location_id = locations.location_id WHERE locations.city = 'London'

music_1.question: What is the name of the song that was released in the most recent year?

music_1.question: What are the id of songs whose format is mp3.

music_1.question: List the name and country of origin for all singers who have produced songs with rating above 9.

music_1.question: What are the different names and countries of origins for all artists whose song ratings are above 9?

music_1.question: List the file size and format for all songs that have resolution lower than 800.

music_1.question: What are the names and countries of origin for the artists who produced the top three highly rated songs.
music_1.query: SELECT T1.artist_name, T1.country FROM artist AS T1 JOIN song AS T2 ON T1.artist_name = T2.artist_name ORDER BY T2.rating DESC LIMIT 3;

music_1.question: What are the names of the singers who sang the top 3 most highly rated songs and what countries do they hail from?

music_1.question: What is the average rating of songs produced by female artists?

music_1.question: How many songs, on average, are sung by a female artist?
music_1.query: SELECT AVG(count) FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) AS count FROM artist AS T1 JOIN song AS T2 ON T1.artist_name = T2.artist_name WHERE T1.gender = 'female' GROUP BY T1.artist_name) AS subquery

music_1.question: What countries are the female artists who sung in the language Bangla from?

music_1.question: What is the average duration of songs that have mp3 format and resolution below 800?

music_1.question: What is the average song duration for the songs that are in mp3 format and whose resolution below 800?

music_1.question: Return the gender and name of artist who produced the song with the lowest resolution.

music_1.question: What is the gender and name of the artist who sang the song with the smallest resolution?

music_1.question: Find the distinct names of all songs that have a higher resolution than some songs in English.
music_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT s1.song_name FROM song AS s1 WHERE s1.resolution > (SELECT MAX(s2.resolution) FROM song AS s2 WHERE s2.languages = 'English')

music_1.question: What are the different names for all songs that have a higher resolution than English songs?

music_1.question: What are the names of all songs that have a lower rating than some song of blues genre?
music_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.song_name FROM song AS T1 JOIN genre AS T2 ON T1.genre_is = T2.g_name WHERE T1.rating < (SELECT MIN(rating) FROM song WHERE genre_is = 'blues')

music_1.question: What are the names of the songs that have a lower rating than at least one blues song?
music_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.song_name FROM song AS T1 JOIN genre AS T2 ON T1.genre_is = T2.g_name WHERE T2.rating > (SELECT MIN(rating) FROM song AS T3 JOIN genre AS T4 ON T3.genre_is = T4.g_name WHERE T4.g_name = 'Blues')

music_1.question: What is the language used most often in the songs?
music_1.query: SELECT languages FROM song GROUP BY languages ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

music_1.question: What are the languages that are used most often in songs?

music_1.question: What is the language that was used most often in songs with resolution above 500?
music_1.query: SELECT languages FROM song WHERE resolution > 500 GROUP BY languages ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

music_1.question: What is the name of the artist, for each language, that has the most songs with a higher resolution than 500?
music_1.query: SELECT T1.artist_name, T1.languages FROM (SELECT artist_name, languages, COUNT(*) AS num_songs FROM song WHERE resolution > 500 GROUP BY artist_name, languages) AS T1 JOIN (SELECT languages, MAX(num_songs) AS max_songs FROM (SELECT artist_name, languages, COUNT(*) AS num_songs FROM song WHERE resolution > 500 GROUP BY artist_name, languages) GROUP BY languages) AS T2 ON T1.languages = T2.languages AND T1.num_songs = T2.max_songs ORDER BY T1.languages;

music_1.question: What are the maximum and minimum resolution of songs whose duration is 3 minutes?
music_1.query: SELECT MAX(resolution), MIN(resolution) FROM song JOIN files ON song.f_id = files.f_id WHERE duration = 180;

music_1.question: What is the maximum and minimum resolution of all songs that are approximately 3 minutes long?
music_1.query: SELECT MAX(T3.resolution), MIN(T3.resolution) FROM (SELECT T1.song_name, T1.artist_name, T2.duration, T3.resolution FROM song AS T1 JOIN files AS T2 ON T1.f_id = T2.f_id WHERE T2.duration BETWEEN 180 AND 240) AS T3

music_1.question: What are the maximum duration and resolution of songs grouped and ordered by languages?
music_1.query: SELECT languages, MAX(duration), MAX(resolution) FROM song GROUP BY languages ORDER BY languages;

music_1.question: What are the maximum duration and resolution of all songs, for each language, ordered alphabetically by language?
music_1.query: SELECT languages, MAX(duration), MAX(resolution) FROM song GROUP BY languages ORDER BY languages ASC

music_1.question: What are the shortest duration and lowest rating of songs grouped by genre and ordered by genre?
music_1.query: SELECT genre.g_name, MIN(files.duration), MIN(song.rating) FROM genre JOIN artist ON genre.g_name = artist.preferred_genre JOIN song ON artist.artist_name = song.artist_name JOIN files ON song.f_id = files.f_id GROUP BY genre.g_name ORDER BY genre.g_name;

music_1.question: What is the shortest and most poorly rated song for each genre, ordered alphabetically by genre?
music_1.query: SELECT T1.g_name, MIN(T3.duration), MIN(T1.rating) FROM genre AS T1 JOIN song AS T2 ON T1.g_name = T2.genre_is JOIN files AS T3 ON T2.f_id = T3.f_id GROUP BY T1.g_name ORDER BY T1.g_name ASC;

music_1.question: Find the names and number of works of all artists who have at least one English songs.

music_1.question: What are the names and number of works for all artists who have sung at least one song in English?

music_1.question: Find the name and country of origin for all artists who have release at least one song of resolution above 900.

music_1.question: What is the name and country of origin for each artist who has released a song with a resolution higher than 900?

music_1.question: Find the names and number of works of the three artists who have produced the most songs.
music_1.query: SELECT artist_name, COUNT(*) AS num_songs FROM song GROUP BY artist_name ORDER BY num_songs DESC LIMIT 3

music_1.question: What are the names of the three artists who have produced the most songs, and how many works did they produce?
music_1.query: SELECT artist_name, COUNT(*) AS num_songs FROM song GROUP BY artist_name ORDER BY num_songs DESC LIMIT 3;

music_1.question: Find the country of origin for the artist who made the least number of songs?
music_1.query: SELECT country FROM artist WHERE artist_name = (SELECT artist_name FROM song GROUP BY artist_name ORDER BY COUNT(*) ASC LIMIT 1)

music_1.question: What country is the artist who made the fewest songs from?
music_1.query: SELECT country FROM artist WHERE artist_name = (SELECT artist_name FROM song GROUP BY artist_name ORDER BY COUNT(*) ASC LIMIT 1)

music_1.question: What are the names of the songs whose rating is below the rating of all songs in English?
music_1.query: SELECT song_name FROM song WHERE rating < (SELECT MIN(rating) FROM song WHERE languages = 'English')

music_1.question: What are the song names for every song whose rating is less than the minimum rating for English songs?
music_1.query: SELECT song_name FROM song WHERE rating < (SELECT MIN(rating) FROM song WHERE genre_is = 'English')

music_1.question: What is ids of the songs whose resolution is higher than the resolution of any songs with rating lower than 8?
music_1.query: SELECT s1.song_name FROM song AS s1 WHERE s1.resolution > ALL(SELECT s2.resolution FROM song AS s2 WHERE s2.rating < 8)

music_1.question: What is the id of every song that has a resolution higher than that of a song with a rating below 8?
music_1.query: SELECT s1.f_id FROM song AS s1 WHERE s1.resolution > (SELECT s2.resolution FROM song AS s2 WHERE s2.rating < 8 ORDER BY s2.resolution DESC LIMIT 1)

music_1.question: What is ids of the songs whose resolution is higher than the average resolution of songs in modern genre?
music_1.query: SELECT T3.song_name FROM genre AS T1 JOIN artist AS T2 ON T1.g_name = T2.preferred_genre JOIN song AS T3 ON T2.artist_name = T3.artist_name WHERE T1.rating = "modern" AND T3.resolution > (SELECT AVG(resolution) FROM song WHERE genre_is = "modern");

music_1.question: What are the ids of all songs that have higher resolution of the average resolution in the modern genre?
music_1.query: SELECT T3.f_id FROM genre AS T1 JOIN song AS T2 ON T1.g_name = T2.genre_is JOIN files AS T3 ON T2.f_id = T3.f_id WHERE T1.rating = "modern" AND T3.resolution > (SELECT AVG(T3.resolution) FROM genre AS T1 JOIN song AS T2 ON T1.g_name = T2.genre_is JOIN files AS T3 ON T2.f_id = T3.f_id WHERE T1.rating = "modern");

music_1.question: Find the top 3 artists who have the largest number of songs works whose language is Bangla.
music_1.query: SELECT artist_name, COUNT(*) AS num_songs FROM song WHERE languages LIKE '%Bangla%' GROUP BY artist_name ORDER BY num_songs DESC LIMIT 3;

music_1.question: What are the top 3 artists with the largest number of songs in the language Bangla?
music_1.query: SELECT artist_name, COUNT(*) AS num_songs FROM song WHERE languages LIKE '%Bangla%' GROUP BY artist_name ORDER BY num_songs DESC LIMIT 3;

music_1.question: List the id, genre and artist name of English songs ordered by rating.
music_1.query: SELECT files.f_id, genre.g_name, artist.artist_name FROM song JOIN files ON song.f_id = files.f_id JOIN artist ON song.artist_name = artist.artist_name JOIN genre ON song.genre_is = genre.g_name WHERE song.languages LIKE '%English%' ORDER BY song.rating DESC;

music_1.question: What is the id, genre, and name of the artist for every English song ordered by ascending rating?
music_1.query: SELECT artist.artist_name, genre.g_name, song.song_name FROM artist JOIN song ON artist.artist_name = song.artist_name JOIN genre ON song.genre_is = genre.g_name WHERE song.country = 'English' ORDER BY song.rating ASC;

music_1.question: List the duration, file size and format of songs whose genre is pop, ordered by title?
music_1.query: SELECT T3.duration, T3.file_size, T3.formats FROM genre AS T1 JOIN artist AS T2 ON T1.g_name = T2.preferred_genre JOIN files AS T3 ON T2.artist_name = T3.artist_name JOIN song AS T4 ON T2.artist_name = T4.artist_name AND T3.f_id = T4.f_id WHERE T1.g_name = "pop" ORDER BY T4.song_name;

music_1.question: What is the duration, file size, and song format for every pop song, ordered by title alphabetically?
music_1.query: SELECT T4.song_name, T3.duration, T3.file_size, T3.formats FROM genre AS T1 JOIN artist AS T2 ON T1.g_name = T2.preferred_genre JOIN files AS T3 ON T2.artist_name = T3.artist_name JOIN song AS T4 ON T3.f_id = T4.f_id WHERE T1.g_name = "pop" ORDER BY T4.song_name;

music_1.question: Find the names of the artists who have produced English songs but have never received rating higher than 8.
music_1.query: SELECT artist_name FROM artist WHERE artist_name NOT IN (SELECT artist_name FROM song WHERE rating > 8 AND languages LIKE '%English%') AND artist_name IN (SELECT artist_name FROM song WHERE languages LIKE '%English%')

music_1.question: What are the names of the different artists that have produced a song in English but have never receieved a rating higher than 8?
music_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.artist_name FROM artist AS T1 JOIN song AS T2 ON T1.artist_name = T2.artist_name WHERE T2.languages LIKE '%English%' AND T2.rating <= 8;

music_1.question: Find the names of the artists who are from Bangladesh and have never received rating higher than 7.

music_1.question: What are the names of the different artists from Bangladesh who never received a rating higher than a 7?
music_1.query: SELECT artist_name FROM artist WHERE country = 'Bangladesh' AND artist_name NOT IN (SELECT artist_name FROM song WHERE rating > 7)

baseball_1.question: what is the full name and id of the college with the largest number of baseball players?
baseball_1.query: SELECT T1.name_full, T1.college_id FROM college AS T1 JOIN player_college AS T2 ON T1.college_id = T2.college_id GROUP BY T1.college_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

baseball_1.question: Find the full name and id of the college that has the most baseball players.
baseball_1.query: SELECT T1.name_full, T1.college_id FROM college AS T1 JOIN player_college AS T2 ON T1.college_id = T2.college_id GROUP BY T1.college_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

baseball_1.question: What is average salary of the players in the team named 'Boston Red Stockings' ?

baseball_1.question: Compute the average salary of the players in the team called 'Boston Red Stockings'.
baseball_1.query: SELECT AVG(salary) FROM salary WHERE team_id = (SELECT team_id FROM team WHERE name = 'Boston Red Stockings')

baseball_1.question: What are first and last names of players participating in all star game in 1998?
baseball_1.query: SELECT player.name_first, player.name_last FROM all_star JOIN player ON all_star.player_id = player.player_id WHERE all_star.year = 1998

baseball_1.question: List the first and last name for players who participated in all star game in 1998.
baseball_1.query: SELECT player.name_first, player.name_last FROM player JOIN all_star ON player.player_id = all_star.player_id WHERE all_star.year = 1998

baseball_1.question: What are the first name, last name and id of the player with the most all star game experiences? Also list the count.
baseball_1.query: SELECT player.name_first, player.name_last, all_star.player_id, COUNT(*) AS num_experiences FROM all_star JOIN player ON all_star.player_id = player.player_id GROUP BY all_star.player_id ORDER BY num_experiences DESC LIMIT 1

baseball_1.question: Which player has the most all star game experiences? Give me the first name, last name and id of the player, as well as the number of times the player participated in all star game.
baseball_1.query: SELECT player.Player_ID, player.Player_name, COUNT(all_star.game_num) AS num_all_star_games FROM player JOIN all_star ON player.Player_ID = all_star.player_id GROUP BY player.Player_ID ORDER BY num_all_star_games DESC LIMIT 1

baseball_1.question: How many players enter hall of fame each year?
baseball_1.query: SELECT yearid, COUNT(*) FROM hall_of_fame WHERE inducted = 'Y' GROUP BY yearid

baseball_1.question: Count the number of players who enter hall of fame for each year.
baseball_1.query: SELECT yearid, COUNT(*) FROM hall_of_fame WHERE inducted = 'Y' GROUP BY yearid

baseball_1.question: What is the average number of attendance at home games for each year?
baseball_1.query: SELECT year, AVG(attendance) FROM home_game GROUP BY year

baseball_1.question: For each year, return the year and the average number of attendance at home games.
baseball_1.query: SELECT year, AVG(attendance) FROM home_game GROUP BY year

baseball_1.question: In 2014, what are the id and rank of the team that has the largest average number of attendance?
baseball_1.query: SELECT team_id, rank FROM team WHERE year = 2014 AND attendance = (SELECT MAX(avg_attendance) FROM (SELECT team_id, AVG(attendance) AS avg_attendance FROM home_game WHERE year = 2014 GROUP BY team_id) AS T1)

baseball_1.question: Find the id and rank of the team that has the highest average attendance rate in 2014.
baseball_1.query: SELECT team_id, rank FROM team WHERE year = 2014 ORDER BY attendance DESC LIMIT 1

baseball_1.question: What are the manager's first name, last name and id who won the most manager award?
baseball_1.query: SELECT T1.player_id, T2.name_first, T2.name_last FROM manager_award AS T1 JOIN player AS T2 ON T1.player_id = T2.player_id GROUP BY T1.player_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

baseball_1.question: Which manager won the most manager award? Give me the manager's first name, last name and id.
baseball_1.query: SELECT T1.player_id, T2.name_first, T2.name_last, count(*) AS num_awards FROM manager_award AS T1 JOIN player AS T2 ON T1.player_id = T2.player_id GROUP BY T1.player_id ORDER BY num_awards DESC LIMIT 1

baseball_1.question: How many parks are there in the state of NY?
baseball_1.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM park WHERE state = 'NY'

baseball_1.question: Show me the number of parks the state of NY has.
baseball_1.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT park_id) FROM park WHERE state = 'NY'

baseball_1.question: Which 3 players won the most player awards? List their full name and id.
baseball_1.query: SELECT player.player_id, player.player_name, COUNT(player_award.award_id) AS award_count FROM player_award JOIN player ON player_award.player_id = player.player_id GROUP BY player_award.player_id ORDER BY award_count DESC LIMIT 3

baseball_1.question: Find the first name, last name and id for the top three players won the most player awards.
baseball_1.query: SELECT player.name_first, player.name_last, player.player_id FROM player_award JOIN player ON player_award.player_id = player.player_id GROUP BY player_award.player_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 3

baseball_1.question: List three countries which are the origins of the least players.
baseball_1.query: SELECT T1.birth_country, COUNT(*) FROM player AS T1 GROUP BY T1.birth_country ORDER BY COUNT(*) ASC LIMIT 3

baseball_1.question: What are the three countries that the least players are from?
baseball_1.query: SELECT Country_name, COUNT(*) as num_players FROM country JOIN match_season ON country.Country_id = match_season.Country GROUP BY Country_name ORDER BY num_players ASC LIMIT 3

baseball_1.question: Find all the players' first name and last name who have empty death record.
baseball_1.query: SELECT name_first, name_last FROM player WHERE death_year IS NULL AND death_month IS NULL AND death_day IS NULL AND death_country IS NULL AND death_state IS NULL AND death_city IS NULL

baseball_1.question: What are the first name and last name of the players whose death record is empty?
baseball_1.query: SELECT name_first, name_last FROM player WHERE death_year IS NULL AND death_month IS NULL AND death_day IS NULL

baseball_1.question: How many players born in USA are right-handed batters? That is, have the batter value 'R'.
baseball_1.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM player WHERE birth_country = 'USA' AND bats = 'R'

baseball_1.question: Count the number of players who were born in USA and have bats information 'R'.
baseball_1.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM player WHERE birth_country = 'USA' AND bats = 'R'

baseball_1.question: What is the average height of the players from the college named 'Yale University'?
baseball_1.query: SELECT AVG(height) FROM player JOIN player_college ON player.player_id = player_college.player_id WHERE college_id = (SELECT college_id FROM college WHERE name_full = 'Yale University')

baseball_1.question: Find the average height of the players who belong to the college called 'Yale University'.
baseball_1.query: SELECT AVG(height) FROM player JOIN player_college ON player.player_id = player_college.player_id WHERE college_id = (SELECT college_id FROM college WHERE name_full = 'Yale University')

baseball_1.question: What is the highest salary among each team? List the team name, id and maximum salary.
baseball_1.query: SELECT T1.team_id, T2.name, MAX(T1.salary) FROM salary AS T1 JOIN team AS T2 ON T1.team_id = T2.team_id GROUP BY T1.team_id, T2.name

baseball_1.question: For each team, return the team name, id and the maximum salary among the team.
baseball_1.query: SELECT T1.team_id, T2.name, MAX(T1.salary) FROM salary AS T1 JOIN team AS T2 ON T1.team_id = T2.team_id GROUP BY T1.team_id, T2.name

baseball_1.question: What are the name and id of the team offering the lowest average salary?
baseball_1.query: SELECT team.team_id, team.name FROM team JOIN salary ON team.team_id = salary.team_id GROUP BY team.team_id, team.name HAVING AVG(salary.salary) = (SELECT MIN(avg_salary) FROM (SELECT team_id, AVG(salary) AS avg_salary FROM salary GROUP BY team_id) AS avg_salaries)

baseball_1.question: Which team offers the lowest average salary? Give me the name and id of the team.
baseball_1.query: SELECT T1.team_id, T1.name, AVG(T2.salary) AS avg_salary FROM team AS T1 JOIN salary AS T2 ON T1.team_id = T2.team_id GROUP BY T1.team_id, T1.name ORDER BY avg_salary ASC LIMIT 1

baseball_1.question: Find the players' first name and last name who won award both in 1960 and in 1961.
baseball_1.query: SELECT T1.name_first, T1.name_last FROM player AS T1 JOIN player_award AS T2 ON T1.player_id = T2.player_id WHERE T2.year = 1960 AND T2.award_id IN (SELECT award_id FROM player_award WHERE year = 1961 AND player_id = T1.player_id)

baseball_1.question: Which players won awards in both 1960 and 1961? Return their first names and last names.
baseball_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.name_first, T1.name_last FROM player AS T1 JOIN player_award AS T2 ON T1.player_id  =  T2.player_id WHERE T2.year  IN  (1960, 1961) GROUP BY T1.player_id HAVING count(*)  =  2

baseball_1.question: What are the first name and last name of the players who have weight above 220 or height below 75?
baseball_1.query: SELECT name_first, name_last FROM player WHERE weight > 220 OR height < 75

baseball_1.question: List the maximum scores of the team Boston Red Stockings when the team won in postseason?

baseball_1.question: How many times did Boston Red Stockings lose in 2009 postseason?

baseball_1.question: What are the name and id of the team with the most victories in 2008 postseason?
baseball_1.query: SELECT team.name, team.team_id FROM team JOIN postseason ON team.team_id = postseason.team_id_winner WHERE postseason.year = 2008 AND postseason.wins = (SELECT MAX(wins) FROM postseason WHERE year = 2008)

baseball_1.question: Find the name and id of the team that won the most times in 2008 postseason.

baseball_1.question: What is the number of wins the team Boston Red Stockings got in the postseasons each year in history?

baseball_1.question: For each year, return the year and the number of times the team Boston Red Stockings won in the postseasons.

baseball_1.question: What is the total number of postseason games that team Boston Red Stockings participated in?

baseball_1.question: How many times in total did the team Boston Red Stockings participate in postseason games?
baseball_1.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM postseason WHERE team_id_winner = (SELECT team_id FROM team WHERE name = 'Boston Red Stockings') OR team_id_loser = (SELECT team_id FROM team WHERE name = 'Boston Red Stockings')

baseball_1.question: How much did the the player with first name Len and last name Barker earn between 1985 to 1990 in total?
baseball_1.query: SELECT SUM(salary) FROM salary JOIN player ON salary.player_id = player.player_id WHERE player.name_first = "Len" AND player.name_last = "Barker" AND salary.year BETWEEN 1985 AND 1990

baseball_1.question: Compute the total salary that the player with first name Len and last name Barker received between 1985 to 1990.

baseball_1.question: List players' first name and last name who received salary from team Washington Nationals in both 2005 and 2007.
baseball_1.query: SELECT T1.name_first, T1.name_last FROM player AS T1 JOIN salary AS T2 ON T1.player_id = T2.player_id JOIN team AS T3 ON T2.team_id = T3.team_id WHERE T3.name = "Washington Nationals" AND T2.year IN (2005, 2007) GROUP BY T1.player_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT T2.year) = 2

baseball_1.question: What are the first name and last name of the players who were paid salary by team Washington Nationals in both 2005 and 2007?
baseball_1.query: SELECT player.name_first, player.name_last FROM player JOIN salary ON player.player_id = salary.player_id JOIN team ON salary.team_id = team.team_id WHERE team.name = "Washington Nationals" AND salary.year IN (2005, 2007) GROUP BY player.player_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT salary.year) = 2

baseball_1.question: How many home games did the team Boston Red Stockings play from 1990 to 2000 in total?
baseball_1.query: SELECT SUM(games) FROM home_game JOIN team ON home_game.team_id = team.team_id WHERE team.name = "Boston Red Stockings" AND year BETWEEN 1990 AND 2000

baseball_1.question: Count the total number of games the team Boston Red Stockings attended from 1990 to 2000.
baseball_1.query: SELECT SUM(Games) FROM (SELECT G FROM team WHERE Name = "Boston Red Stockings" AND Year BETWEEN 1990 AND 2000 UNION ALL SELECT Ghome FROM team WHERE Name = "Boston Red Stockings" AND Year BETWEEN 1990 AND 2000) AS T1

baseball_1.question: Which team had the least number of attendances in home games in 1980?
baseball_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM team AS T1 JOIN home_game AS T2 ON T1.team_id  =  T2.team_id WHERE T2.year  =  1980 ORDER BY T2.attendance ASC LIMIT 1

baseball_1.question: Find the team that attended the least number of home games in 1980.
baseball_1.query: SELECT team.Name FROM team JOIN home_game ON team.Team_id = home_game.Team_id WHERE home_game.Year = 1980 ORDER BY home_game.Games ASC LIMIT 1

mountain_photos.question: How many camera lenses have a focal length longer than 15 mm?
mountain_photos.query: SELECT count(*) FROM camera_lens WHERE focal_length_mm  >  15

mountain_photos.question: Find the brand and name for each camera lens, and sort in descending order of maximum aperture.
mountain_photos.query: SELECT brand, name FROM camera_lens ORDER BY max_aperture DESC

mountain_photos.question: List the id, color scheme, and name for all the photos.
mountain_photos.query: SELECT id, color, name FROM photos

mountain_photos.question: What are the maximum and average height of the mountains?
What are the average prominence of the mountains in country 'Morocco'?
mountain_photos.query: SELECT AVG(Prominence) FROM mountain WHERE Country = 'Morocco'

mountain_photos.question: What are the name, height and prominence of mountains which do not belong to the range 'Aberdare Range'?
mountain_photos.query: SELECT name, Height, Prominence FROM mountain WHERE Range != 'Aberdare Range'

mountain_photos.question: What are the id and name of the photos for mountains?
mountain_photos.query: SELECT id, name FROM photos WHERE mountain_id IS NOT NULL

mountain_photos.question: What are the id and name of the mountains that have at least 2 photos?
mountain_photos.query: SELECT T1.id, T1.name FROM mountain AS T1 JOIN photos AS T2 ON T1.id = T2.mountain_id GROUP BY T1.id HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2

mountain_photos.question: What are the names of the cameras that have taken picture of the most mountains?
mountain_photos.query: SELECT T2.name FROM photos AS T1 JOIN camera_lens AS T2 ON T1.camera_lens_id  =  T2.id GROUP BY T2.id ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT T1.mountain_id) DESC LIMIT 1

mountain_photos.question: What are the names of photos taken with the lens brand 'Sigma' or 'Olympus'?
mountain_photos.query: SELECT name FROM photos JOIN camera_lens ON photos.camera_lens_id = camera_lens.id WHERE camera_lens.brand IN ('Sigma', 'Olympus')

mountain_photos.question: How many different kinds of lens brands are there?
How many camera lenses are not used in taking any photos?
mountain_photos.query: SELECT count(*) FROM camera_lens WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT camera_lens_id FROM photos)

mountain_photos.question: How many distinct kinds of camera lenses are used to take photos of mountains in the country 'Ethiopia'?
mountain_photos.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT camera_lens_id) FROM photos JOIN mountain ON photos.mountain_id = mountain.id WHERE mountain.country = 'Ethiopia'

mountain_photos.question: List the brands of lenses that took both a picture of mountains with range 'Toubkal Atlas' and a picture of mountains with range 'Lasta Massif'
mountain_photos.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.brand FROM camera_lens AS T1 JOIN photos AS T2 ON T1.id = T2.camera_lens_id JOIN mountain AS T3 ON T2.mountain_id = T3.id WHERE T3.range = 'Toubkal Atlas' AND T1.brand IN (SELECT DISTINCT T1.brand FROM camera_lens AS T1 JOIN photos AS T2 ON T1.id = T2.camera_lens_id JOIN mountain AS T3 ON T2.mountain_id = T3.id WHERE T3.range = 'Lasta Massif')

mountain_photos.question: Show the name and prominence of the mountains whose picture is not taken by a lens of brand 'Sigma'.
mountain_photos.query: SELECT T1.name, T1.prominence FROM mountain AS T1 JOIN photos AS T2 ON T1.id = T2.mountain_id JOIN camera_lens AS T3 ON T2.camera_lens_id = T3.id WHERE T3.brand != 'Sigma'

mountain_photos.question: List the camera lens names containing substring "Digital".
mountain_photos.query: SELECT name FROM camera_lens WHERE name LIKE '%Digital%'

mountain_photos.question: What is the name of each camera lens and the number of photos taken by it? Order the result by the count of photos.
mountain_photos.query: SELECT T1.name, COUNT(T3.id) AS num_photos FROM camera_lens AS T1 JOIN photos AS T3 ON T1.id = T3.camera_lens_id GROUP BY T1.id ORDER BY num_photos DESC

program_share.question: what are the names of the channels that broadcast in both morning and night?

program_share.question: find the number of different programs that are broadcast during night time.

program_share.question: How many distinct programs are broadcast at "Night" time?

program_share.question: Who are the owners of the programs that broadcast both in the morning and at night?

program_share.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT Owner) FROM (SELECT Owner FROM program UNION SELECT Owner FROM channel) AS T1

program_share.question: Count the number of distinct channel owners.
program_share.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT Owner) FROM channel

program_share.question: find the names of programs whose origin is not in Beijing.
program_share.query: SELECT Name FROM program WHERE Origin <> 'Beijing'

program_share.question: Which programs' origins are not "Beijing"? Give me the program names.
program_share.query: SELECT Name FROM program WHERE Origin <> 'Beijing'

program_share.question: What are the names of the channels owned by CCTV or HBS?
program_share.query: SELECT Name FROM channel WHERE Owner IN ('CCTV', 'HBS')

program_share.question: List the names of all the channels owned by either CCTV or HBS
program_share.query: SELECT Name FROM channel WHERE Owner IN ('CCTV', 'HBS')

program_share.question: Find the total rating ratio for each channel owner.
program_share.query: SELECT T1.Owner, SUM(T2.Rating_in_percent * T3.Share_in_percent) / SUM(T3.Share_in_percent) AS Total_Rating_Ratio FROM program AS T1 JOIN broadcast AS T2 ON T1.Program_ID = T2.Program_ID JOIN broadcast_share AS T3 ON T2.Channel_ID = T3.Channel_ID AND T2.Program_ID = T3.Program_ID JOIN channel AS T4 ON T2.Channel_ID = T4.Channel_ID AND T1.Owner = T4.Owner GROUP BY T1.Owner

program_share.question: What is the total rating of channel for each channel owner?
program_share.query: SELECT T1.Owner, SUM(T2.Rating_in_percent) AS Total_Rating FROM channel AS T2 JOIN program AS T3 ON T2.Owner = T3.Owner JOIN broadcast AS T4 ON T3.Program_ID = T4.Program_ID WHERE T4.Channel_ID = T2.Channel_ID GROUP BY T1.Owner

program_share.question: Find the name of the program that is broadcast most frequently.
program_share.query: SELECT T1.Name FROM program AS T1 JOIN broadcast AS T2 ON T1.Program_ID  =  T2.Program_ID GROUP BY T2.Program_ID ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

program_share.question: Which program is broadcast most frequently? Give me the program name.
program_share.query: SELECT T1.Name FROM program AS T1 JOIN broadcast AS T2 ON T1.Program_ID = T2.Program_ID GROUP BY T2.Program_ID ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

e_learning.question: Find the login name of the course author that teaches the course with name "advanced database".

e_learning.question: Find the addresses of the course authors who teach the course with name "operating system" or "data structure".
e_learning.query: SELECT T1.address_line_1 FROM course_authors_and_tutors AS T1 JOIN courses AS T2 ON T1.author_id = T2.author_id WHERE T2.course_name = "operating system" OR T2.course_name = "data structure"

e_learning.question: What are the addresses of the course authors who teach either "operating system" or "data structure" course.
e_learning.query: SELECT T1.address_line_1 FROM course_authors_and_tutors AS T1 JOIN courses AS T2 ON T1.author_id = T2.author_id JOIN subjects AS T3 ON T2.subject_id = T3.subject_id WHERE T3.subject_name IN ("operating system", "data structure")

e_learning.question: Find the personal name, family name, and author ID of the course author that teaches the most courses.
e_learning.query: SELECT T1.personal_name, T1.family_name, T1.author_id FROM Course_Authors_and_Tutors AS T1 JOIN Courses AS T2 ON T1.author_id = T2.author_id GROUP BY T1.author_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

e_learning.question: What are the personal name, family name, and author ID of the course author who teaches the most courses?

e_learning.question: Find the names and descriptions of courses that belong to the subject named "Computer Science".

e_learning.question: What are the names and descriptions of the all courses under the "Computer Science" subject?

e_learning.question: Find the subject ID, subject name, and the corresponding number of available courses for each subject.
e_learning.query: SELECT T1.subject_id, T2.subject_name, count(*) FROM courses AS T1 JOIN subjects AS T2 ON T1.subject_id = T2.subject_id GROUP BY T1.subject_id, T2.subject_name

e_learning.question: What are the subject ID, subject name, and the number of available courses for each subject?
e_learning.query: SELECT T1.subject_id, T2.subject_name, COUNT(T1.course_id) AS num_courses FROM courses AS T1 JOIN subjects AS T2 ON T1.subject_id = T2.subject_id GROUP BY T1.subject_id, T2.subject_name

e_learning.question: Find the subject ID, name of subject and the corresponding number of courses for each subject, and sort by the course count in ascending order.
e_learning.query: SELECT T3.subject_id, T3.subject_name, COUNT(*) AS course_count FROM courses AS T1 JOIN subjects AS T3 ON T1.subject_id = T3.subject_id GROUP BY T3.subject_id ORDER BY course_count ASC

e_learning.question: List the subject ID, name of subject and the number of courses available for each subject in ascending order of the course counts.
e_learning.query: SELECT T3.subject_id, T3.subject_name, COUNT(*) AS course_count FROM courses AS T1 JOIN subjects AS T3 ON T1.subject_id = T3.subject_id GROUP BY T3.subject_id ORDER BY course_count ASC

e_learning.question: What is the date of enrollment of the course named "Spanish"?

e_learning.question: Find the the date of enrollment of the "Spanish" course.
e_learning.query: SELECT date_of_enrolment FROM student_course_enrolment AS T1 JOIN courses AS T2 ON T1.course_id = T2.course_id JOIN subjects AS T3 ON T2.subject_id = T3.subject_id WHERE T3.subject_name = "Spanish"

e_learning.question: What is the name of the course that has the most student enrollment?
e_learning.query: SELECT T1.course_name FROM courses AS T1 JOIN student_course_enrolment AS T2 ON T1.course_id = T2.course_id GROUP BY T1.course_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

e_learning.question: Which course is enrolled in by the most students? Give me the course name.
e_learning.query: SELECT T3.course_name FROM student_course_enrolment AS T1 JOIN courses AS T3 ON T1.course_id = T3.course_id GROUP BY T1.course_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

e_learning.question: What are the names of the courses that have exactly 1 student enrollment?
e_learning.query: SELECT course_name FROM courses WHERE course_id IN (SELECT course_id FROM student_course_enrolment GROUP BY course_id HAVING COUNT(*) = 1)

e_learning.question: Find the names of the courses that have just one student enrollment.
e_learning.query: SELECT T4.course_name FROM (SELECT course_id, COUNT(*) AS num_enrollments FROM student_course_enrolment GROUP BY course_id) AS T3 JOIN student_course_enrolment AS T2 ON T3.course_id = T2.course_id JOIN courses AS T4 ON T2.course_id = T4.course_id WHERE T3.num_enrollments = 1

e_learning.question: What are the descriptions and names of the courses that have student enrollment bigger than 2?
e_learning.query: SELECT course_description, course_name FROM courses AS T1 JOIN student_course_enrolment AS T2 ON T1.course_id = T2.course_id GROUP BY T2.course_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 2

e_learning.question: Return the descriptions and names of the courses that have more than two students enrolled in.
e_learning.query: SELECT course_description, course_name FROM courses WHERE course_id IN (SELECT course_id FROM student_course_enrolment GROUP BY course_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 2)

e_learning.question: What is the name of each course and the corresponding number of student enrollment?
e_learning.query: SELECT T1.course_name, COUNT(*) FROM courses AS T1 JOIN student_course_enrolment AS T2 ON T1.course_id = T2.course_id GROUP BY T2.course_id

e_learning.question: List the name and the number of enrolled student for each course.

e_learning.query: SELECT T1.date_of_completion FROM student_course_enrolment AS T1 JOIN student_tests_taken AS T2 ON T1.registration_id = T2.registration_id WHERE T2.test_result = "Fail"

e_learning.question: List the dates of enrollment and completion of the student with family name "Zieme" and personal name "Bernie".
e_learning.query: SELECT T1.date_of_enrolment, T1.date_of_completion FROM student_course_enrolment AS T1 JOIN students AS T2 ON T1.student_id = T2.student_id WHERE T2.family_name = "Zieme" AND T2.personal_name = "Bernie"

e_learning.question: On what dates did the student with family name "Zieme" and personal name "Bernie" enroll in and complete the courses?
