e_learning.question: Find the student ID and login name of the student with the most course enrollments
e_learning.query: SELECT student_id, login_name FROM students JOIN student_course_enrolment ON students.student_id = student_course_enrolment.student_id GROUP BY students.student_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

e_learning.question: What are the student ID and login name of the student who are enrolled in the most courses?
e_learning.query: SELECT T1.student_id, T1.login_name FROM students AS T1 JOIN student_course_enrolment AS T2 ON T1.student_id = T2.student_id GROUP BY T1.student_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

e_learning.question: Find the student ID and personal name of the student with at least two enrollments.
e_learning.query: SELECT T1.student_id, T1.personal_name FROM Students AS T1 JOIN Student_Course_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.student_id = T2.student_id GROUP BY T1.student_id HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2

e_learning.question: Which student are enrolled in at least two courses? Give me the student ID and personal name.
e_learning.query: SELECT T1.student_id, T1.personal_name FROM students AS T1 JOIN student_course_enrolment AS T2 ON T1.student_id = T2.student_id GROUP BY T1.student_id HAVING count(*) >= 2

e_learning.question: Find the student ID and middle name for all the students with at most two enrollments.
e_learning.query: SELECT student_id, middle_name FROM Students WHERE student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM Student_Course_Enrolment GROUP BY student_id HAVING COUNT(*) <= 2)

e_learning.question: What are the student IDs and middle names of the students enrolled in at most two courses?
e_learning.query: SELECT student_id, middle_name FROM students WHERE student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM student_course_enrolment GROUP BY student_id HAVING COUNT(*) <= 2)

e_learning.question: Count the number of students who did not enroll in any course.

e_learning.question: Find the common login name of course authors and students.
e_learning.query: SELECT login_name FROM course_authors_and_tutors INTERSECT SELECT login_name FROM students

e_learning.question: What are the login names used both by some course authors and some students?

e_learning.question: What are the personal names used both by some course authors and some students?

insurance_policies.question: Which claims caused more than 2 settlements or have the maximum claim value? List the date the claim was made and the claim id.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT claim_id, date_claim_made FROM claims WHERE claim_id IN (SELECT claim_id FROM settlements GROUP BY claim_id HAVING count(*) > 2) OR amount_claimed = (SELECT max(amount_claimed) FROM claims)

insurance_policies.question: Find the claims that led to more than two settlements or have the maximum claim value. For each of them, return the date the claim was made and the id of the claim.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT claim_id, date_claim_made FROM claims WHERE claim_id IN (SELECT claim_id FROM settlements GROUP BY claim_id HAVING count(*) > 2) OR amount_claimed = (SELECT max(amount_claimed) FROM claims)

insurance_policies.question: Which customer had at least 2 policies but did not file any claims? List the customer details and id.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t1.customer_id, t1.customer_details FROM customers AS t1 JOIN customer_policies AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id WHERE t2.policy_id NOT IN (SELECT policy_id FROM claims) GROUP BY t1.customer_id, t1.customer_details HAVING count(*) >= 2

insurance_policies.question: Give me the the customer details and id for the customers who had two or more policies but did not file any claims.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t1.customer_id, t1.customer_details FROM customers AS t1 JOIN customer_policies AS t2 ON t1.customer_id = t2.customer_id LEFT JOIN claims AS t3 ON t2.policy_id = t3.policy_id WHERE t3.claim_id IS NULL GROUP BY t1.customer_id, t1.customer_details HAVING count(*) >= 2

insurance_policies.question: List the method, date and amount of all the payments, in ascending order of date.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT payment_method_code, date_payment_made, amount_payment FROM payments ORDER BY date_payment_made ASC

insurance_policies.question: What are the method, date and amount of each payment? Sort the list in ascending order of date.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT payment_method_code, date_payment_made, amount_payment FROM payments JOIN settlements ON payments.settlement_id = settlements.settlement_id ORDER BY date_payment_made ASC

insurance_policies.question: Among all the claims, what is the settlement amount of the claim with the largest claim amount? List both the settlement amount and claim amount.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT max(amount_settled), amount_claimed FROM claims JOIN settlements ON claims.claim_id = settlements.claim_id WHERE amount_claimed = (SELECT max(amount_claimed) FROM claims)

insurance_policies.question: Find the settlement amount of the claim with the largest claim amount. Show both the settlement amount and claim amount.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t1.amount_claimed, t2.amount_settled FROM claims AS t1 JOIN settlements AS t2 ON t1.claim_id  =  t2.claim_id WHERE t1.amount_claimed  =  (SELECT max(amount_claimed) FROM claims)

insurance_policies.question: Among all the claims, what is the amount claimed in the claim with the least amount settled? List both the settlement amount and claim amount.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t1.amount_claimed, t2.amount_settled FROM claims AS t1 JOIN settlements AS t2 ON t1.claim_id  =  t2.claim_id WHERE t2.amount_settled  =  (SELECT min(amount_settled) FROM settlements)

insurance_policies.question: Find the claimed amount in the claim with the least amount settled. Show both the settlement amount and claim amount.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t1.amount_claimed, t2.amount_settled FROM claims AS t1 JOIN settlements AS t2 ON t1.claim_id  =  t2.claim_id WHERE t2.amount_settled  =  (SELECT min(amount_settled) FROM settlements)

insurance_policies.question: Among all the claims, which claims have a claimed amount larger than the average? List the date the claim was made and the date it was settled.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT date_claim_made, date_claim_settled FROM claims WHERE amount_claimed > (SELECT AVG(amount_claimed) FROM claims)

insurance_policies.question: Give me the claim date, settlement date for all the claims whose claimed amount is larger than the average.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT date_claim_made, date_claim_settled FROM claims WHERE amount_claimed > (SELECT AVG(amount_claimed) FROM claims)

insurance_policies.question: Among all the claims, which settlements have a claimed amount that is no more than the average? List the claim start date.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT DISTINCT t2.start_date FROM claims AS t1 JOIN customer_policies AS t2 ON t1.policy_id  =  t2.policy_id JOIN settlements AS t3 ON t1.claim_id  =  t3.claim_id WHERE t3.amount_claimed <= (SELECT avg(amount_claimed) FROM settlements)

insurance_policies.question: Return the claim start date for the claims whose claimed amount is no more than the average
insurance_policies.query: SELECT start_date FROM customer_policies WHERE policy_id IN (SELECT policy_id FROM claims WHERE amount_claimed <= (SELECT avg(amount_claimed) FROM claims))

insurance_policies.question: How many settlements does each claim correspond to? List the claim id and the number of settlements.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t1.claim_id, count(*) FROM claims AS t1 JOIN settlements AS t2 ON t1.claim_id  =  t2.claim_id GROUP BY t1.claim_id

insurance_policies.question: Find the number of settlements each claim corresponds to. Show the number together with the claim id.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT claims.claim_id, COUNT(settlements.settlement_id) AS num_settlements FROM claims LEFT JOIN settlements ON claims.claim_id = settlements.claim_id GROUP BY claims.claim_id

insurance_policies.question: Which claim incurred the most number of settlements? List the claim id, the date the claim was made, and the number.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t1.claim_id, t1.date_claim_made, COUNT(*) AS num_settlements FROM claims AS t1 JOIN settlements AS t2 ON t1.claim_id = t2.claim_id GROUP BY t1.claim_id ORDER BY num_settlements DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_policies.question: Find the claim id and claim date of the claim that incurred the most settlement count. Also tell me the count.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t1.claim_id, t1.date_claim_made, COUNT(*) AS settlement_count FROM claims AS t1 JOIN settlements AS t2 ON t1.claim_id = t2.claim_id GROUP BY t1.claim_id ORDER BY settlement_count DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_policies.question: How many settlements were made on the claim with the most recent claim settlement date? List the number and the claim id.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT count(*) AS num_settlements, claim_id FROM settlements WHERE date_claim_settled = (SELECT max(date_claim_settled) FROM claims) GROUP BY claim_id ORDER BY num_settlements DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_policies.question: Find the claim id and the number of settlements made for the claim with the most recent settlement date.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t1.claim_id, count(*) FROM settlements AS t1 JOIN (SELECT claim_id, max(date_claim_settled) AS max_date FROM settlements GROUP BY claim_id) AS t2 ON t1.claim_id  =  t2.claim_id AND t1.date_claim_settled  =  t2.max_date GROUP BY t1.claim_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_policies.question: Of all the claims, what was the earliest date when any claim was made?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT min(date_claim_made) FROM claims

insurance_policies.question: Tell me the the date when the first claim was made.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT min(date_claim_made) FROM claims

insurance_policies.question: What is the total amount of settlement made for all the settlements?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT sum(amount_settled) FROM settlements

insurance_policies.question: Compute the total amount of settlement across all the settlements.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT sum(amount_settled) FROM settlements

insurance_policies.question: Who are the customers that had more than 1 policy? List the customer details and id.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT customer_id, customer_details FROM customers WHERE customer_id IN (SELECT customer_id FROM customer_policies GROUP BY customer_id HAVING count(*) > 1)

insurance_policies.question: Find the the customer details and id for the customers who had more than one policy.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT customer_id, customer_details FROM customers WHERE customer_id IN (SELECT customer_id FROM customer_policies GROUP BY customer_id HAVING count(*) > 1)

insurance_policies.question: What are the claim dates and settlement dates of all the settlements?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT date_claim_made, date_claim_settled FROM settlements

insurance_policies.question: Tell me the the claim date and settlement date for each settlement case.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t2.date_claim_made, t2.date_claim_settled, t3.date_claim_made, t3.date_claim_settled FROM settlements AS t1 JOIN claims AS t2 ON t1.claim_id = t2.claim_id JOIN claims AS t3 ON t1.claim_id = t3.claim_id

insurance_policies.question: What is the most popular payment method?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT payment_method_code FROM payments GROUP BY payment_method_code ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_policies.question: Which payment method is used the most often?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT payment_method_code FROM payments GROUP BY payment_method_code ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_policies.question: With which kind of payment method were the least number of payments processed?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT payment_method_code FROM payments GROUP BY payment_method_code ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1

insurance_policies.question: What is the payment method that were used the least often?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT payment_method_code FROM payments GROUP BY payment_method_code ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1

insurance_policies.question: What is the total amount of payment?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT sum(amount_payment) FROM payments

insurance_policies.question: Compute the total amount of payment processed.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT sum(amount_payment) FROM payments

insurance_policies.question: What are all the distinct details of the customers?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT DISTINCT customer_details FROM customers

insurance_policies.question: Return the distinct customer details.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT DISTINCT customer_details FROM customers

insurance_policies.question: Which kind of policy type was chosen by the most customers?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT policy_type_code FROM customer_policies GROUP BY policy_type_code ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT customer_id) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_policies.question: Find the policy type the most customers choose.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT policy_type_code FROM customer_policies GROUP BY policy_type_code ORDER BY count(DISTINCT customer_id) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_policies.question: How many settlements are there in total?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT count(*) FROM settlements

insurance_policies.question: Count the total number of settlements made.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT count(*) FROM settlements

insurance_policies.question: Which Payments were processed with Visa? List the payment Id, the date and the amount.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT payment_id, date_payment_made, amount_payment FROM payments AS t1 JOIN settlements AS t2 ON t1.settlement_id  =  t2.settlement_id JOIN claims AS t3 ON t2.claim_id  =  t3.claim_id JOIN customer_policies AS t4 ON t3.policy_id  =  t4.policy_id WHERE payment_method_code  =  'Visa'

insurance_policies.question: Give me the payment Id, the date and the amount for all the payments processed with Visa.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT payment_id, date_payment_made, amount_payment FROM payments WHERE payment_method_code = "Visa"

insurance_policies.question: List the details of the customers who do not have any policies.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id NOT IN (SELECT customer_id FROM customer_policies)

insurance_policies.question: Which customers do not have any policies? Find the details of these customers.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT customer_details FROM customers EXCEPT SELECT t2.customer_details FROM customer_policies AS t1 JOIN customers AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id

insurance_policies.question: List the date the claim was made, the date it was settled and the amount settled for all the claims which had exactly one settlement.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t1.date_claim_made, t1.date_claim_settled, t1.amount_settled FROM claims AS t1 JOIN settlements AS t2 ON t1.claim_id = t2.claim_id GROUP BY t1.claim_id HAVING COUNT(*) = 1

insurance_policies.question: Which claims had exactly one settlement? For each, tell me the the date the claim was made, the date it was settled and the amount settled.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT t1.date_claim_made, t1.date_claim_settled, t1.amount_settled FROM claims AS t1 JOIN settlements AS t2 ON t1.claim_id  =  t2.claim_id GROUP BY t1.claim_id HAVING count(*)  =  1

insurance_policies.question: Find the total claimed amount of all the claims.
insurance_policies.query: SELECT sum(amount_claimed) FROM claims

insurance_policies.question: What is total amount claimed summed across all the claims?
insurance_policies.query: SELECT sum(amount_claimed) FROM claims

hospital_1.question: Which department has the largest number of employees?
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM department AS t1 JOIN physician AS t2 ON t1.head  =  t2.employeeid GROUP BY t1.name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: Find the department with the most employees.
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM department AS t1 JOIN physician AS t2 ON t1.head  =  t2.employeeid GROUP BY t1.name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: What is the employee id of the head whose department has the least number of employees?
hospital_1.query: SELECT head FROM department GROUP BY head ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: Tell me the employee id of the head of the department with the least employees.
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.head FROM department AS t1 JOIN physician AS t2 ON t1.head  =  t2.employeeid GROUP BY t1.head ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: what is the name and position of the head whose department has least number of employees?
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name, t1.position FROM physician AS t1 JOIN department AS t2 ON t1.employeeid = t2.head GROUP BY t2.departmentid ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: Find the name and position of the head of the department with the least employees.
hospital_1.query: SELECT physician.name, physician.position FROM department JOIN physician ON department.head = physician.employeeid GROUP BY department.departmentid ORDER BY COUNT(*) ASC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: What are names of patients who made an appointment?

hospital_1.question: List the names of patients who have made appointments.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT patient.name FROM appointment JOIN patient ON appointment.patient = patient.ssn

hospital_1.question: what are name and phone number of patients who had more than one appointment?
hospital_1.query: SELECT name, phone FROM patient WHERE ssn IN (SELECT patient FROM appointment GROUP BY patient HAVING COUNT(*) > 1)

hospital_1.question: Which patients made more than one appointment? Tell me the name and phone number of these patients.
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name, t1.phone FROM patient AS t1 JOIN appointment AS t2 ON t1.ssn  =  t2.patient GROUP BY t2.patient HAVING count(*)  >  1

hospital_1.question: Find the id of the appointment with the most recent start date?
hospital_1.query: SELECT appointmentID FROM appointment ORDER BY start DESC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: What is the id of the appointment that started most recently?

hospital_1.question: List the name of physicians who took some appointment.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM physician WHERE employeeid IN (SELECT physician FROM appointment)

hospital_1.question: What are the names of all the physicians who took appointments.

hospital_1.question: List the name of physicians who never took any appointment.
hospital_1.query: SELECT name FROM physician WHERE employeeid NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT physician FROM appointment)

hospital_1.question: Which physicians have never taken any appointment? Find their names.
hospital_1.query: SELECT name FROM physician WHERE employeeid NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT physician FROM appointment)

hospital_1.question: Find the names of all physicians and their primary affiliated departments' names.
hospital_1.query: SELECT physician.name, department.name FROM physician JOIN affiliated_with ON physician.employeeid = affiliated_with.physician JOIN department ON affiliated_with.department = department.departmentid WHERE affiliated_with.primaryaffiliation = 1

hospital_1.question: What are the name and primarily affiliated department name of each physician?
hospital_1.query: SELECT physician.name, department.name FROM physician JOIN affiliated_with ON physician.employeeid = affiliated_with.physician JOIN department ON affiliated_with.department = department.departmentid WHERE affiliated_with.primaryaffiliation = 1

hospital_1.question: What is the name of the patient who made the most recent appointment?
hospital_1.query: SELECT t2.name FROM appointment AS t1 JOIN patient AS t2 ON t1.patient  =  t2.ssn ORDER BY t1.start DESC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: Find the name of the patient who made the appointment with the most recent start date.
hospital_1.query: SELECT t2.Name FROM appointment AS t1 JOIN patient AS t2 ON t1.patient  =  t2.SSN WHERE t1.start  =  (SELECT max(start) FROM appointment)

hospital_1.question: How many patients stay in room 112?
hospital_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM stay WHERE room = 112

hospital_1.question: Count the number of patients who stayed in room 112.
hospital_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM stay WHERE room = 112

hospital_1.question: How many patients' prescriptions are made by physician John Dorian?
hospital_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM prescribes AS t1 JOIN physician AS t2 ON t1.physician = t2.employeeid WHERE t2.name = "John Dorian"

hospital_1.question: Find the number of patients' prescriptions physician John Dorian made.
hospital_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM prescribes AS t1 JOIN physician AS t2 ON t1.physician = t2.employeeid WHERE t2.name = "John Dorian"

hospital_1.question: Find the name of medication used on the patient who stays in room 111?
hospital_1.query: SELECT medication.name FROM medication JOIN prescribes ON medication.code = prescribes.medication JOIN appointment ON prescribes.appointment = appointment.appointmentid JOIN stay ON appointment.patient = stay.patient JOIN room ON stay.room = room.roomnumber WHERE room.roomnumber = 111

hospital_1.question: What is the name of the medication used for the patient staying in room 111?
hospital_1.query: SELECT medication.name FROM medication JOIN prescribes ON medication.code = prescribes.medication JOIN appointment ON prescribes.appointment = appointment.appointmentid JOIN stay ON appointment.patient = stay.patient AND appointment.start >= stay.staystart AND appointment.end <= stay.stayend JOIN room ON stay.room = room.roomnumber WHERE room.roomnumber = 111

hospital_1.question: Find the patient who most recently stayed in room 111.
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.Patient FROM stay AS t1 JOIN room AS t2 ON t1.room_number  =  t2.room_number WHERE t2.room_number  =  111 ORDER BY t1.stay_end DESC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: What is the id of the patient who stayed in room 111 most recently?
hospital_1.query: SELECT patient FROM stay WHERE room = 111 ORDER BY stay_end DESC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: What is the name of the nurse has the most appointments?
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM nurse AS t1 JOIN appointment AS t2 ON t1.employeeid = t2.prepnurse GROUP BY t1.name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: Find the name of the nurse who has the largest number of appointments.
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM nurse AS t1 JOIN appointment AS t2 ON t1.employeeid = t2.prepnurse GROUP BY t1.name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: How many patients do each physician take care of? List their names and number of patients they take care of.
hospital_1.query: SELECT physician.name, COUNT(DISTINCT patient.ssn) AS num_patients FROM physician JOIN appointment ON physician.employeeid = appointment.physician JOIN patient ON appointment.patient = patient.ssn GROUP BY physician.name ORDER BY num_patients DESC

hospital_1.question: Return the name of each physician and the number of patients he or she treats.
hospital_1.query: SELECT physician.name, count(appointment.patient) FROM physician JOIN appointment ON physician.employeeid = appointment.physician GROUP BY physician.name

hospital_1.question: Find the name of physicians who are in charge of more than one patient.
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN patient AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.pcp GROUP BY t1.name HAVING count(*)  >  1

hospital_1.question: Which physicians are in charge of more than one patient? Give me their names.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN appointment AS t2 ON t1.employeeid = t2.physician GROUP BY t1.name HAVING count(DISTINCT t2.patient) > 1

hospital_1.question: What are the unique block codes that have available rooms?
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT block_code FROM room WHERE unavailable = 0

hospital_1.question: Tell me the distinct block codes where some rooms are available.

hospital_1.question: Find the number of distinct room types available.

hospital_1.question: What is the names of the physicians who prescribe medication Thesisin?
hospital_1.query: SELECT physician.name FROM physician JOIN prescribes ON physician.employeeid = prescribes.physician JOIN medication ON prescribes.medication = medication.code WHERE medication.name = 'Thesisin'

hospital_1.question: List the names of all the physicians who prescribe Thesisin as medication.
hospital_1.query: SELECT name FROM physician WHERE employeeid IN (SELECT physician FROM prescribes WHERE medication = 'Thesisin')

hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT physician.name, physician.position FROM physician JOIN prescribes ON physician.employeeid = prescribes.physician JOIN medication ON prescribes.medication = medication.code WHERE medication.brand = 'X'

hospital_1.question: Which physicians prescribe a medication of brand X? Tell me the name and position of those physicians.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT physician.name, physician.position FROM physician JOIN prescribes ON physician.employeeid = prescribes.physician JOIN medication ON prescribes.medication = medication.code WHERE medication.brand = 'X'

hospital_1.question: Find the number of medications prescribed for each brand.
hospital_1.query: SELECT brand, count(*) FROM medication JOIN prescribes ON medication.code = prescribes.medication GROUP BY brand

hospital_1.question: How many medications are prescribed for each brand?
hospital_1.query: SELECT brand, count(*) FROM medication JOIN prescribes ON medication.code = prescribes.medication GROUP BY brand

hospital_1.question: Find the name of physicians whose position title contains the word 'senior'.
hospital_1.query: SELECT name FROM physician WHERE position LIKE "%senior%"

hospital_1.question: What are the names of the physicians who have 'senior' in their titles.
hospital_1.query: SELECT name FROM physician WHERE position LIKE '%senior%'

hospital_1.question: Find the patient who has the most recent undergoing treatment?
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.Patient FROM undergoes AS t1 JOIN procedures AS t2 ON t1.procedures  =  t2.code WHERE t1.dateundergoes  =  (SELECT max(dateundergoes) FROM undergoes)

hospital_1.question: Which patient is undergoing the most recent treatment?
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM patient AS t1 JOIN undergoes AS t2 ON t1.ssn  =  t2.patient GROUP BY t1.name ORDER BY max(t2.dateundergoes) DESC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: Find the names of all patients who have an undergoing treatment and are staying in room 111.
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM patient AS t1 JOIN undergoes AS t2 ON t1.ssn  =  t2.patient JOIN stay AS t3 ON t1.ssn  =  t3.patient JOIN room AS t4 ON t3.room_number  =  t4.room_number WHERE t2.dateundergoes <= t3.stayend AND t2.dateundergoes >= t3.staystart AND t4.roomnumber  =  111

hospital_1.question: What are the names of patients who are staying in room 111 and have an undergoing treatment?
hospital_1.query: SELECT p.name FROM patient AS p JOIN stay AS s ON p.ssn = s.patient JOIN undergoes AS u ON p.ssn = u.patient WHERE s.room = 111 AND u.dateundergoes IS NOT NULL

hospital_1.question: List the names of all distinct nurses ordered by alphabetical order?
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM nurse ORDER BY name ASC

hospital_1.question: What is the alphabetically ordered list of all the distinct names of nurses?
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM nurse ORDER BY name ASC

hospital_1.question: Find the names of nurses who are nursing an undergoing treatment.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.name FROM nurse AS t1 JOIN appointment AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.prepnurse JOIN undergoes AS t3 ON t2.patient  =  t3.patient AND t2.physician  =  t3.physician AND t2.start  =  t3.dateundergoes AND t2.examinationroom  =  t3.assistingnurse

hospital_1.question: Which nurses are in charge of patients undergoing treatments?
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.name FROM nurse AS t1 JOIN appointment AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.prepnurse JOIN undergoes AS t3 ON t2.patient  =  t3.patient AND t2.physician  =  t3.physician AND t2.start  =  t3.dateundergoes JOIN trained_in AS t4 ON t2.physician  =  t4.physician AND t3.procedures  =  t4.treatment

hospital_1.question: List the names of all distinct medications, ordered in an alphabetical order.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM medication ORDER BY name ASC

hospital_1.question: What is the alphabetically ordered list of all distinct medications?
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM medication ORDER BY name ASC

hospital_1.question: What are the names of the physician who prescribed the highest dose?
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN prescribes AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.physician JOIN medication AS t3 ON t2.medication  =  t3.code WHERE t2.dose  =  (SELECT max(dose) FROM prescribes)

hospital_1.question: Find the physician who prescribed the highest dose. What is his or her name?
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN prescribes AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.physician GROUP BY t1.name ORDER BY sum(t2.dose) DESC LIMIT 1

hospital_1.question: List the physicians' employee ids together with their primary affiliation departments' ids.
hospital_1.query: SELECT physician.employeeid, affiliated_with.department FROM physician JOIN affiliated_with ON physician.employeeid = affiliated_with.physician WHERE affiliated_with.primaryaffiliation = 1

hospital_1.question: What are each physician's employee id and department id primarily affiliated.
hospital_1.query: SELECT physician.employeeid, affiliated_with.department FROM physician JOIN affiliated_with ON physician.employeeid = affiliated_with.physician WHERE affiliated_with.primaryaffiliation = 1

hospital_1.question: List the names of departments where some physicians are primarily affiliated with.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.name FROM department AS t1 JOIN affiliated_with AS t2 ON t1.departmentid  =  t2.department JOIN physician AS t3 ON t2.physician  =  t3.employeeid WHERE t2.primaryaffiliation  =  1

hospital_1.question: What are the names of departments that have primarily affiliated physicians.
hospital_1.query: SELECT name FROM department WHERE primaryaffiliation = 'Y'

hospital_1.question: What nurses are on call with block floor 1 and block code 1? Tell me their names.
hospital_1.query: SELECT name FROM nurse AS n JOIN on_call AS o ON n.employeeid = o.nurse WHERE o.blockfloor = 1 AND o.blockcode = 1

hospital_1.question: Find the ids of the nurses who are on call in block floor 1 and block code 1.
hospital_1.query: SELECT nurse FROM on_call WHERE blockfloor = 1 AND blockcode = 1

hospital_1.question: What are the highest cost, lowest cost and average cost of procedures?
hospital_1.query: SELECT max(cost), min(cost), avg(cost) FROM procedures

hospital_1.question: Tell me the highest, lowest, and average cost of procedures.
hospital_1.query: SELECT max(cost), min(cost), avg(cost) FROM procedures

hospital_1.question: List the name and cost of all procedures sorted by the cost from the highest to the lowest.
hospital_1.query: SELECT name, cost FROM procedures ORDER BY cost DESC

hospital_1.question: Sort the list of names and costs of all procedures in the descending order of cost.
hospital_1.query: SELECT name, cost FROM procedures ORDER BY cost DESC

hospital_1.question: Find the three most expensive procedures.
hospital_1.query: SELECT name, cost FROM procedures ORDER BY cost DESC LIMIT 3

hospital_1.question: What are the three most costly procedures?
hospital_1.query: SELECT name, cost FROM procedures ORDER BY cost DESC LIMIT 3

hospital_1.question: Find the physicians who are trained in a procedure that costs more than 5000.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN trained_in AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.physician JOIN procedures AS t3 ON t2.treatment  =  t3.code WHERE t3.cost  >  5000

hospital_1.question: Which physicians are trained in procedures that are more expensive than 5000?
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.Name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN trained_in AS t2 ON t1.EmployeeID  =  t2.Physician JOIN procedures AS t3 ON t2.Treatment  =  t3.Code WHERE t3.Cost > 5000

hospital_1.question: Find the physician who was trained in the most expensive procedure?
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN trained_in AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.physician JOIN procedures AS t3 ON t2.treatment  =  t3.code WHERE t3.cost  =  (SELECT max(cost) FROM procedures)

hospital_1.question: Which physician was trained in the procedure that costs the most.
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN trained_in AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.physician JOIN procedures AS t3 ON t2.treatment  =  t3.code WHERE t3.cost  =  (SELECT max(cost) FROM procedures)

hospital_1.question: What is the average cost of procedures that physician John Wen was trained in?
hospital_1.query: SELECT avg(procedures.cost) FROM procedures JOIN trained_in ON procedures.code = trained_in.treatment JOIN physician ON trained_in.physician = physician.employeeid WHERE physician.name = 'John Wen'

hospital_1.question: Compute the mean price of procedures physician John Wen was trained in.
hospital_1.query: SELECT AVG(procedures.cost) FROM procedures JOIN trained_in ON procedures.code = trained_in.treatment JOIN physician ON trained_in.physician = physician.employeeid WHERE physician.name = 'John Wen'

hospital_1.question: Find the names of procedures which physician John Wen was trained in.
hospital_1.query: SELECT t2.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN trained_in AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.physician JOIN procedures AS t3 ON t2.treatment  =  t3.code WHERE t1.name  =  "John Wen"

hospital_1.question: What are the names of procedures physician John Wen was trained in?
hospital_1.query: SELECT t2.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN trained_in AS t3 ON t1.employeeid  =  t3.physician JOIN procedures AS t2 ON t3.treatment  =  t2.code WHERE t1.name  =  "John Wen"

hospital_1.question: Find all procedures which cost more than 1000 or which physician John Wen was trained in.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT procedures.name FROM procedures JOIN trained_in ON procedures.code = trained_in.treatment JOIN physician ON trained_in.physician = physician.employeeid WHERE procedures.cost > 1000 OR physician.name = 'John Wen'

hospital_1.question: What are the procedures that cost more than 1000 or are specialized in by physician John Wen?
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.name FROM procedures AS t1 LEFT JOIN trained_in AS t2 ON t1.code  =  t2.treatment LEFT JOIN physician AS t3 ON t2.physician  =  t3.employeeid WHERE t1.cost > 1000 OR t3.name  =  'John Wen'

hospital_1.question: Find the names of all procedures which cost more than 1000 but which physician John Wen was not trained in?
hospital_1.query: SELECT name FROM procedures WHERE cost > 1000 AND code NOT IN (SELECT treatment FROM trained_in WHERE physician = (SELECT employeeid FROM physician WHERE name = 'John Wen'))

hospital_1.question: Among the procedures that cost more than 1000, which were not specialized in by physician John Wen?
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.name FROM procedures AS t1 JOIN undergoes AS t2 ON t1.code  =  t2.procedures JOIN physician AS t3 ON t2.physician  =  t3.employeeid WHERE t1.cost > 1000 AND t3.name != "John Wen"

hospital_1.question: Find the names of all procedures such that the cost is less than 5000 and physician John Wen was trained in.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.name FROM procedures AS t1 JOIN trained_in AS t2 ON t1.code  =  t2.treatment JOIN physician AS t3 ON t2.physician  =  t3.employeeid WHERE t1.cost < 5000 AND t3.name  =  "John Wen"

hospital_1.question: What procedures cost less than 5000 and have John Wen as a trained physician?
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM procedures AS t1 JOIN trained_in AS t2 ON t1.code  =  t2.treatment JOIN physician AS t3 ON t2.physician  =  t3.employeeid WHERE t1.cost < 5000 AND t3.name  =  'John Wen'

hospital_1.question: Find the name of physicians who are affiliated with both Surgery and Psychiatry departments.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN affiliated_with AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.physician JOIN department AS t3 ON t2.department  =  t3.departmentid WHERE t3.name  =  "Surgery" AND t1.employeeid IN (SELECT physician FROM affiliated_with WHERE department IN (SELECT departmentid FROM department WHERE name  =  "Psychiatry"))

hospital_1.question: Which physicians are affiliated with both Surgery and Psychiatry departments? Tell me their names.
hospital_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN affiliated_with AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.physician JOIN department AS t3 ON t2.department  =  t3.departmentid WHERE t3.name  =  "Surgery" INTERSECT SELECT t1.name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN affiliated_with AS t2 ON t1.employeeid  =  t2.physician JOIN department AS t3 ON t2.department  =  t3.departmentid WHERE t3.name  =  "Psychiatry"

hospital_1.question: Find the name of physicians who are affiliated with Surgery or Psychiatry department.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.Name FROM Physician AS t1 JOIN Affiliated_With AS t2 ON t1.EmployeeID = t2.Physician JOIN Department AS t3 ON t2.Department = t3.DepartmentID WHERE t3.Name = "Surgery" OR t3.Name = "Psychiatry"

hospital_1.question: Which physicians are affiliated with either Surgery or Psychiatry department? Give me their names.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM physician AS t1 JOIN affiliated_with AS t2 ON t1.employeeid = t2.physician JOIN department AS t3 ON t2.department = t3.departmentid WHERE t3.name = "Surgery" OR t3.name = "Psychiatry"

hospital_1.question: Find the names of patients who are not using the medication of Procrastin-X.
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT p.name FROM patient AS p LEFT JOIN prescribes AS pr ON p.ssn = pr.patient LEFT JOIN medication AS m ON pr.medication = m.code WHERE m.name IS NULL OR m.name != 'Procrastin-X'

hospital_1.question: What are the names of patients who are not taking the medication of Procrastin-X.
hospital_1.query: SELECT name FROM patient WHERE ssn NOT IN (SELECT patient FROM prescribes WHERE medication = (SELECT code FROM medication WHERE name = "Procrastin-X"))

hospital_1.question: Find the number of patients who are not using the medication of Procrastin-X.
hospital_1.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT patient.ssn) FROM patient WHERE patient.ssn NOT IN (SELECT prescribes.patient FROM prescribes WHERE prescribes.medication = 'Procrastin-X')

hospital_1.question: How many patients are not using Procrastin-X as medication?
hospital_1.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT patient.ssn) FROM patient WHERE patient.ssn NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT prescribes.patient FROM prescribes WHERE prescribes.medication = 'Procrastin-X')

hospital_1.question: How many appointments are there?
hospital_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM appointment

hospital_1.question: Count how many appointments have been made in total.
hospital_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM appointment

hospital_1.question: Find the names of nurses who are on call.
hospital_1.query: SELECT nurse.name FROM on_call AS oc JOIN nurse ON oc.nurse = nurse.employeeid

hospital_1.question: What are the distinct names of nurses on call?
hospital_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM nurse JOIN on_call ON nurse.employeeid = on_call.nurse

ship_mission.question: Show codes and fates of missions, and names of ships involved.
ship_mission.query: SELECT T1.Code, T1.Fate, T2.Name FROM mission AS T1 JOIN ship AS T2 ON T1.Ship_ID = T2.Ship_ID

ship_mission.question: What are the mission codes, fates, and names of the ships involved?
ship_mission.query: SELECT mission.Code, mission.Fate, ship.Name FROM mission JOIN ship ON mission.Ship_ID = ship.Ship_ID

ship_mission.question: Show names of ships involved in a mission launched after 1928.
ship_mission.query: SELECT ship.Name FROM mission JOIN ship ON mission.Ship_ID = ship.Ship_ID WHERE Launched_Year > 1928

ship_mission.question: What are the names of ships that were involved in a mission launched after 1928?
ship_mission.query: SELECT ship.Name FROM ship JOIN mission ON ship.Ship_ID = mission.Ship_ID WHERE mission.Launched_Year > 1928

ship_mission.question: Show the distinct fate of missions that involve ships with nationality "United States"
ship_mission.query: SELECT DISTINCT Fate FROM mission WHERE Ship_ID IN (SELECT Ship_ID FROM ship WHERE Nationality  =  'United States')

ship_mission.question: What are the different fates of the mission that involved ships from the United States?
ship_mission.query: SELECT DISTINCT Fate FROM mission JOIN ship ON mission.Ship_ID = ship.Ship_ID WHERE ship.Nationality = 'United States'

ship_mission.question: List the name of ships that are not involved in any mission
ship_mission.query: SELECT name FROM ship WHERE ship_id NOT IN (SELECT ship_id FROM mission)

ship_mission.question: What are the names of the ships that are not involved in any missions?
ship_mission.query: SELECT name FROM ship WHERE ship_id NOT IN (SELECT ship_id FROM mission)

ship_mission.question: Show the types of ships that have both ships with tonnage larger than 6000 and ships with tonnage smaller than 4000.
ship_mission.query: SELECT type FROM ship WHERE tonnage > 6000 INTERSECT SELECT type FROM ship WHERE tonnage < 4000

ship_mission.question: What are the types of the ships that have both shiips with tonnage more than 6000 and those with tonnage less than 4000?
ship_mission.query: SELECT type FROM ship WHERE tonnage > 6000 INTERSECT SELECT type FROM ship WHERE tonnage < 4000

company_employee.question: How many companies are headquartered in the US?
company_employee.query: SELECT count(*) FROM company WHERE headquarters  =  'US'

company_employee.question: List the names of companies by ascending number of sales.
company_employee.query: SELECT name FROM company ORDER BY Sales_in_Billion ASC

company_employee.question: What are the headquarters and industries of all companies?
Show the names of companies in the banking or retailing industry?
company_employee.query: SELECT name FROM company WHERE industry IN ('banking', 'retailing')

company_employee.question: What is the maximum and minimum market value of companies?
What is the headquarter of the company with the largest sales?
company_employee.query: SELECT headquarters FROM company WHERE sales_in_billion = (SELECT MAX(sales_in_billion) FROM company)

company_employee.question: Show the different headquarters and number of companies at each headquarter.
company_employee.query: SELECT headquarters, COUNT(DISTINCT company_id) FROM company GROUP BY headquarters

company_employee.question: Show the most common headquarter for companies.
company_employee.query: SELECT headquarters, COUNT(*) AS count FROM company GROUP BY headquarters ORDER BY count DESC LIMIT 1

company_employee.question: Show the headquarters that have at least two companies.
company_employee.query: SELECT T1.headquarters FROM company AS T1 GROUP BY T1.headquarters HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2

company_employee.question: Show the headquarters that have both companies in banking industry and companies in oil and gas industry.
company_employee.query: SELECT T1.headquarters FROM company AS T1 JOIN employment AS T2 ON T1.company_id  =  T2.company_id JOIN people AS T3 ON T2.people_id  =  T3.people_id WHERE T1.industry  =  'banking' INTERSECT SELECT T1.headquarters FROM company AS T1 JOIN employment AS T2 ON T1.company_id  =  T2.company_id JOIN people AS T3 ON T2.people_id  =  T3.people_id WHERE T1.industry  =  'oil and gas'

company_employee.question: Show the names of companies and of employees.
company_employee.query: SELECT T2.name AS company_name, T1.name AS employee_name FROM people AS T1 JOIN employment AS T3 ON T1.people_id = T3.people_id JOIN company AS T2 ON T3.company_id = T2.company_id

company_employee.question: Show names of companies and that of employees in descending order of number of years working for that employee.
company_employee.query: SELECT T2.name, T1.name FROM people AS T1 JOIN employment AS T2 ON T1.people_id = T2.people_id ORDER BY T2.year_working DESC

company_employee.question: Show the names of employees that work for companies with sales bigger than 200.
company_employee.query: SELECT T1.name FROM people AS T1 JOIN employment AS T2 ON T1.people_id = T2.people_id JOIN company AS T3 ON T2.company_id = T3.company_id WHERE T3.sales_in_billion > 200

company_employee.question: Show the names of companies and the number of employees they have
company_employee.query: SELECT T1.name ,  COUNT(*) FROM company AS T1 JOIN employment AS T2 ON T1.company_id  =  T2.company_id JOIN people AS T3 ON T2.people_id  =  T3.people_id GROUP BY T1.name

company_employee.question: List the names of people that are not employed by any company
company_employee.query: SELECT name FROM people WHERE people_id NOT IN (SELECT people_id FROM employment)

company_employee.question: list the names of the companies with more than 200 sales in the descending order of sales and profits.
company_employee.query: SELECT name FROM company WHERE sales_in_billion > 200 ORDER BY sales_in_billion DESC, profits_in_billion DESC

film_rank.query: SELECT DISTINCT director FROM film WHERE film_id IN (SELECT film_id FROM film_market_estimation WHERE year = 1995)

film_rank.question: What is the average number of cities of markets with low film market estimate bigger than 10000?
film_rank.query: SELECT AVG(number_cities) FROM market INNER JOIN film_market_estimation ON market.market_id = film_market_estimation.market_id WHERE low_estimate > 10000 GROUP BY market.market_id

film_rank.question: Give the average number of cities within markets that had a low market estimation larger than 10000?
film_rank.query: SELECT avg(T2.number_cities) FROM film_market_estimation AS T1 JOIN market AS T2 ON T1.market_id = T2.market_id WHERE T1.low_estimate > 10000 GROUP BY T1.market_id

film_rank.question: Please list the countries and years of film market estimations.
film_rank.query: SELECT DISTINCT country, year FROM market JOIN film_market_estimation ON market.market_id = film_market_estimation.market_id ORDER BY country, year

film_rank.question: What are the countries of markets and their corresponding years of market estimation?
film_rank.query: SELECT T2.country, T3.year FROM market AS T2 JOIN film_market_estimation AS T3 ON T2.market_id  =  T3.market_id GROUP BY T2.country, T3.year

film_rank.question: Please list the years of film market estimations when the market is in country "Japan" in descending order.
film_rank.query: SELECT year FROM film_market_estimation JOIN market ON film_market_estimation.market_id = market.market_id WHERE country = 'Japan' ORDER BY year DESC

film_rank.question: What are the years of film market estimation for the market of Japan, ordered by year descending?
film_rank.query: SELECT year FROM film_market_estimation JOIN market ON film_market_estimation.market_id = market.market_id WHERE country = 'Japan' ORDER BY year DESC

film_rank.question: List the studios of each film and the number of films produced by that studio.
film_rank.query: SELECT studio, COUNT(*) FROM film GROUP BY studio

film_rank.question: How films are produced by each studio?
film_rank.query: SELECT studio, COUNT(*) AS num_films FROM film GROUP BY studio

film_rank.question: List the name of film studio that have the most number of films.
film_rank.query: SELECT studio, COUNT(*) FROM film GROUP BY studio ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

film_rank.question: What is the name of teh studio that created the most films?
film_rank.query: SELECT studio FROM film GROUP BY studio ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

film_rank.question: List the names of studios that have at least two films.
film_rank.query: SELECT studio FROM film GROUP BY studio HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2

film_rank.question: What are the names of studios that have made two or more films?
film_rank.query: SELECT studio FROM film GROUP BY studio HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2

film_rank.question: List the title of films that do not have any market estimation.
film_rank.query: SELECT title FROM film WHERE film_id NOT IN (SELECT film_id FROM film_market_estimation)

film_rank.query: SELECT title FROM film WHERE film_id NOT IN (SELECT film_id FROM film_market_estimation)

film_rank.question: Show the studios that have produced films with director "Nicholas Meyer" and "Walter Hill".
film_rank.query: SELECT studio FROM film WHERE director = 'Nicholas Meyer' OR director = 'Walter Hill' GROUP BY studio HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT director) = 2

film_rank.question: What are the names of studios that have produced films with both Nicholas Meyer and Walter Hill?
film_rank.query: SELECT studio FROM film WHERE director = 'Nicholas Meyer' AND film_id IN (SELECT film_id FROM film WHERE director = 'Walter Hill')

film_rank.question: Find the titles and studios of the films that are produced by some film studios that contained the word "Universal".
film_rank.query: SELECT title, studio FROM film WHERE studio LIKE '%Universal%'

film_rank.question: What are the titles and studios of films that have been produced by a studio whose name contains "Universal"?
film_rank.query: SELECT title, studio FROM film WHERE studio LIKE '%Universal%'

film_rank.question: Show the studios that have not produced films with director "Walter Hill".
film_rank.query: SELECT DISTINCT studio FROM film WHERE director <> 'Walter Hill' OR director IS NULL

film_rank.question: Which studios have never worked with the director Walter Hill?
film_rank.query: SELECT DISTINCT studio FROM film WHERE director <> 'Walter Hill' OR director IS NULL

film_rank.question: List the studios which average gross is above 4500000.
film_rank.query: SELECT studio FROM film GROUP BY studio HAVING AVG(gross_in_dollar) > 4500000

film_rank.question: Which studios have an average gross of over 4500000?
film_rank.query: SELECT studio FROM film GROUP BY studio HAVING AVG(gross_in_dollar) > 4500000

film_rank.question: What is the title of the film that has the highest high market estimation.
film_rank.query: SELECT title FROM film JOIN film_market_estimation ON film.film_id = film_market_estimation.film_id WHERE high_estimate = (SELECT MAX(high_estimate) FROM film_market_estimation)

film_rank.question: Return the title of the film with the highest high estimate?
film_rank.query: SELECT title FROM film JOIN film_market_estimation ON film.film_id = film_market_estimation.film_id ORDER BY high_estimate DESC LIMIT 1

film_rank.question: What are the titles and directors of the films were never presented in China?

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What are the distinct grant amount for the grants where the documents were sent before '1986-08-26 20:49:27' and grant were ended after '1989-03-16 18:27:16'?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.grant_amount FROM Grants AS T1 JOIN Documents AS T2 ON T1.grant_id  =  T2.grant_id WHERE T2.sent_date < '1986-08-26 20:49:27' AND T1.grant_end_date > '1989-03-16 18:27:16'

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What are the different grant amounts for documents sent before '1986-08-26 20:49:27' and after the grant ended on '1989-03-16 18:27:16'?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.grant_amount FROM Documents AS T1 JOIN Grants AS T2 ON T1.grant_id  =  T2.grant_id WHERE T1.sent_date < '1986-08-26 20:49:27' AND T2.grant_end_date > '1989-03-16 18:27:16'

tracking_grants_for_research.question: List the project details of the project both producing patent and paper as outcomes.
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT T1.project_details FROM Projects AS T1 JOIN Project_Outcomes AS T2 ON T1.project_id  =  T2.project_id JOIN Research_Outcomes AS T3 ON T2.outcome_code  =  T3.outcome_code WHERE T3.outcome_description IN ('Patent', 'Paper') GROUP BY T1.project_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT T3.outcome_description)  =  2

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What are the details of the project that is producing both patents and papers as outcomes?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.project_details FROM Projects AS T1 JOIN Project_Outcomes AS T2 ON T1.project_id = T2.project_id JOIN Research_Outcomes AS T3 ON T2.outcome_code = T3.outcome_code WHERE T3.outcome_description IN ('patents', 'papers') GROUP BY T1.project_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT T3.outcome_description) = 2

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What is the total grant amount of the organisations described as research?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT SUM(grant_amount) FROM Grants JOIN Organisations ON Grants.organisation_id = Organisations.organisation_id JOIN Organisation_Types ON Organisations.organisation_type = Organisation_Types.organisation_type WHERE Organisation_Types.organisation_type_description = 'research'

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What is the total amount of grant money for research?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT SUM(grant_amount) FROM Grants JOIN Organisation_Types ON Grants.organisation_id = Organisations.organisation_id WHERE organisation_type_description = 'Research'

tracking_grants_for_research.question: List from which date and to which date these staff work: project staff of the project which hires the most staffs
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT T1.date_from, T1.date_to FROM Project_Staff AS T1 JOIN (SELECT project_id FROM Project_Staff GROUP BY project_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1) AS T2 ON T1.project_id = T2.project_id

tracking_grants_for_research.question: From what date and to what date do the staff work on a project that has the most staff and has staff in a leader role?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT T1.date_from, T1.date_to FROM Project_Staff AS T1 JOIN Staff_Roles AS T2 ON T1.role_code = T2.role_code WHERE T2.role_description = 'leader' AND T1.project_id IN (SELECT project_id FROM Project_Staff GROUP BY project_id HAVING COUNT(*) = (SELECT MAX(count) FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) AS count FROM Project_Staff GROUP BY project_id) AS T))

tracking_grants_for_research.question: Find the organisation ids and details of the organisations which are involved in
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.organisation_id, T3.organisation_details FROM Documents AS T1 JOIN Projects AS T2 ON T1.project_id = T2.project_id JOIN Organisations AS T3 ON T2.organisation_id = T3.organisation_id WHERE T1.document_type_code = 'report'

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What are the ids and details for all organizations that have grants of more than 6000 dollars?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT T1.organisation_id, T1.organisation_details FROM Organisations AS T1 JOIN Grants AS T2 ON T1.organisation_id = T2.organisation_id WHERE T2.grant_amount > 6000

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What is the organisation type and id of the organisation which has the most number of research staff?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT T1.organisation_type, T2.organisation_id FROM Organisation_Types AS T1 JOIN Organisations AS T2 ON T1.organisation_type = T2.organisation_type JOIN Research_Staff AS T3 ON T2.organisation_id = T3.employer_organisation_id GROUP BY T2.organisation_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What is the type and id of the organization that has the most research staff?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT T1.organisation_type, T2.organisation_id FROM Organisation_Types AS T1 JOIN Organisations AS T2 ON T1.organisation_type = T2.organisation_type WHERE T2.organisation_id IN (SELECT employer_organisation_id FROM Research_Staff GROUP BY employer_organisation_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1)

tracking_grants_for_research.question: Which organisation type hires most research staff?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT T1.organisation_type, COUNT(*) FROM Organisation_Types AS T1 JOIN Organisations AS T2 ON T1.organisation_type = T2.organisation_type JOIN Research_Staff AS T3 ON T2.organisation_id = T3.employer_organisation_id GROUP BY T1.organisation_type ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What is the type of the organization with the most research staff?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT T1.organisation_type FROM Organisation_Types AS T1 JOIN Organisations AS T2 ON T1.organisation_type = T2.organisation_type JOIN Research_Staff AS T3 ON T2.organisation_id = T3.employer_organisation_id GROUP BY T1.organisation_type ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_grants_for_research.question: Find out the send dates of the documents with the grant amount of more than 5000 were granted by organisation type described
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT T1.sent_date FROM Documents AS T1 JOIN Grants AS T2 ON T1.grant_id  =  T2.grant_id JOIN Organisations AS T3 ON T2.organisation_id  =  T3.organisation_id JOIN Organisation_Types AS T4 ON T3.organisation_type  =  T4.organisation_type WHERE T2.grant_amount > 5000 AND T4.organisation_type_description  =  'Research Institution'

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What are the send dates for all documents that have a grant amount of more than 5000 and are involved in research?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT sent_date FROM Documents AS D JOIN Grants AS G ON D.grant_id = G.grant_id JOIN Organisations AS O ON G.organisation_id = O.organisation_id JOIN Organisation_Types AS OT ON O.organisation_type = OT.organisation_type WHERE G.grant_amount > 5000 AND OT.organisation_type_description = 'Research'

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What are the response received dates for the documents described as 'Regular' or granted with more than 100?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT response_received_date FROM Documents AS D JOIN Document_Types AS DT ON D.document_type_code = DT.document_type_code JOIN Grants AS G ON D.grant_id = G.grant_id WHERE DT.document_description = 'Regular' OR G.grant_amount > 100

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What is the response received date for the document described as Regular that was granted more than 100 dollars?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT D.response_received_date FROM Documents AS D JOIN Grants AS G ON D.grant_id = G.grant_id JOIN Document_Types AS DT ON D.document_type_code = DT.document_type_code WHERE DT.document_description = 'Regular' AND G.grant_amount > 100

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What are the details for all projects that did not hire any staff in a research role?

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What are the task details, task id and project id for the projects which are detailed as 'omnis' or  have more than 2 outcomes?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT T1.task_details, T1.task_id, T1.project_id FROM Tasks AS T1 JOIN Projects AS T2 ON T1.project_id = T2.project_id LEFT JOIN Project_Outcomes AS T3 ON T1.project_id = T3.project_id WHERE T2.project_details = 'omnis' OR (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Project_Outcomes WHERE project_id = T1.project_id) > 2

tracking_grants_for_research.question: What are the task details, task ids, and project ids for the progrects that are detailed as 'omnis' or have at least 3 outcomes?
tracking_grants_for_research.query: SELECT T1.task_details, T1.task_id, T1.project_id FROM Tasks AS T1 JOIN Projects AS T2 ON T1.project_id = T2.project_id LEFT JOIN Project_Outcomes AS T3 ON T1.project_id = T3.project_id WHERE T2.project_details = 'omnis' OR (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Project_Outcomes WHERE project_id = T1.project_id) >= 3

tracking_grants_for_research.question: When do all the researcher role staff start to work, and when do they stop working?

tracking_grants_for_research.question: When did researchers start and stop working?

network_2.question: Find the name and age of the person who is a friend of both Dan and Alice.
network_2.query: SELECT pf2.friend, p2.age FROM PersonFriend AS pf1 JOIN PersonFriend AS pf2 ON pf1.friend = pf2.friend AND pf1.name <> pf2.name JOIN Person AS p1 ON pf1.name = p1.name JOIN Person AS p2 ON pf2.name = p2.name WHERE pf1.name = "Dan" AND pf2.name = "Alice"

network_2.question: What are the names and ages of every person who is a friend of both Dan and Alice?
network_2.query: SELECT pf1.friend, p1.age FROM PersonFriend AS pf1 JOIN PersonFriend AS pf2 ON pf1.friend = pf2.friend AND pf2.name = "Dan" JOIN Person AS p1 ON pf1.friend = p1.name WHERE pf1.name = "Alice"

network_2.question: Find the name and age of the person who is a friend of Dan or Alice.
network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.name, T2.age FROM PersonFriend AS T1 JOIN Person AS T2 ON T1.friend = T2.name WHERE T1.name = "Dan" OR T1.name = "Alice"

network_2.question: What are the different names and ages of every friend of either Dan or alice?
network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT p.name, p.age FROM Person AS p JOIN PersonFriend AS pf ON p.name = pf.friend WHERE pf.name = 'Dan' OR pf.name = 'alice' UNION SELECT DISTINCT p.name, p.age FROM Person AS p JOIN PersonFriend AS pf ON p.name = pf.name WHERE pf.friend = 'Dan' OR pf.friend = 'alice'

network_2.question: Find the name of the person who has friends with age above 40 and under age 30?
network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT pf1.name FROM PersonFriend AS pf1 JOIN PersonFriend AS pf2 ON pf1.friend = pf2.friend JOIN Person AS p ON pf1.name = p.name WHERE p.age < 30 AND p.gender = "M" AND pf2.year > 40 AND pf2.year < 30

network_2.question: What are the names of every person who has a friend over 40 and under 30?
network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT p1.name FROM Person AS p1 JOIN PersonFriend AS pf ON p1.name = pf.name JOIN Person AS p2 ON pf.friend = p2.name WHERE p2.age > 40 AND p2.age < 30

network_2.question: Find the name of the person who has friends with age above 40 but not under age 30?
network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT pf1.name FROM PersonFriend AS pf1 JOIN PersonFriend AS pf2 ON pf1.friend = pf2.friend JOIN Person AS p ON pf1.name = p.name WHERE p.age > 40 AND pf2.year IS NOT NULL AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM Person AS p2 WHERE p2.name = pf1.name AND p2.age < 30)

network_2.question: What are the names of the people who are older 40 but no friends under age 30?
network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT p1.name FROM person AS p1 LEFT JOIN personfriend AS pf ON p1.name = pf.name LEFT JOIN person AS p2 ON pf.friend = p2.name WHERE p1.age > 40 AND (p2.age < 30 OR p2.age IS NULL)

network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT pf.friend FROM PersonFriend AS pf JOIN Person AS p ON pf.friend = p.name WHERE p.city = 'New York'

network_2.question: Who has friends that are younger than the average age?
network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT p.name FROM Person AS p JOIN PersonFriend AS pf ON p.name = pf.name JOIN Person AS f ON pf.friend = f.name WHERE f.age < (SELECT avg(age) FROM Person)

network_2.question: What are the different names of friends who are younger than the average age for a friend?
network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT pf.friend FROM PersonFriend pf WHERE pf.friend IN (SELECT pf2.friend FROM PersonFriend pf2 JOIN Person p ON pf2.friend = p.name GROUP BY pf2.friend HAVING AVG(p.age) < (SELECT AVG(p2.age) FROM Person p2))

network_2.question: Who has friends that are older than the average age? Print their friends and their ages as well
network_2.query: SELECT T2.name, T2.age, T3.name, T3.age FROM PersonFriend AS T1 JOIN Person AS T2 ON T1.name = T2.name JOIN Person AS T3 ON T1.friend = T3.name WHERE T3.age > (SELECT AVG(age) FROM Person)

network_2.question: Whare the names, friends, and ages of all people who are older than the average age of a person?
network_2.query: SELECT p1.name, p2.name AS friend, p1.age FROM Person AS p1 JOIN PersonFriend AS pf ON p1.name = pf.name JOIN Person AS p2 ON pf.friend = p2.name WHERE p1.age > (SELECT AVG(age) FROM Person) ORDER BY p1.age DESC

network_2.question: Who is the friend of Zach with longest year relationship?
network_2.query: SELECT t2.friend FROM PersonFriend AS t1 JOIN PersonFriend AS t2 ON t1.friend  =  t2.name WHERE t1.name  =  'Zach' ORDER BY t2.year DESC LIMIT 1

network_2.question: Which friend of Zach has the longest-lasting friendship?
network_2.query: SELECT friend FROM PersonFriend WHERE name = 'Zach' ORDER BY year DESC LIMIT 1

network_2.question: What is the age of the friend of Zach with longest year relationship?
network_2.query: SELECT age FROM Person AS T1 JOIN PersonFriend AS T2 ON T1.name = T2.friend WHERE T2.name = "Zach" ORDER BY T2.year DESC LIMIT 1

network_2.question: What are the ages of all of Zach's friends who are in the longest relationship?
network_2.query: SELECT age FROM PersonFriend AS t1 JOIN Person AS t2 ON t1.friend = t2.name WHERE t1.name = 'Zach' AND t1.year = (SELECT MAX(year) FROM PersonFriend WHERE name = 'Zach')

network_2.question: Find the name of persons who are friends with Alice for the shortest years.
network_2.query: SELECT friend FROM PersonFriend WHERE name = "Alice" ORDER BY year ASC LIMIT 1

network_2.question: What are the names of all people who are friends with Alice for the shortest amount of time?
network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT pf.friend FROM PersonFriend AS pf WHERE pf.name = "Alice" AND pf.year = (SELECT MIN(year) FROM PersonFriend WHERE name = "Alice")

network_2.question: Find the name, age, and job title of persons who are friends with Alice for the longest years.
network_2.query: SELECT T1.name, T1.age, T1.job FROM Person AS T1 JOIN PersonFriend AS T2 ON T1.name = T2.friend WHERE T2.name = "Alice" ORDER BY T2.year DESC LIMIT 1

network_2.question: What are the names, ages, and jobs of all people who are friends with Alice for the longest amount of time?
network_2.query: SELECT p.name, p.age, p.job FROM Person AS p JOIN PersonFriend AS pf ON p.name = pf.friend WHERE pf.name = 'Alice' AND pf.year = (SELECT MAX(year) FROM PersonFriend WHERE name = 'Alice')

network_2.question: Who is the person that has no friend?
network_2.query: SELECT name FROM Person WHERE name NOT IN (SELECT name FROM PersonFriend)

network_2.question: What are the names of all people who do not have friends?
network_2.query: SELECT name FROM Person WHERE name NOT IN (SELECT name FROM PersonFriend UNION SELECT friend FROM PersonFriend)

network_2.question: Which person whose friends have the oldest average age?
network_2.query: SELECT name FROM PersonFriend AS t1 JOIN (SELECT friend, AVG(age) AS avg_age FROM Person JOIN PersonFriend ON name = friend GROUP BY friend) AS t2 ON t1.friend = t2.friend GROUP BY name ORDER BY avg_age DESC LIMIT 1

network_2.question: What is the name of the person who has the oldest average age for their friends, and what is that average age?
network_2.query: SELECT T1.name, AVG(T2.age) AS avg_age FROM Person AS T1 JOIN PersonFriend AS T2 ON T1.name = T2.name GROUP BY T1.name ORDER BY avg_age DESC LIMIT 1

network_2.question: What is the total number of people who has no friend living in the city of Austin.
network_2.query: SELECT count(*) FROM person WHERE city = 'Austin' AND name NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT name FROM personfriend WHERE friend IN (SELECT name FROM person WHERE city = 'Austin'))

network_2.question: What is the total number of people who have no friends living in Austin?
network_2.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Person WHERE name NOT IN (SELECT name FROM PersonFriend WHERE friend IN (SELECT name FROM Person WHERE city = 'Austin')) AND city = 'Austin'

network_2.question: Find Alice's friends of friends.
network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT pf2.friend FROM PersonFriend AS pf1 JOIN PersonFriend AS pf2 ON pf1.friend = pf2.name WHERE pf1.name = 'Alice' AND pf2.friend NOT IN (SELECT friend FROM PersonFriend WHERE name = 'Alice')

network_2.question: What are the names of all of Alice's friends of friends?
network_2.query: SELECT DISTINCT pf2.friend FROM PersonFriend AS pf1 JOIN PersonFriend AS pf2 ON pf1.friend = pf2.name WHERE pf1.name = 'Alice' AND pf2.friend NOT IN (SELECT friend FROM PersonFriend WHERE name = 'Alice') AND pf2.name != 'Alice'

decoration_competition.question: List the names of members in ascending alphabetical order.
decoration_competition.query: SELECT Name FROM member ORDER BY Name ASC

decoration_competition.question: What are the names and countries of members?

decoration_competition.query: SELECT Name FROM member WHERE Country IN ('United States', 'Canada')

decoration_competition.question: Show the different countries and the number of members from each.
decoration_competition.query: SELECT country, count(*) FROM member GROUP BY country

decoration_competition.question: Show the most common country across members.
decoration_competition.query: SELECT country FROM member GROUP BY country ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

decoration_competition.question: Which countries have more than two members?
decoration_competition.query: SELECT country FROM member GROUP BY country HAVING count(*) > 2

decoration_competition.question: Show the leader names and locations of colleges.
Show the names of members and names of colleges they go to.
decoration_competition.query: SELECT t2.Name, t1.Name FROM college AS t1 JOIN member AS t2 ON t1.College_ID = t2.College_ID

decoration_competition.question: Show the names of members and the locations of colleges they go to in ascending alphabetical order of member names.
decoration_competition.query: SELECT t2.name, t1.college_location FROM college AS t1 JOIN member AS t2 ON t1.college_id = t2.college_id ORDER BY t2.name ASC

decoration_competition.question: Show the distinct leader names of colleges associated with members from country "Canada".
decoration_competition.query: SELECT DISTINCT c.Leader_Name FROM college AS c JOIN member AS m ON c.College_ID = m.College_ID WHERE m.Country = 'Canada'

decoration_competition.question: Show the names of members and the decoration themes they have.
decoration_competition.query: SELECT t2.Name, t3.Decoration_Theme FROM member AS t2 JOIN round AS t3 ON t2.Member_ID = t3.Member_ID

decoration_competition.question: Show the names of members that have a rank in round higher than 3.
decoration_competition.query: SELECT t2.name FROM round AS t1 JOIN member AS t2 ON t1.member_id  =  t2.member_id WHERE t1.rank_in_round > 3

decoration_competition.question: Show the names of members in ascending order of their rank in rounds.
decoration_competition.query: SELECT t2.name FROM round AS t1 JOIN member AS t2 ON t1.member_id  =  t2.member_id ORDER BY t1.rank_in_round ASC

decoration_competition.question: List the names of members who did not participate in any round.
decoration_competition.query: SELECT t2.name FROM member AS t2 LEFT JOIN round AS t1 ON t2.member_id = t1.member_id WHERE t1.member_id IS NULL

document_management.question: Find the name and access counts of all documents, in alphabetic order of the document name.

document_management.question: What are the names of all the documents, as well as the access counts of each, ordered alphabetically?

document_management.question: Find the name of the document that has been accessed the greatest number of times, as well as the count of how many times it has been accessed?
document_management.query: SELECT document_name, access_count FROM Documents ORDER BY access_count DESC LIMIT 1;

document_management.question: What is the name of the document which has been accessed the most times, as well as the number of times it has been accessed?
document_management.query: SELECT document_name, access_count FROM Documents ORDER BY access_count DESC LIMIT 1;

document_management.question: Find the types of documents with more than 4 documents.
document_management.query: SELECT document_type_code FROM Documents GROUP BY document_type_code HAVING COUNT(*) > 4;

document_management.question: What are the codes of types of documents of which there are for or more?
document_management.query: SELECT document_type_code FROM Documents GROUP BY document_type_code HAVING COUNT(*) >= 4;

document_management.question: Find the total access count of all documents in the most popular document type.
document_management.query: SELECT SUM(access_count) FROM Documents WHERE document_type_code = (SELECT document_type_code FROM Documents GROUP BY document_type_code ORDER BY SUM(access_count) DESC LIMIT 1);

document_management.question: What is the total access count of documents that are of the most common document type?
document_management.query: SELECT SUM(access_count) FROM Documents WHERE document_type_code = (SELECT document_type_code FROM Documents GROUP BY document_type_code ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1);

document_management.question: What is the average access count of documents?
document_management.query: SELECT AVG(access_count) FROM Documents

document_management.query: SELECT AVG(access_count) FROM Documents;

document_management.question: What is the structure of the document with the least number of accesses?
document_management.query: SELECT Document_Structures.document_structure_description FROM Documents JOIN Document_Structures ON Documents.document_structure_code = Document_Structures.document_structure_code ORDER BY access_count ASC LIMIT 1;

document_management.question: Return the structure description of the document that has been accessed the fewest number of times.
document_management.query: SELECT Document_Structures.document_structure_description FROM Documents JOIN Document_Structures ON Documents.document_structure_code = Document_Structures.document_structure_code ORDER BY Documents.access_count ASC LIMIT 1;

document_management.question: What is the type of the document named "David CV"?

document_management.question: Return the type code of the document named "David CV".

document_management.question: Find the list of documents that are both in the most three popular type and have the most three popular structure.
document_management.query:
SELECT Documents.document_code 
FROM Documents 
WHERE document_type_code IN (
    SELECT document_type_code 
    FROM Documents 
    GROUP BY document_type_code 
    ORDER BY access_count DESC 
    LIMIT 3
) 
AND document_structure_code IN (
    SELECT document_structure_code 
    FROM Documents 
    GROUP BY document_structure_code 
    ORDER BY access_count DESC 
    LIMIT 3
) 
GROUP BY Documents.document_code 
HAVING COUNT(*) = 2;

document_management.question: What are the names of documents that have both one of the three most common types and one of three most common structures?
document_management.query: SELECT document_name FROM Documents WHERE document_type_code IN (SELECT document_type_code FROM Documents GROUP BY document_type_code ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 3) AND document_structure_code IN (SELECT document_structure_code FROM Documents GROUP BY document_structure_code ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 3);

document_management.question: What document types do have more than 10000 total access number.
