ship_1.query: SELECT Name, Flag FROM Ship WHERE Ship_ID NOT IN (SELECT Ship_ID FROM captain WHERE Rank = "Midshipman")

ship_1.question: What are the names and flags of ships that do not have a captain with the rank of Midshipman?
ship_1.query: SELECT Name, Flag FROM Ship WHERE Ship_ID NOT IN (SELECT Ship_ID FROM captain WHERE Rank = "Midshipman")

ship_1.question: Find the name of the ships that are steered by both a captain with Midshipman rank and a captain with Lieutenant rank.
ship_1.query: SELECT Name FROM Ship WHERE Ship_ID IN (SELECT Ship_ID FROM captain WHERE Rank = "Midshipman") AND Ship_ID IN (SELECT Ship_ID FROM captain WHERE Rank = "Lieutenant")

ship_1.question: What are the names of ships that are commanded by both captains with the rank of Midshipman and captains with the rank of Lieutenant?
ship_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT s.Name FROM captain c1 JOIN captain c2 ON c1.Ship_ID = c2.Ship_ID JOIN ship s ON c1.Ship_ID = s.Ship_ID WHERE c1.Rank = 'Midshipman' AND c2.Rank = 'Lieutenant'

city_record.question: What is id of the city that hosted events in the most recent year?
city_record.query: SELECT Host_City FROM hosting_city WHERE Year = (SELECT MAX(Year) FROM hosting_city)

city_record.question: Find the city that hosted some events in the most recent year. What is the id of this city?
city_record.query: SELECT Host_City FROM hosting_city WHERE Year = (SELECT MAX(Year) FROM hosting_city) LIMIT 1

city_record.question: Find the match ids of the cities that hosted competition "1994 FIFA World Cup qualification"?
city_record.query: SELECT T1.Match_ID FROM match AS T1 JOIN hosting_city AS T2 ON T1.Match_ID = T2.Match_ID WHERE T1.Competition = "1994 FIFA World Cup qualification"

city_record.question: What is the match id of the competition called "1994 FIFA World Cup qualification"?
city_record.query: SELECT Match_ID FROM match WHERE Competition = "1994 FIFA World Cup qualification"

city_record.question: Find the cities which were once a host city after 2010?
city_record.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.City FROM city AS T1 JOIN hosting_city AS T2 ON T1.City_ID = T2.Host_City WHERE T2.Year > 2010

city_record.question: Which cities served as a host city after 2010?
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city JOIN hosting_city ON city.City_ID = hosting_city.Host_City WHERE hosting_city.Year > 2010

city_record.question: Which city has hosted the most events?
city_record.query: SELECT T1.City FROM city AS T1 JOIN hosting_city AS T2 ON T1.City_ID  =  T2.Host_City GROUP BY T2.Host_City ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

city_record.question: Find the city that hosted the most events.
city_record.query: SELECT T1.City FROM city AS T1 JOIN hosting_city AS T2 ON T1.City_ID = T2.Host_City GROUP BY T2.Host_City ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

city_record.question: What is the venue of the competition "1994 FIFA World Cup qualification" hosted by "Nanjing ( Jiangsu )"?
city_record.query: SELECT Venue FROM match AS T1 JOIN hosting_city AS T2 ON T1.Match_ID = T2.Match_ID JOIN city AS T3 ON T2.Host_City = T3.City_ID WHERE T1.Competition = '1994 FIFA World Cup qualification' AND T3.City = 'Nanjing' AND T3.Hanzi = '江苏'

city_record.question: Find the venue of the competition "1994 FIFA World Cup qualification" which was hosted by "Nanjing ( Jiangsu )".
city_record.query: SELECT T1.Venue FROM match AS T1 JOIN hosting_city AS T2 ON T1.Match_ID = T2.Match_ID JOIN city AS T3 ON T2.Host_City = T3.City_ID WHERE T1.Competition = '1994 FIFA World Cup qualification' AND T3.City = 'Nanjing' AND T3.Hanzi = '江苏'

city_record.question: Give me the temperature of Shanghai in January.
city_record.query: SELECT Jan FROM temperature WHERE City_ID = (SELECT City_ID FROM city WHERE City = 'Shanghai')

city_record.question: What is the temperature of "Shanghai" city in January?
city_record.query: SELECT Jan FROM temperature WHERE City_ID = (SELECT City_ID FROM city WHERE City = 'Shanghai')

city_record.question: What is the host year of city "Taizhou ( Zhejiang )"?
city_record.query: SELECT T1.Year FROM hosting_city AS T1 JOIN city AS T2 ON T1.Host_City = T2.City_ID WHERE T2.City = 'Taizhou ( Zhejiang )'

city_record.question: IN which year did city "Taizhou ( Zhejiang )" serve as a host city?
city_record.query: SELECT Year FROM hosting_city AS T1 JOIN city AS T2 ON T1.Host_City  =  T2.City_ID WHERE T2.City  =  'Taizhou ( Zhejiang )'

city_record.question: Which three cities have the largest regional population?
city_record.query: SELECT City, Regional_Population FROM city ORDER BY Regional_Population DESC LIMIT 3

city_record.question: What are the three largest cities in terms of regional population?
city_record.query: SELECT City, Regional_Population FROM city ORDER BY Regional_Population DESC LIMIT 3

city_record.question: Which city has the lowest GDP? Please list the city name and its GDP.
city_record.query: SELECT City, GDP FROM city ORDER BY GDP ASC LIMIT 1

city_record.question: What is the city with the smallest GDP? Return the city and its GDP.
city_record.query: SELECT City, GDP FROM city ORDER BY GDP ASC LIMIT 1

city_record.question: Which city has the highest temperature in February?
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city JOIN temperature ON city.City_ID = temperature.City_ID ORDER BY Feb DESC LIMIT 1

city_record.question: In February, which city marks the highest temperature?
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city JOIN temperature ON city.City_ID = temperature.City_ID ORDER BY Feb DESC LIMIT 1

city_record.question: Give me a list of cities whose temperature in March is lower than that in July or higher than that in Oct?
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city JOIN temperature ON city.City_ID = temperature.City_ID WHERE temperature.Mar < temperature.Jul OR temperature.Mar > temperature.Oct

city_record.question: Which cities' temperature in March is lower than that in July or higher than that in Oct?
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM temperature WHERE Mar < Jul OR Mar > Oct

city_record.question: Give me a list of cities whose temperature in Mar is lower than that in July and which have also served as host cities?
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city JOIN temperature ON city.City_ID = temperature.City_ID JOIN hosting_city ON city.City_ID = hosting_city.Host_City WHERE temperature.Mar < temperature.Jul

city_record.question: Which cities have lower temperature in March than in July and have been once host cities?
city_record.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.City FROM city AS T1 JOIN temperature AS T2 ON T1.City_ID = T2.City_ID JOIN hosting_city AS T3 ON T1.City_ID = T3.Host_City WHERE T2.Mar < T2.Jul AND T3.Year IN (SELECT DISTINCT Year FROM hosting_city)

city_record.question: Give me a list of cities whose temperature in Mar is lower than that in Dec and which have never been host cities.
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city WHERE City_ID NOT IN (SELECT Host_City FROM hosting_city) AND Mar < Dec

city_record.question: Which cities have lower temperature in March than in Dec and have never served as host cities?
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city WHERE City_ID NOT IN (SELECT Host_City FROM hosting_city) AND Mar < Dec

city_record.question: Give me a list of cities whose temperature in Feb is higher than that in Jun or cities that were once host cities?
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city WHERE City_ID IN (SELECT City_ID FROM temperature WHERE Feb > Jun) OR City_ID IN (SELECT Host_City FROM hosting_city JOIN match ON hosting_city.Match_ID = match.Match_ID)

city_record.question: Which cities have higher temperature in Feb than in Jun or have once served as host cities?
city_record.query: SELECT DISTINCT City FROM city JOIN temperature ON city.City_ID = temperature.City_ID JOIN hosting_city ON city.City_ID = hosting_city.Host_City WHERE Feb > Jun OR Year IS NOT NULL

city_record.question: Please give me a list of cities whose regional population is over 10000000.
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city WHERE Regional_Population > 10000000

city_record.question: Which cities have regional population above 10000000?
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city WHERE Regional_Population > 10000000

city_record.question: Please give me a list of cities whose regional population is over 8000000 or under 5000000.
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city WHERE Regional_Population > 8000000 OR Regional_Population < 5000000

city_record.question: Which cities have regional population above 8000000 or below 5000000?
city_record.query: SELECT City FROM city WHERE Regional_Population > 8000000 OR Regional_Population < 5000000

city_record.question: Find the number of matches in different competitions.
city_record.query: SELECT Competition, COUNT(*) FROM match GROUP BY Competition

city_record.question: For each competition, count the number of matches.
city_record.query: SELECT Competition, COUNT(*) FROM match GROUP BY Competition

city_record.question: List venues of all matches in the order of their dates starting from the most recent one.
city_record.query: SELECT Venue FROM match ORDER BY Date DESC

city_record.question: What are the venues of all the matches? Sort them in the descending order of match date.
city_record.query: SELECT Venue FROM match ORDER BY Date DESC

city_record.question: what is the GDP of the city with the largest population.
city_record.query: SELECT GDP FROM city ORDER BY Regional_Population DESC LIMIT 1

city_record.question: Find the GDP of the city with the largest regional population.
city_record.query: SELECT GDP FROM city ORDER BY Regional_Population DESC LIMIT 1

city_record.question: What are the GDP and population of the city that already served as a host more than once?
city_record.query: SELECT T1.GDP, T1.Regional_Population FROM city AS T1 JOIN hosting_city AS T2 ON T1.City_ID = T2.Host_City GROUP BY T2.Host_City HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

city_record.question: Which cities have served as host cities more than once? Return me their GDP and population.
city_record.query: SELECT city.GDP, city.Regional_Population FROM city JOIN hosting_city ON city.City_ID = hosting_city.Host_City GROUP BY hosting_city.Host_City HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

e_government.question: List every individual's first name, middle name and last name in alphabetical order by last name.
e_government.query: SELECT individual_first_name, individual_middle_name, individual_last_name FROM Individuals ORDER BY individual_last_name ASC

e_government.question: What are the first, middle, and last names of all individuals, ordered by last name?
e_government.query: SELECT individual_first_name, individual_middle_name, individual_last_name FROM Individuals ORDER BY individual_last_name;

e_government.question: List all the types of forms.
e_government.query: SELECT DISTINCT form_type_code FROM Forms

e_government.question: What are the different types of forms?
e_government.query: SELECT DISTINCT form_type_code FROM Forms

e_government.question: Find the name of the most popular party form.
e_government.query: SELECT T1.form_name FROM forms AS T1 JOIN party_forms AS T2 ON T1.form_id = T2.form_id GROUP BY T1.form_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

e_government.question: What is the name of the party form that is most common?
e_government.query: SELECT form_name FROM forms JOIN party_forms ON forms.form_id = party_forms.form_id GROUP BY forms.form_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

e_government.question: Find the payment method and phone of the party with email "enrico09@example.com".
e_government.query: SELECT payment_method_code, party_phone FROM Parties WHERE party_email = "enrico09@example.com";

e_government.question: What is the payment method code and party phone of the party with the email 'enrico09@example.com'?
e_government.query: SELECT payment_method_code, party_phone FROM Parties WHERE party_email = 'enrico09@example.com'

e_government.question: Find the emails of parties with the most popular party form.
e_government.query: SELECT T1.party_email FROM parties AS T1 JOIN party_forms AS T2 ON T1.party_id = T2.party_id JOIN forms AS T3 ON T2.form_id = T3.form_id GROUP BY T1.party_id HAVING T2.form_id = (SELECT form_id FROM party_forms GROUP BY form_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1)

e_government.question: What are the party emails associated with parties that used the party form that is the most common?
e_government.query: SELECT party_email FROM Parties WHERE party_id IN (SELECT party_id FROM Party_Forms WHERE form_id = (SELECT form_id FROM Forms GROUP BY form_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1))

e_government.question: List all the name of organizations in order of the date formed.
e_government.query: SELECT organization_name FROM Organizations ORDER BY date_formed ASC

e_government.question: What are the names of organizations, ordered by the date they were formed, ascending?
e_government.query: SELECT organization_name FROM organizations ORDER BY date_formed ASC

e_government.question: Find the name of the youngest organization.
e_government.query: SELECT organization_name FROM Organizations ORDER BY date_formed DESC LIMIT 1;

e_government.question: What is the name of the organization that was formed most recently?
e_government.query: SELECT organization_name FROM Organizations ORDER BY date_formed DESC LIMIT 1;

e_government.question: Find the last name of the latest contact individual of the organization "Labour Party".
e_government.query: SELECT T1.individual_last_name FROM Individuals AS T1 JOIN Organization_Contact_Individuals AS T2 ON T1.individual_id = T2.individual_id JOIN Organizations AS T3 ON T2.organization_id = T3.organization_id WHERE T3.organization_name = "Labour Party" ORDER BY T2.date_contact_from DESC LIMIT 1;

e_government.question: What is the last name of the contact individual from the Labour party organization who was contacted most recently?
e_government.query: SELECT T1.individual_last_name FROM individuals AS T1 JOIN organization_contact_individuals AS T2 ON T1.individual_id = T2.individual_id JOIN organizations AS T3 ON T2.organization_id = T3.organization_id WHERE T3.organization_name = "Labour party" ORDER BY T2.date_contact_to DESC LIMIT 1

e_government.question: Find the last name of the first ever contact person of the organization with the highest UK Vat number.
e_government.query: SELECT T3.individual_last_name FROM Organizations AS T1 JOIN Organization_Contact_Individuals AS T2 ON T1.organization_id = T2.organization_id JOIN Individuals AS T3 ON T2.individual_id = T3.individual_id WHERE T1.uk_vat_number = (SELECT MAX(uk_vat_number) FROM Organizations) ORDER BY T2.date_contact_from ASC LIMIT 1

e_government.question: What is the last name of the first individual contacted from the organization with the maximum UK Vat number across all organizations?
e_government.query: SELECT individual_last_name FROM individuals WHERE individual_id = (SELECT individual_id FROM organization_contact_individuals WHERE organization_id = (SELECT organization_id FROM organizations WHERE uk_vat_number = (SELECT MAX(uk_vat_number) FROM organizations)));

e_government.question: How many services are there?
e_government.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Services;

e_government.question: Count the number of services.
e_government.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Services;

e_government.question: Find name of the services that has never been used.
e_government.query: SELECT service_name FROM services WHERE service_id NOT IN (SELECT service_id FROM party_services)

e_government.question: What are the names of the services that have never been used?
e_government.query: SELECT service_name FROM Services WHERE service_id NOT IN (SELECT service_id FROM Party_Services);

e_government.question: Find the name of all the cities and states.
e_government.query: SELECT town_city, state_province_county FROM Addresses;

e_government.question: What are the names of all cities and states?
e_government.query: SELECT town_city, state_province_county FROM Addresses;

e_government.question: How many cities are there in state "Colorado"?
e_government.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT town_city) FROM Addresses WHERE state_province_county = "Colorado";

e_government.question: Count the number of cities in the state of Colorado.
e_government.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT town_city) FROM Addresses WHERE state_province_county = 'Colorado';

e_government.question: Find the payment method code used by more than 3 parties.
e_government.query: SELECT payment_method_code, COUNT(*) FROM Parties GROUP BY payment_method_code HAVING COUNT(*) > 3;

e_government.question: What are the payment method codes that have been used by more than 3 parties?
e_government.query: SELECT payment_method_code FROM Parties GROUP BY payment_method_code HAVING count(DISTINCT party_id) > 3;

e_government.question: Find the name of organizations whose names contain "Party".
e_government.query: SELECT organization_name FROM Organizations WHERE organization_name LIKE "%Party%";

e_government.question: What are the names of organizations that contain the word "Party"?
e_government.query: SELECT organization_name FROM Organizations WHERE organization_name LIKE '%Party%'

e_government.question: How many distinct payment methods are used by parties?
e_government.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT payment_method_code) FROM Parties;

e_government.question: Count the number of different payment method codes used by parties.
e_government.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT payment_method_code) FROM Parties;

e_government.question: Which is the email of the party that has used the services the most number of times?
e_government.query: SELECT T1.party_email FROM parties AS T1 JOIN party_services AS T2 ON T1.party_id = T2.customer_id GROUP BY T1.party_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

e_government.question: Return the party email that has used party services the greatest number of times.
e_government.query: SELECT T1.party_email FROM parties AS T1 JOIN party_services AS T2 ON T1.party_id = T2.customer_id GROUP BY T1.party_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

e_government.question: Which state can address "6862 Kaitlyn Knolls" possibly be in?
e_government.query: SELECT state_province_county FROM Addresses WHERE line_1_number_building = "6862 Kaitlyn Knolls";

e_government.question: Give the state corresponding to the line number building "6862 Kaitlyn Knolls".
e_government.query: SELECT state_province_county FROM Addresses WHERE line_1_number_building = "6862 Kaitlyn Knolls";

e_government.question: What is the name of organization that has the greatest number of contact individuals?
e_government.query: SELECT T2.organization_name FROM Organization_Contact_Individuals AS T1 JOIN Organizations AS T2 ON T1.organization_id = T2.organization_id GROUP BY T2.organization_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

e_government.question: Return the name of the organization which has the most contact individuals.
e_government.query: SELECT T1.organization_name FROM organizations AS T1 JOIN organization_contact_individuals AS T2 ON T1.organization_id = T2.organization_id GROUP BY T1.organization_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

e_government.question: Find the last name of the individuals that have been contact individuals of an organization.
e_government.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.individual_last_name FROM Organization_Contact_Individuals AS T1 JOIN Individuals AS T2 ON T1.individual_id = T2.individual_id

e_government.question: What are the last names of individuals who have been contact individuals for an organization?
e_government.query: SELECT individual_last_name FROM individuals WHERE individual_id IN (SELECT individual_id FROM organization_contact_individuals)

school_bus.question: Show the name, home city, and age for all drivers.
school_bus.query: SELECT Name, Home_city, Age FROM driver

school_bus.question: Show the party and the number of drivers in each party.
school_bus.query: SELECT Party, COUNT(*) FROM driver GROUP BY Party

school_bus.question: Show the name of drivers in descending order of age.
school_bus.query: SELECT Name FROM driver ORDER BY Age DESC

school_bus.question: Show the home city with the most number of drivers.
school_bus.query: SELECT home_city, COUNT(*) AS num_drivers FROM driver GROUP BY home_city ORDER BY num_drivers DESC LIMIT 1

school_bus.question: Show the party with drivers from Hartford and drivers older than 40.
school_bus.query: SELECT DISTINCT d.party FROM driver AS d JOIN school_bus AS sb ON d.driver_id = sb.driver_id WHERE d.home_city = "Hartford" AND d.age > 40

school_bus.question: Show home city where at least two drivers older than 40 are from.
school_bus.query: SELECT home_city FROM driver WHERE age > 40 GROUP BY home_city HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2

school_bus.question: Show all home cities except for those having a driver older than 40.
school_bus.query: SELECT DISTINCT home_city FROM driver WHERE Age <= 40

school_bus.question: Show the names of the drivers without a school bus.
school_bus.query: SELECT Name FROM driver WHERE Driver_ID NOT IN (SELECT Driver_ID FROM school_bus)

school_bus.question: Show the types of schools that have two schools.
school_bus.query: SELECT type FROM school GROUP BY type HAVING COUNT(*) = 2

school_bus.question: Show the school name and driver name for all school buses.
school_bus.query: SELECT T2.School, T1.Name FROM driver AS T1 JOIN school_bus AS T3 ON T1.Driver_ID = T3.Driver_ID JOIN school AS T2 ON T3.School_ID = T2.School_ID

school_bus.question: What is the maximum, minimum and average years spent working on a school bus?
school_bus.query: SELECT max(years_working), min(years_working), avg(years_working) FROM school_bus

school_bus.question: Show the school name and type for schools without a school bus.
school_bus.query: SELECT school.school, school.type FROM school LEFT JOIN school_bus ON school.school_id = school_bus.school_id WHERE school_bus.school_id IS NULL

school_bus.question: Show the type of school and the number of buses for each type.
school_bus.query: SELECT T2.Type, COUNT(*) FROM school_bus AS T1 JOIN school AS T2 ON T1.School_ID = T2.School_ID GROUP BY T2.Type

school_bus.question: How many drivers are from Hartford city or younger than 40?
school_bus.query: SELECT count(*) FROM driver WHERE Home_city = "Hartford" OR Age < 40

school_bus.question: List names for drivers from Hartford city and younger than 40.
school_bus.query: SELECT Name FROM driver WHERE Home_city = "Hartford" AND Age < 40

school_bus.question: find the name of driver who is driving the school bus with the longest working history.
school_bus.query: SELECT driver.Name FROM driver JOIN school_bus ON driver.Driver_ID = school_bus.Driver_ID ORDER BY school_bus.Years_Working DESC LIMIT 1

flight_company.question: How many flights have a velocity larger than 200?
flight_company.query: SELECT count(*) FROM flight WHERE velocity > 200

flight_company.question: List the vehicle flight number, date and pilot of all the flights, ordered by altitude.
flight_company.query: SELECT Vehicle_Flight_number, Date, Pilot FROM flight ORDER BY Altitude DESC

flight_company.question: List the id, country, city and name of the airports ordered alphabetically by the name.
flight_company.query: SELECT id, country, city, name FROM airport ORDER BY name ASC

flight_company.question: What is maximum group equity shareholding of the companies?
What is the velocity of the pilot named 'Thompson'?
flight_company.query: SELECT velocity FROM flight WHERE Pilot = 'Thompson'

flight_company.question: What are the names and types of the companies that have ever operated a flight?
flight_company.query: SELECT DISTINCT name, Type FROM operate_company AS T1 JOIN flight AS T2 ON T1.id = T2.company_id

flight_company.question: What are the names of the airports which are not in the country 'Iceland'?
flight_company.query: SELECT name FROM airport WHERE Country <> 'Iceland'

flight_company.question: What are the distinct types of the companies that have operated any flights with velocity less than 200?
flight_company.query: SELECT DISTINCT Type FROM operate_company WHERE id IN (SELECT company_id FROM flight WHERE Velocity < 200)

flight_company.question: What are the ids and names of the companies that operated more than one flight?
flight_company.query: SELECT T1.id, T1.name FROM operate_company AS T1 JOIN flight AS T2 ON T1.id = T2.company_id GROUP BY T2.company_id HAVING count(*) > 1

flight_company.question: What is the id, name and IATA code of the airport that had most number of flights?
flight_company.query: SELECT id, name, IATA FROM airport WHERE id IN (SELECT airport_id FROM flight GROUP BY airport_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1)

flight_company.question: What are the different pilot names who had piloted a flight in the country 'United States' or in the airport named 'Billund Airport'?
flight_company.query: SELECT DISTINCT pilot FROM flight WHERE airport_id IN (SELECT id FROM airport WHERE Country = 'United States' OR name = 'Billund Airport')

flight_company.question: What is the most common company type, and how many are there?
flight_company.query: SELECT Type, count(*) FROM operate_company GROUP BY Type ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

flight_company.question: How many airports haven't the pilot 'Thompson' driven an aircraft?
flight_company.query: SELECT count(*) FROM airport WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT airport_id FROM flight WHERE Pilot = 'Thompson')

flight_company.question: List the name of the pilots who have flied for both a company that mainly provide 'Cargo' services and a company that runs 'Catering services' activities.
flight_company.query: SELECT T1.Pilot FROM flight AS T1 JOIN operate_company AS T2 ON T1.company_id = T2.id WHERE T2.Principal_activities = 'Cargo' INTERSECT SELECT T1.Pilot FROM flight AS T1 JOIN operate_company AS T2 ON T1.company_id = T2.id WHERE T2.Principal_activities = 'Catering services'

flight_company.question: Which of the airport names contains the word 'international'?
flight_company.query: SELECT name FROM airport WHERE name LIKE '%International%'

flight_company.question: How many companies operates airlines in each airport?
flight_company.query: SELECT airport.name, COUNT(DISTINCT operate_company.id) FROM airport JOIN flight ON airport.id = flight.airport_id JOIN operate_company ON flight.company_id = operate_company.id GROUP BY airport.name

flight_company.question: how many airports are there in each country?
flight_company.query: SELECT country, count(*) FROM airport GROUP BY country

flight_company.question: which countries have more than 2 airports?
flight_company.query: SELECT Country FROM airport GROUP BY Country HAVING count(*) > 2

flight_company.question: which pilot is in charge of the most number of flights?
flight_company.query: SELECT T1.Pilot FROM flight AS T1 GROUP BY T1.Pilot ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: How many accounts do we have?
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Accounts;

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: Count the number of accounts.
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Accounts

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: Show all account ids and account details.
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT Account_ID, Account_Details FROM Accounts;

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: What are the ids and details of all accounts?
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT Account_ID, Account_Details FROM Accounts;

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: How many statements do we have?
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Statements

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: Count the number of statements.
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Statements

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: List all statement ids and statement details.
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT statement_id, statement_details FROM Statements;

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: What are the ids and details of all statements?
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT Statement_ID, Statement_Details FROM Statements

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: Show statement id, statement detail, account detail for accounts.
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT T1.Statement_ID, T1.Statement_Details, T2.Account_Details FROM Statements AS T1 JOIN Accounts AS T2 ON T1.Statement_ID = T2.Statement_ID;

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: What are the statement ids, statement details, and account details, for all accounts?
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT T1.statement_id, T1.statement_details, T2.account_details FROM Statements AS T1 JOIN Accounts AS T2 ON T1.statement_id = T2.statement_id;

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: Show all statement id and the number of accounts for each statement.
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT T1.Statement_ID, COUNT(T2.Account_ID) FROM Statements AS T1 JOIN Accounts AS T2 ON T1.Statement_ID = T2.Statement_ID GROUP BY T1.Statement_ID;

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: What are the different statement ids on accounts, and the number of accounts for each?
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT T1.Statement_ID, COUNT(*) FROM Accounts AS T1 JOIN Statements AS T2 ON T1.Statement_ID = T2.Statement_ID GROUP BY T1.Statement_ID;

cre_Docs_and_Epenses.question: Show the statement id and the statement detail for the statement with most number of accounts.
cre_Docs_and_Epenses.query: SELECT Statements.statement_id, Statements.statement_details FROM Statements JOIN Accounts ON Statements.statement_id = Accounts.statement_id GROUP BY Statements.statement_id ORDER BY COUNT(Accounts.account_id) DESC LIMIT 1;

scientist_1.query: SELECT SUM(hours) FROM Projects

scientist_1.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT scientist) FROM AssignedTo

scientist_1.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT code) FROM projects

scientist_1.question: How many different projects are there?

scientist_1.question: Find the average hours of all projects.
scientist_1.query: SELECT avg(hours) FROM Projects

scientist_1.question: What is the average hours across all projects?
scientist_1.query: SELECT avg(hours) FROM Projects

scientist_1.question: Find the name of project that continues for the longest time.
scientist_1.query: SELECT name FROM Projects ORDER BY hours DESC LIMIT 1

scientist_1.question: What is the name of the project with the most hours?
scientist_1.query: SELECT name FROM Projects WHERE Hours = (SELECT MAX(Hours) FROM Projects)

scientist_1.question: List the name of all projects that are operated longer than the average working hours of all projects.
scientist_1.query: SELECT name FROM projects WHERE hours > (SELECT AVG(hours) FROM projects)

scientist_1.question: What are the names of projects that have taken longer than the average number of hours for all projects?
scientist_1.query: SELECT name FROM projects WHERE hours > (SELECT AVG(hours) FROM projects)

scientist_1.question: Find the name and hours of project that has the most number of scientists.
scientist_1.query: SELECT p.name, p.hours FROM projects p JOIN assignedto a ON p.code = a.project GROUP BY p.code ORDER BY COUNT(a.scientist) DESC LIMIT 1

scientist_1.question: What is the name and hours for the project which has the most scientists assigned to it?
scientist_1.query: SELECT t1.name, t1.hours FROM projects AS t1 JOIN assignedto AS t2 ON t1.code = t2.project GROUP BY t1.code ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

scientist_1.question: Find the name of the project for which a scientist whose name contains ‘Smith’ is assigned to.
scientist_1.query: SELECT t2.Name FROM Scientists AS t1 JOIN AssignedTo AS t3 ON t1.SSN = t3.Scientist JOIN Projects AS t2 ON t3.Project = t2.Code WHERE t1.Name LIKE '%Smith%'

scientist_1.question: What is the name of the project that has a scientist assigned to it whose name contains 'Smith'?
scientist_1.query: SELECT t2.name FROM scientists AS t1 JOIN assignedto AS t3 ON t1.ssn  =  t3.scientist JOIN projects AS t2 ON t3.project  =  t2.code WHERE t1.name LIKE '%Smith%'

scientist_1.question: Find the total hours of the projects that scientists named Michael Rogers or Carol Smith are assigned to.
scientist_1.query: SELECT SUM(p.hours) FROM Projects AS p JOIN AssignedTo AS a ON p.code = a.project JOIN Scientists AS s ON a.scientist = s.ssn WHERE s.name = 'Michael Rogers' OR s.name = 'Carol Smith'

scientist_1.question: What is the sum of hours for projects that scientists with the name Michael Rogers or Carol Smith are assigned to?
scientist_1.query: SELECT SUM(p.hours) FROM Projects AS p JOIN AssignedTo AS a ON p.code = a.project JOIN Scientists AS s ON a.scientist = s.ssn WHERE s.name = "Michael Rogers" OR s.name = "Carol Smith"

scientist_1.question: Find the name of projects that require between 100 and 300 hours of work.
scientist_1.query: SELECT name FROM Projects WHERE Hours BETWEEN 100 AND 300

scientist_1.question: What are the names of projects that require between 100 and 300 hours?
scientist_1.query: SELECT Name FROM Projects WHERE Hours BETWEEN 100 AND 300

scientist_1.question: Find the name of the scientist who worked on both a project named 'Matter of Time' and a project named 'A Puzzling Parallax'.
scientist_1.query: SELECT s.name FROM Scientists AS s JOIN AssignedTo AS a ON s.ssn = a.scientist JOIN Projects AS p ON a.project = p.code WHERE p.name = 'Matter of Time' AND s.ssn IN (SELECT scientist FROM AssignedTo WHERE project = (SELECT code FROM Projects WHERE name = 'A Puzzling Parallax'))

scientist_1.question: What are the names of any scientists who worked on projects named 'Matter of Time' and 'A Puzzling Pattern'?
scientist_1.query: SELECT t1.name FROM scientists AS t1 JOIN assignedto AS t2 ON t1.ssn  =  t2.scientist JOIN projects AS t3 ON t2.project  =  t3.code WHERE t3.name  =  "Matter of Time" AND t2.scientist IN (SELECT scientist FROM assignedto WHERE project IN (SELECT code FROM projects WHERE name  =  "A Puzzling Pattern"))

scientist_1.question: List the names of all scientists sorted in alphabetical order.

scientist_1.question: What are the names of all the scientists in alphabetical order?

scientist_1.question: Find the number of scientists involved for each project name.

scientist_1.question: What are the naems of all the projects, and how many scientists were assigned to each of them?

scientist_1.question: Find the number of scientists involved for the projects that require more than 300 hours.

scientist_1.question: Find the number of projects which each scientist is working on and scientist's name.

scientist_1.query: SELECT Name FROM Scientists WHERE SSN NOT IN (SELECT Scientist FROM AssignedTo WHERE Project = (SELECT Code FROM Projects ORDER BY Hours DESC LIMIT 1))

scientist_1.question: List all the scientists' names, their projects' names, and the hours worked by that scientist on each project, in alphabetical order of project name, and then scientist name.
scientist_1.query: SELECT T1.Name, T2.Name, T2.Hours FROM Scientists AS T1 JOIN AssignedTo AS T3 ON T1.SSN = T3.Scientist JOIN Projects AS T2 ON T3.Project = T2.Code ORDER BY T2.Name, T1.Name

scientist_1.question: What are the names of each scientist, the names of the projects that they work on, and the hours for each of those projects, listed in alphabetical order by project name, then scientist name.
scientist_1.query: SELECT t1.Name AS ScientistName, t2.Name AS ProjectName, t2.Hours FROM Scientists AS t1 JOIN AssignedTo AS t3 ON t1.SSN = t3.Scientist JOIN Projects AS t2 ON t3.Project = t2.Code ORDER BY t2.Name, t1.Name

scientist_1.question: Find name of the project that needs the least amount of time to finish and the name of scientists who worked on it.
scientist_1.query: SELECT t2.name, t1.name FROM scientists AS t1 JOIN assignedto AS t3 ON t1.ssn  =  t3.scientist JOIN projects AS t2 ON t3.project  =  t2.code WHERE t2.hours  =  (SELECT min(hours) FROM projects)

scientist_1.question: What is the name of the project that requires the fewest number of hours, and the names of the scientists assigned to it?
scientist_1.query: SELECT t2.name, t1.name FROM scientists AS t1 JOIN assignedto AS t3 ON t1.ssn = t3.scientist JOIN projects AS t2 ON t3.project = t2.code WHERE t2.hours = (SELECT MIN(hours) FROM projects)

wine_1.question: What is the area for the appelation which produced the most wines prior to 2010?
wine_1.query: SELECT T3.Area FROM (SELECT T1.Appelation, COUNT(*) AS num_wines FROM wine AS T1 WHERE T1.Year < 2010 GROUP BY T1.Appelation ORDER BY num_wines DESC LIMIT 1) AS T2 JOIN appellations AS T3 ON T2.Appelation = T3.Appelation

wine_1.question: What is the color of the grape whose wine products has the highest average price?
wine_1.query: SELECT g.Color FROM grapes AS g JOIN wine AS w ON g.ID = w.Grape WHERE w.Price = (SELECT MAX(avg_price) FROM (SELECT AVG(Price) AS avg_price FROM wine GROUP BY Grape) AS temp)

wine_1.question: Give the color of the grape whose wine products have the highest average price?
wine_1.query: SELECT g.Color FROM grapes AS g JOIN wine AS w ON g.ID = w.Grape GROUP BY g.Color ORDER BY AVG(w.Price) DESC LIMIT 1

wine_1.question: Find the top 3 wineries with the greatest number of wines made of white color grapes.
wine_1.query: SELECT t3.Winery, COUNT(*) AS num_of_wines FROM wine AS t1 JOIN grapes AS t2 ON t1.Grape = t2.Grape WHERE t2.Color = 'white' GROUP BY t3.Winery ORDER BY num_of_wines DESC LIMIT 3

wine_1.question: List the grape, appelation and name of wines whose score is higher than 93 ordered by Name.
wine_1.query: SELECT t1.Grape, t2.Appelation, t3.Name FROM grapes AS t1 JOIN wine AS t3 ON t1.Grape  =  t3.Grape JOIN appellations AS t2 ON t3.Appelation  =  t2.Appelation WHERE t3.Score > 93 ORDER BY t3.Name ASC

wine_1.question: What are the grapes, appelations, and wines with scores above 93, sorted by Name?
wine_1.query: SELECT t1.Grape, t2.Appelation, t3.Name FROM grapes AS t1 JOIN appellations AS t2 ON t1.ID  =  t2.No JOIN wine AS t3 ON t1.Grape  =  t3.Grape AND t2.Appelation  =  t3.Appelation WHERE t3.Score > 93 ORDER BY t3.Name

wine_1.question: Find the appelations that produce wines after the year of 2008 but not in Central Coast area.

train_station.question: How many train stations are there?
train_station.query: SELECT count(*) FROM station

train_station.question: Show the name, location, and number of platforms for all stations.
train_station.query: SELECT Name, Location, Number_of_Platforms FROM station

train_station.question: What are all locations of train stations?
train_station.query: SELECT DISTINCT Location FROM station

train_station.question: Show the names and total passengers for all train stations not in London.
train_station.query: SELECT t1.Name ,  t1.Total_Passengers FROM station AS t1 JOIN train_station AS t2 ON t1.Station_ID  =  t2.Station_ID JOIN train AS t3 ON t2.Train_ID  =  t3.Train_ID WHERE t1.Location NOT LIKE "%London%"

train_station.question: Show the names and main services for train stations that have the top three total number of passengers.
train_station.query: SELECT t1.Name ,  t1.Main_Services FROM station AS t1 JOIN (SELECT Station_ID, SUM(Total_Passengers) AS Total_Passengers FROM station GROUP BY Station_ID ORDER BY Total_Passengers DESC LIMIT 3) AS t2 ON t1.Station_ID  =  t2.Station_ID ORDER BY t2.Total_Passengers DESC

train_station.question: What is the average and maximum number of total passengers for train stations in London or Glasgow?
train_station.query: SELECT AVG(Total_Passengers), MAX(Total_Passengers) FROM station WHERE Location IN ('London', 'Glasgow')

train_station.question: Show all locations and the total number of platforms and passengers for all train stations in each location.
train_station.query: SELECT location, SUM(number_of_platforms), SUM(total_passengers) FROM station GROUP BY location

train_station.question: Show all locations that have train stations with at least 15 platforms and train stations with more than 25 total passengers.
train_station.query: SELECT DISTINCT s1.Location FROM station AS s1 JOIN train_station AS ts1 ON s1.Station_ID = ts1.Station_ID WHERE s1.Number_of_Platforms >= 15 AND s1.Total_Passengers > 25 AND ts1.Train_ID IN (SELECT ts2.Train_ID FROM train_station AS ts2 JOIN station AS s2 ON ts2.Station_ID = s2.Station_ID WHERE s2.Total_Passengers > 25)

train_station.question: Show all locations which don't have a train station with at least 15 platforms.
train_station.query: SELECT DISTINCT Location FROM station WHERE Location NOT IN (SELECT Location FROM station WHERE Number_of_Platforms >= 15 AND Station_ID IN (SELECT Station_ID FROM train_station))

train_station.question: Show the location with most number of train stations.
train_station.query: SELECT t1.Location FROM station AS t1 JOIN train_station AS t2 ON t1.Station_ID = t2.Station_ID GROUP BY t1.Location ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT t2.Train_ID) DESC LIMIT 1

train_station.question: Show the name, time, and service for all trains.
train_station.query: SELECT Name, Time, Service FROM train

train_station.question: Show the number of trains
train_station.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM train

train_station.question: Show the name and service for all trains in order by time.
train_station.query: SELECT Name, Service FROM train ORDER BY Time

train_station.question: Show the station name and number of trains in each station.
train_station.query: SELECT t1.Name ,  COUNT(t2.Train_ID) FROM station AS t1 LEFT JOIN train_station AS t2 ON t1.Station_ID  =  t2.Station_ID GROUP BY t1.Station_ID

train_station.question: show the train name and station name for each train.
train_station.query: SELECT t2.Name AS Train_Name, t1.Name AS Station_Name FROM station AS t1 JOIN train_station AS t3 ON t1.Station_ID = t3.Station_ID JOIN train AS t2 ON t3.Train_ID = t2.Train_ID

train_station.question: Show all train names and times in stations in London in descending order by train time.
train_station.query: SELECT t2.Name, t2.Time FROM station AS t1 JOIN train_station AS t3 ON t1.Station_ID = t3.Station_ID JOIN train AS t2 ON t3.Train_ID = t2.Train_ID WHERE t1.Location = "London" ORDER BY t2.Time DESC

train_station.question: Show the station name with greatest number of trains.
train_station.query: SELECT t1.Name FROM station AS t1 JOIN train_station AS t2 ON t1.Station_ID  =  t2.Station_ID GROUP BY t2.Station_ID ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

train_station.question: Show the station name with at least two trains.
train_station.query: SELECT t1.Name FROM station AS t1 JOIN train_station AS t2 ON t1.Station_ID = t2.Station_ID GROUP BY t2.Station_ID HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2

train_station.question: Show all locations with only 1 station.
train_station.query: SELECT Location FROM station GROUP BY Location HAVING COUNT(*) = 1

train_station.question: Show station names without any trains.
train_station.query: SELECT Name FROM station WHERE Station_ID NOT IN (SELECT Station_ID FROM train_station)

train_station.question: What are the names of the stations which serve both "Ananthapuri Express" and "Guruvayur Express" trains?
train_station.query: SELECT s.Name FROM station AS s JOIN train_station AS ts1 ON s.Station_ID = ts1.Station_ID JOIN train AS t1 ON ts1.Train_ID = t1.Train_ID JOIN train_station AS ts2 ON s.Station_ID = ts2.Station_ID JOIN train AS t2 ON ts2.Train_ID = t2.Train_ID WHERE t1.Name = "Ananthapuri Express" AND t2.Name = "Guruvayur Express"

train_station.question: Find the names of the trains that do not pass any station located in London.
train_station.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.Name FROM train AS t1 LEFT JOIN train_station AS t2 ON t1.Train_ID = t2.Train_ID LEFT JOIN station AS t3 ON t2.Station_ID = t3.Station_ID WHERE t3.Location != "London" OR t3.Location IS NULL

train_station.question: List the names and locations of all stations ordered by their yearly entry exit and interchange amounts.
train_station.query: SELECT Name, Location FROM station ORDER BY Annual_entry_exit + Annual_interchanges DESC

activity_1.query: SELECT t2.facid, count(t1.stuid) FROM student AS t1 JOIN participates_in AS t3 ON t1.stuid = t3.stuid JOIN activity AS t4 ON t3.actid = t4.actid JOIN faculty_participates_in AS t2 ON t4.actid = t2.actid GROUP BY t2.facid

activity_1.question: Give me the the first and last name of the faculty who advises the most students.
activity_1.query: SELECT t4.fname, t4.lname FROM faculty AS t4 JOIN student AS t1 ON t4.facid = t1.advisor JOIN participates_in AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid GROUP BY t4.facid ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

activity_1.question: Show the ids for all the faculty members who have at least 2 students.

activity_1.question: Which faculty members advise two ore more students? Give me their faculty ids.

activity_1.question: What are ids of the faculty members who not only participate in an activity but also advise a student.
activity_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t2.FacID FROM Faculty_Participates_in AS t1 JOIN Participates_in AS t2 ON t1.actid  =  t2.actid JOIN Student AS t3 ON t2.stuid  =  t3.StuID WHERE t3.Advisor  =  t2.stuid

activity_1.question: How many activities does Mark Giuliano participate in?
activity_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM participates_in AS t1 JOIN student AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid JOIN activity AS t3 ON t1.actid = t3.actid WHERE t2.fname = "Mark" AND t2.lname = "Giuliano"

activity_1.question: Find the number of activities Mark Giuliano is involved in.
activity_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Participates_in AS t1 JOIN Student AS t2 ON t1.stuid  =  t2.stuid JOIN Activity AS t3 ON t1.actid  =  t3.actid WHERE t2.fname  =  "Mark" AND t2.lname  =  "Giuliano"

activity_1.question: Show the names of all the activities Mark Giuliano participates in.
activity_1.query: SELECT t1.activity_name FROM activity AS t1 JOIN participates_in AS t2 ON t1.actid  =  t2.actid JOIN student AS t3 ON t2.stuid  =  t3.stuid WHERE t3.fname  =  "Mark" AND t3.lname  =  "Giuliano"

activity_1.question: What are the names of the activities Mark Giuliano is involved in
activity_1.query: SELECT t1.activity_name FROM activity AS t1 JOIN participates_in AS t2 ON t1.actid  =  t2.actid JOIN student AS t3 ON t2.stuid  =  t3.stuid WHERE t3.fname  =  "Mark" AND t3.lname  =  "Giuliano"

activity_1.question: Show the first and last name of all the faculty members who participated in some activity, together with the number of activities they participated in.
activity_1.query: SELECT t2.fname, t2.lname, COUNT(*) AS num_activities FROM faculty_participates_in AS t1 JOIN faculty AS t2 ON t1.facid = t2.facid GROUP BY t1.facid

activity_1.question: What is the first and last name of the faculty members who participated in at least one activity? For each of them, also show the number of activities they participated in.
activity_1.query: SELECT t4.fname ,  t4.lname ,  count(*) FROM faculty_participates_in AS t1 JOIN activity AS t2 ON t1.actid  =  t2.actid JOIN faculty AS t4 ON t1.facid  =  t4.facid GROUP BY t4.facid

activity_1.question: Show all the activity names and the number of faculty involved in each activity.
activity_1.query: SELECT t1.activity_name, count(*) FROM activity AS t1 JOIN faculty_participates_in AS t2 ON t1.actid = t2.actid GROUP BY t1.activity_name

activity_1.question: How many faculty members participate in each activity? Return the activity names and the number of faculty members.
activity_1.query: SELECT activity.activity_name, count(*) FROM activity JOIN faculty_participates_in ON activity.actid = faculty_participates_in.actid GROUP BY activity.activity_name

activity_1.question: What is the first and last name of the faculty participating in the most activities?
activity_1.query: SELECT T2.Fname ,  T2.Lname FROM Faculty_Participates_in AS T1 JOIN Faculty AS T2 ON T1.FacID  =  T2.FacID GROUP BY T1.FacID ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

activity_1.question: Find the first and last name of the faculty who is involved in the largest number of activities.
activity_1.query: SELECT t4.fname, t4.lname FROM faculty AS t4 JOIN faculty_participates_in AS t3 ON t4.facid  =  t3.facid GROUP BY t4.facid ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

activity_1.question: What is the name of the activity that has the most faculty members involved in?
activity_1.query: SELECT t1.activity_name FROM activity AS t1 JOIN faculty_participates_in AS t2 ON t1.actid  =  t2.actid GROUP BY t1.activity_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

activity_1.question: Which activity has the most faculty members participating in? Find the activity name.
activity_1.query: SELECT t1.activity_name FROM activity AS t1 JOIN faculty_participates_in AS t2 ON t1.actid  =  t2.actid GROUP BY t1.activity_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

activity_1.question: Show the ids of the students who don't participate in any activity.
activity_1.query: SELECT Student.StuID FROM Student LEFT JOIN Participates_in ON Student.StuID = Participates_in.stuid WHERE Participates_in.stuid IS NULL

activity_1.question: What are the ids of the students who are not involved in any activity
activity_1.query: SELECT StuID FROM Student WHERE StuID NOT IN (SELECT StuID FROM Participates_in)

activity_1.question: Show the ids for all the students who participate in an activity and are under 20.
activity_1.query: SELECT stuid FROM participates_in AS t1 JOIN student AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid WHERE t2.age < 20

activity_1.question: What are the ids of the students who are under 20 years old and are involved in at least one activity.
activity_1.query: SELECT StuID FROM Student WHERE Age < 20 AND StuID IN (SELECT stuid FROM Participates_in)

activity_1.question: What is the first and last name of the student participating in the most activities?
activity_1.query: SELECT T3.fname, T3.lname FROM Participates_in AS T1 JOIN Student AS T3 ON T1.stuid = T3.StuID GROUP BY T1.stuid ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

activity_1.question: Tell me the first and last name of the student who has the most activities.
activity_1.query: SELECT T3.Fname, T3.Lname FROM Participates_in AS T1 JOIN Student AS T3 ON T1.StuID = T3.StuID GROUP BY T1.StuID ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

activity_1.question: What is the name of the activity with the most students?
activity_1.query: SELECT t1.activity_name FROM activity AS t1 JOIN participates_in AS t2 ON t1.actid = t2.actid GROUP BY t1.activity_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

activity_1.question: Find the name of the activity that has the largest number of student participants.
activity_1.query: SELECT t1.activity_name FROM activity AS t1 JOIN participates_in AS t2 ON t1.actid = t2.actid WHERE t2.stuid IN (SELECT stuid FROM student) GROUP BY t1.activity_name ORDER BY count(DISTINCT t2.stuid) DESC LIMIT 1

activity_1.question: Find the first names of the faculty members who are playing Canoeing or Kayaking.
activity_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t5.fname FROM Faculty_Participates_in AS t1 JOIN Activity AS t2 ON t1.actid  =  t2.actid JOIN Faculty AS t5 ON t1.facid  =  t5.facid WHERE t2.activity_name  =  "Canoeing" OR t2.activity_name  =  "Kayaking"

activity_1.question: Which faculty members are playing either Canoeing or Kayaking? Tell me their first names.
activity_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t5.fname FROM Faculty_Participates_in AS t1 JOIN Activity AS t2 ON t1.actid  =  t2.actid JOIN Faculty AS t5 ON t1.facid  =  t5.facid WHERE t2.activity_name  =  "Canoeing" OR t2.activity_name  =  "Kayaking"

activity_1.question: Find the first names of professors who are not playing Canoeing or Kayaking.
activity_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t2.fname FROM faculty AS t2 LEFT JOIN faculty_participates_in AS t1 ON t2.facid  =  t1.facid LEFT JOIN activity AS t3 ON t1.actid  =  t3.actid WHERE t3.activity_name NOT IN ("Canoeing", "Kayaking") AND t2.fname IS NOT NULL

activity_1.question: What are the first names of the professors who do not play Canoeing or Kayaking as activities?
activity_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t4.fname FROM faculty AS t4 WHERE t4.facid NOT IN (SELECT t3.facid FROM faculty_participates_in AS t1 JOIN activity AS t2 ON t1.actid = t2.actid JOIN participates_in AS t3 ON t2.actid = t3.actid WHERE t2.activity_name = "Canoeing" OR t2.activity_name = "Kayaking")

activity_1.question: Find the first names of the faculty members who participate in Canoeing and Kayaking.
activity_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t5.fname FROM Activity AS t1 JOIN Faculty_Participates_in AS t2 ON t1.actid  =  t2.actid JOIN Faculty AS t5 ON t2.facid  =  t5.facid WHERE t1.activity_name  =  "Canoeing" OR t1.activity_name  =  "Kayaking"

activity_1.question: What are the first names of the faculty members playing both Canoeing and Kayaking?
activity_1.query: SELECT Fname FROM Faculty WHERE FacID IN (SELECT FacID FROM Faculty_Participates_in WHERE actid  =  (SELECT actid FROM Activity WHERE activity_name  =  "Canoeing") INTERSECT SELECT FacID FROM Faculty_Participates_in WHERE actid  =  (SELECT actid FROM Activity WHERE activity_name  =  "Kayaking"))

activity_1.question: Find the ids of the students who participate in Canoeing and Kayaking.
activity_1.query: SELECT stuid FROM Participates_in WHERE actid IN (SELECT actid FROM Activity WHERE activity_name IN ('Canoeing', 'Kayaking')) GROUP BY stuid HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT actid) = 2

activity_1.question: Which students participate in both Canoeing and Kayaking as their activities? Tell me their student ids.
activity_1.query: SELECT t1.stuid FROM participates_in AS t1 JOIN activity AS t2 ON t1.actid  =  t2.actid WHERE t2.activity_name  =  "Canoeing" AND t1.stuid IN (SELECT stuid FROM participates_in WHERE actid IN (SELECT actid FROM activity WHERE activity_name  =  "Kayaking")) GROUP BY t1.stuid HAVING count(*) = 2

flight_4.question: Find the name and city of the airport which is the destination of the most number of routes.

flight_4.question: What is the name and city of the airport that the most routes end at?

flight_4.question: Find the names of the top 10 airlines that operate the most number of routes.
flight_4.query: SELECT T3.name, count(*) AS num_routes FROM routes AS T1 JOIN airlines AS T3 ON T1.alid = T3.alid GROUP BY T3.name ORDER BY num_routes DESC LIMIT 10

flight_4.question: For the airline ids with the top 10 most routes operated, what are their names?
flight_4.query: SELECT T1.alid, T2.name FROM routes AS T1 JOIN airlines AS T2 ON T1.alid = T2.alid GROUP BY T1.alid ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 10

flight_4.question: Find the name and city of the airport which is the source for the most number of flight routes.
flight_4.query: SELECT T2.name, T2.city FROM routes AS T1 JOIN airports AS T2 ON T1.src_apid = T2.apid GROUP BY T1.src_apid ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

flight_4.question: What is the name and city of the airport from most of the routes start?
flight_4.query: SELECT name, city FROM airports WHERE apid IN (SELECT src_apid FROM routes GROUP BY src_apid ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1)

flight_4.question: Find the number of different airports which are the destinations of the American Airlines.
flight_4.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT dst_apid) FROM routes WHERE alid = (SELECT alid FROM airlines WHERE name = 'American Airlines')

flight_4.question: What is the number of different different airports that are destinations for American Airlines?
flight_4.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT dst_apid) FROM routes WHERE alid = (SELECT alid FROM airlines WHERE name = 'American Airlines')

flight_4.question: Which countries has the most number of airlines?
flight_4.query: SELECT T3.country, count(*) FROM routes AS T1 JOIN airlines AS T2 ON T1.alid = T2.alid JOIN airports AS T3 ON T1.src_apid = T3.apid GROUP BY T3.country ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

flight_4.question: What is the name of the country with the most number of home airlines?
flight_4.query: SELECT T3.country FROM airlines AS T1 JOIN routes AS T2 ON T1.alid  =  T2.alid JOIN airports AS T3 ON T2.src_apid  =  T3.apid WHERE T1.country  =  T3.country GROUP BY T3.country ORDER BY count(DISTINCT T1.alid) DESC LIMIT 1

flight_4.question: Which countries has the most number of airlines whose active status is 'Y'?
flight_4.query: SELECT T1.country, COUNT(*) FROM airlines AS T1 WHERE T1.active = 'Y' GROUP BY T1.country ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

flight_4.question: What are the countries with the most airlines whose active status is Y?
flight_4.query: SELECT T1.country, COUNT(*) FROM airlines AS T1 WHERE T1.active = 'Y' GROUP BY T1.country ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC

flight_4.question: List all countries and their number of airlines in the descending order of number of airlines.
flight_4.query: SELECT country, COUNT(DISTINCT alid) AS num_airlines FROM airlines GROUP BY country ORDER BY num_airlines DESC

flight_4.question: How many airlines operate out of each country in descending order?
flight_4.query: SELECT airports.country, COUNT(DISTINCT airlines.alid) AS num_airlines FROM routes JOIN airports ON routes.src_apid = airports.apid JOIN airlines ON routes.alid = airlines.alid GROUP BY airports.country ORDER BY num_airlines DESC

flight_4.question: How many airports are there per country? Order the countries by decreasing number of airports.
flight_4.query: SELECT country, COUNT(*) AS num_airports FROM airports GROUP BY country ORDER BY num_airports DESC

flight_4.question: What is the number of airports per country, ordered from most to least?
flight_4.query: SELECT country, COUNT(DISTINCT apid) AS num_airports FROM airports GROUP BY country ORDER BY num_airports DESC

flight_4.question: How many airports are there per city in the United States? Order the cities by decreasing number of airports.
flight_4.query: SELECT city, COUNT(DISTINCT apid) AS num_airports FROM airports WHERE country = 'United States' GROUP BY city ORDER BY num_airports DESC

flight_4.question: How many airports are there per city in the US ordered from most to least?
flight_4.query: SELECT city, COUNT(DISTINCT apid) AS num_airports FROM airports WHERE country = 'US' GROUP BY city ORDER BY num_airports DESC

flight_4.question: Return the cities with more than 3 airports in the United States.
flight_4.query: SELECT city FROM airports WHERE country  =  'United States' GROUP BY city HAVING count(*)  >  3

flight_4.question: What is the number of cities in the United States with more than 3 airports?
flight_4.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT airports.city) FROM airports JOIN routes ON airports.apid = routes.src_apid OR airports.apid = routes.dst_apid WHERE airports.country = 'United States' GROUP BY airports.city HAVING count(DISTINCT airports.apid) > 3

flight_4.question: How many cities are there that have more than 3 airports?
flight_4.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT city) FROM airports GROUP BY city HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT apid) > 3

flight_4.question: What is the count of cities with more than 3 airports?
flight_4.query: SELECT count(*) FROM (SELECT city FROM airports GROUP BY city HAVING count(*) > 3) AS T1

flight_4.question: List the cities which have more than one airport and number of airports.
flight_4.query: SELECT city, COUNT(*) AS num_airports FROM airports GROUP BY city HAVING num_airports > 1

flight_4.question: What are the names of all cities with more than one airport and how many airports do they have?
flight_4.query: SELECT city, COUNT(*) AS num_airports FROM airports GROUP BY city HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

flight_4.question: List the cities which have more than 2 airports sorted by the number of airports.
flight_4.query: SELECT city, COUNT(*) AS num_airports FROM airports GROUP BY city HAVING num_airports > 2 ORDER BY num_airports DESC

flight_4.question: What are the cities that have more than 2 airports sorted by number of airports?
flight_4.query: SELECT city, COUNT(*) AS num_airports FROM airports GROUP BY city HAVING num_airports > 2 ORDER BY num_airports ASC

flight_4.question: Find the number of routes for each source airport and the airport name.

flight_4.question: For each airport name, how many routes start at that airport?

flight_4.question: Find the number of routes and airport name for each source airport, order the results by decreasing number of routes.
flight_4.query: SELECT src_apid, airports.name, COUNT(*) AS num_routes FROM routes JOIN airports ON routes.src_apid = airports.apid GROUP BY src_apid, airports.name ORDER BY num_routes DESC

flight_4.question: For each  airport name, how many routes start at that airport, ordered from most to least?
flight_4.query: SELECT src_ap, count(*) FROM routes GROUP BY src_ap ORDER BY count(*) DESC

flight_4.query: SELECT AVG(elevation), country FROM airports GROUP BY country

flight_4.question: For each country, what is the average elevation of that country's airports?

flight_4.question: What are the cities with exactly two airports?

flight_4.question: For each country and airline name, how many routes are there?
flight_4.query: SELECT airports.country, airlines.name, count(*) FROM routes JOIN airports ON routes.src_apid = airports.apid JOIN airlines ON routes.alid = airlines.alid GROUP BY airports.country, airlines.name

flight_4.question: What is the total number of routes for each country and airline in that country?
flight_4.query: SELECT airports.country, airlines.name, count(*) FROM routes JOIN airports ON routes.src_apid = airports.apid JOIN airlines ON routes.alid = airlines.alid GROUP BY airports.country, airlines.name

flight_4.question: What is the number of routes operated by the airline American Airlines whose destinations are in Italy?

flight_4.question: How many routes go from the United States to Canada?
flight_4.query: SELECT count(*) FROM routes WHERE src_apid IN (SELECT apid FROM airports WHERE country = 'United States') AND dst_apid IN (SELECT apid FROM airports WHERE country = 'Canada')

flight_4.question: Find the id of routes whose source and destination airports are in the United States.
flight_4.query: SELECT rid FROM routes AS T1 JOIN airports AS T2 ON T1.src_apid  =  T2.apid JOIN airports AS T3 ON T1.dst_apid  =  T3.apid WHERE T2.country  =  "United States" AND T3.country  =  "United States"

flight_4.question: What is the id of the routes whose source and destination airports are in the United States?

flight_4.question: Find the name of airline which runs the most number of routes.
flight_4.query: SELECT T2.name FROM routes AS T1 JOIN airlines AS T2 ON T1.alid = T2.alid GROUP BY T1.alid ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

flight_4.question: What is the name of the airline with the most routes?
flight_4.query: SELECT T2.name FROM airlines AS T2 JOIN routes AS T1 ON T1.alid = T2.alid GROUP BY T2.alid ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

flight_4.question: Find the busiest source airport that runs most number of routes in China.
flight_4.query: SELECT T1.src_ap, count(*) FROM routes AS T1 JOIN airports AS T2 ON T1.src_apid = T2.apid WHERE T2.country = "China" GROUP BY T1.src_ap ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

flight_4.question: What is the name of the airport with the most number of routes that start in China?
flight_4.query: SELECT T2.name FROM airports AS T2 JOIN routes AS T1 ON T1.src_apid = T2.apid WHERE T2.country = 'China' GROUP BY T2.apid ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

flight_4.question: Find the busiest destination airport that runs most number of routes in China.
flight_4.query: SELECT T1.name, COUNT(*) AS num_routes FROM airports AS T1 JOIN routes AS T2 ON T1.apid = T2.dst_apid JOIN airlines AS T3 ON T2.alid = T3.alid WHERE T1.country = 'China' GROUP BY T1.apid ORDER BY num_routes DESC LIMIT 1

flight_4.question: What is the name of the airport that is the destination of the most number of routes that start in China?
flight_4.query: SELECT T2.name FROM airports AS T1 JOIN routes AS T3 ON T1.apid = T3.dst_apid JOIN airports AS T2 ON T3.src_apid = T2.apid JOIN airlines AS T4 ON T3.alid = T4.alid WHERE T1.country = 'China' GROUP BY T3.dst_apid ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_orders.question: Find the id of the order whose shipment tracking number is "3452".
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.order_id FROM orders AS t1 JOIN shipments AS t2 ON t1.order_id = t2.order_id WHERE t2.shipment_tracking_number = "3452"

tracking_orders.question: Which order's shipment tracking number is "3452"? Give me the id of the order.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.order_id FROM orders AS t1 JOIN shipments AS t2 ON t1.order_id = t2.order_id WHERE t2.shipment_tracking_number = "3452"

tracking_orders.question: Find the ids of all the order items whose product id is 11.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT order_item_id FROM order_items WHERE product_id = 11

tracking_orders.question: Find all the order items whose product id is 11. What are the order item ids?
tracking_orders.query: SELECT order_item_id FROM order_items WHERE product_id = 11

tracking_orders.question: List the name of all the distinct customers who have orders with status "Packing".
tracking_orders.query: SELECT DISTINCT customer_name FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id WHERE order_status = "Packing"

tracking_orders.question: Which customers have orders with status "Packing"? Give me the customer names.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN orders AS t2 ON t1.customer_id = t2.customer_id WHERE t2.order_status = "Packing"

tracking_orders.question: Find the details of all the distinct customers who have orders with status "On Road".
tracking_orders.query: SELECT DISTINCT c.customer_id, c.customer_name, c.customer_details FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id WHERE o.order_status = 'On Road'

tracking_orders.question: What are the distinct customers who have orders with status "On Road"? Give me the customer details?
tracking_orders.query: SELECT DISTINCT c.* FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id WHERE o.order_status = "On Road"

tracking_orders.question: What is the name of the customer who has the most orders?
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN orders AS t2 ON t1.customer_id = t2.customer_id GROUP BY t1.customer_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_orders.question: What is the customer id of the customer who has the most orders?
tracking_orders.query: SELECT customer_id FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_orders.question: Find the id of the customer who made the most orders.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT customer_id FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_orders.question: Give me a list of id and status of orders which belong to the customer named "Jeramie".
tracking_orders.query: SELECT order_id, order_status FROM orders WHERE customer_id = (SELECT customer_id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'Jeramie')

tracking_orders.question: Which orders are made by the customer named "Jeramie"? Give me the order ids and status.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT order_id, order_status FROM orders WHERE customer_id = (SELECT customer_id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'Jeramie')

tracking_orders.question: Find the dates of orders which belong to the customer named "Jeramie".
tracking_orders.query: SELECT date_order_placed FROM orders JOIN customers ON orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id WHERE customers.customer_name = "Jeramie"

tracking_orders.question: What are the dates of the orders made by the customer named "Jeramie"?
tracking_orders.query: SELECT date_order_placed FROM orders AS t1 JOIN customers AS t2 ON t1.customer_id = t2.customer_id WHERE t2.customer_name = "Jeramie"

tracking_orders.question: Give me the names of customers who have placed orders between 2009-01-01 and 2010-01-01.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT DISTINCT customer_name FROM customers AS c JOIN orders AS o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id WHERE o.date_order_placed BETWEEN '2009-01-01' AND '2010-01-01'

tracking_orders.question: Which customers made orders between 2009-01-01 and 2010-01-01? Find their names.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN orders AS t2 ON t1.customer_id = t2.customer_id WHERE t2.date_order_placed BETWEEN '2009-01-01' AND '2010-01-01'

tracking_orders.question: Give me a list of distinct product ids from orders placed between 1975-01-01 and 1976-01-01?
tracking_orders.query: SELECT DISTINCT t3.product_id FROM orders AS t1 JOIN order_items AS t3 ON t1.order_id = t3.order_id WHERE t1.date_order_placed BETWEEN '1975-01-01' AND '1976-01-01'

tracking_orders.question: What are the distinct ids of products ordered between 1975-01-01 and 1976-01-01??
tracking_orders.query: SELECT DISTINCT t4.product_id FROM orders AS t1 JOIN order_items AS t2 ON t1.order_id  =  t2.order_id JOIN products AS t4 ON t2.product_id  =  t4.product_id WHERE t1.date_order_placed BETWEEN '1975-01-01' AND '1976-01-01'

tracking_orders.question: Find the names of the customers who have order status both "On Road" and "Shipped".
tracking_orders.query: SELECT DISTINCT c.customer_name FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id JOIN order_items oi ON o.order_id = oi.order_id JOIN shipments s ON o.order_id = s.order_id WHERE o.order_status = 'On Road' AND s.shipment_id IN (SELECT shipment_id FROM shipment_items WHERE order_item_id IN (SELECT order_item_id FROM order_items WHERE order_status = 'Shipped'))

tracking_orders.question: Which customers have both "On Road" and "Shipped" as order status? List the customer names.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN orders AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id WHERE order_status  =  "On Road" AND t1.customer_id IN (SELECT t1.customer_id FROM customers AS t1 JOIN orders AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id WHERE order_status  =  "Shipped")

tracking_orders.question: Find the id of the customers who have order status both "On Road" and "Shipped".
tracking_orders.query: SELECT customer_id FROM orders WHERE order_status = 'On Road' AND customer_id IN (SELECT customer_id FROM orders WHERE order_status = 'Shipped')

tracking_orders.question: Which customers have both "On Road" and "Shipped" as order status? List the customer ids.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT customer_id FROM orders WHERE order_status IN ('On Road', 'Shipped') GROUP BY customer_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT order_status) = 2

tracking_orders.question: When was the order placed whose shipment tracking number is 3452? Give me the date.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT date_order_placed FROM orders AS t1 JOIN shipments AS t2 ON t1.order_id  =  t2.order_id WHERE t2.shipment_tracking_number  =  3452

tracking_orders.question: On which day was the order placed whose shipment tracking number is 3452?
tracking_orders.query: SELECT date_order_placed FROM orders JOIN shipments ON orders.order_id = shipments.order_id WHERE shipment_tracking_number = 3452

tracking_orders.query: SELECT date_order_placed FROM orders AS t1 JOIN shipments AS t2 ON t1.order_id = t2.order_id JOIN invoices AS t3 ON t2.invoice_number = t3.invoice_number WHERE t3.invoice_number = 10

tracking_orders.question: On what day was the order with invoice number 10 placed?
tracking_orders.query: SELECT date_order_placed FROM orders JOIN invoices ON orders.order_id = invoices.invoice_number WHERE invoices.invoice_number = 10

tracking_orders.question: List the count and id of each product in all the orders.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.product_id, COUNT(*) FROM order_items AS t1 JOIN orders AS t2 ON t1.order_id = t2.order_id GROUP BY t1.product_id

tracking_orders.question: For each product, return its id and the number of times it was ordered.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.product_id, COUNT(t2.order_item_id) AS num_orders FROM products AS t1 JOIN order_items AS t2 ON t1.product_id = t2.product_id GROUP BY t1.product_id

tracking_orders.question: List the name and count of each product in all orders.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.product_name, COUNT(*) FROM products AS t1 JOIN order_items AS t2 ON t1.product_id = t2.product_id GROUP BY t1.product_name

tracking_orders.question: For each product, show its name and the number of times it was ordered.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.product_name, COUNT(*) FROM products AS t1 JOIN order_items AS t2 ON t1.product_id = t2.product_id GROUP BY t1.product_id

tracking_orders.question: Find the ids of orders which are shipped after 2000-01-01.

tracking_orders.question: Which orders have shipment after 2000-01-01? Give me the order ids.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.order_id FROM orders AS t1 JOIN shipments AS t2 ON t1.order_id = t2.order_id WHERE t2.shipment_date > '2000-01-01'

tracking_orders.question: Find the id of the order which is shipped most recently.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.order_id FROM orders AS t1 JOIN shipments AS t2 ON t1.order_id  =  t2.order_id ORDER BY t2.shipment_date DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_orders.question: Which order has the most recent shipment? Give me the order id.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.order_id FROM orders AS t1 JOIN shipments AS t2 ON t1.order_id = t2.order_id ORDER BY t2.shipment_date DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_orders.query: SELECT DISTINCT product_name FROM products ORDER BY product_name ASC

tracking_orders.question: Sort all the distinct products in alphabetical order.

tracking_orders.question: What is the id of the order which has the most items?
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.order_id FROM orders AS t1 JOIN order_items AS t2 ON t1.order_id = t2.order_id GROUP BY t1.order_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_orders.question: Which order deals with the most items? Return the order id.
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.order_id FROM orders AS t1 JOIN order_items AS t2 ON t1.order_id = t2.order_id GROUP BY t1.order_id ORDER BY sum(t2.order_quantity) DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_orders.question: What is the name of the customer who has the largest number of orders?
tracking_orders.query: SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN orders AS t2 ON t1.customer_id = t2.customer_id GROUP BY t2.customer_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

tracking_orders.question: Find the invoice numbers which are created before 1989-09-03 or after 2007-12-25.

tracking_orders.question: What are the invoice numbers created before 1989-09-03 or after 2007-12-25?
tracking_orders.query: SELECT invoice_number FROM invoices WHERE invoice_date < '1989-09-03' OR invoice_date > '2007-12-25'

tracking_orders.question: Find the distinct details of invoices which are created before 1989-09-03 or after 2007-12-25.
